prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: condensation (www.nationalgeographic.org)
Content: Condensation is the process where water vapor becomes liquid. It is the reverse of evaporation, where liquid water becomes a vapor.


Condensation happens one of two ways: Either the air is cooled to its dew point or it becomes so saturate d with water vapor that it cannot hold any more water.


Dew Point


Dew point is the temperature at which condensation happens. (Dew is simply condensed water in the atmosphere.) Air temperatures can reach or fall below the dew point naturally, as they often do at night. Thats why lawns, cars, and houses are often coated with water droplets in the morning.


Condensation can also produce water droplets on the outside of soda cans or glasses of cold water. When warm air hits the cold surface, it reaches its dew point and condenses. This leaves droplets of water on the glass or can.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: UCSB Science Line (scienceline.ucsb.edu)
Content: The drops of water on the outside of a cold cup come from the air.Believe it or not, there is a significant amount of water vapor in the air that we breathe. This is why we have humidity. A cold cup can take thermal energy out of the water vapor in the air next to the cup, causing the water vapor to condense into liquid water. The same kind of phenomena occurs when you take ice cream out of the freezer - you see frost on the outside of the container. In this case the cup (or ice cream container) is below the freezing point of water. Therefore, the water vapor from the air will freeze when it comes in contact with the container, forming a layer of frost.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Steamy Science: Demonstrating Condensation (www.scientificamerican.com)
Content: Ever wonder where those little drops of water on the outside of your cold can of soda pop or bottle of water come from? That’s condensation! Cold surfaces can cause water vapor in the air to cool down, condense and form tiny beads of liquid. The molecules in these miniscule droplets of water are grouped far more closely together than when they were in their gas phase, and exert less pressure—a fact that has some pretty cool physical implications.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Why does Milk Form a Skin When It is Heated? (with pictures) (www.delightedcooking.com)
Content: Milk forms a skin on top when heated because of a chemical reaction that affects how protein and fat molecules interact with each other. When milk is heated rapidly, some of the water in it evaporates from the surface. This exposes proteins and fat molecules, which bind and dry out as warming continues. Skin most commonly forms when milk is heated over a stove top, as stoves are generally capable of reaching very high temperatures quite quickly, though it can happen in the microwave as well. The film is not harmful, but is distasteful to many and can be prevented with constant stirring and a close eye on temperature.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Why does Milk Form a Skin When It is Heated? (with pictures) (www.delightedcooking.com)
Content: It is often surprising to see a film or skin on nonfat or “skim” milk, since it would seem that, without fat, the proteins would have nothing to bind to. In truth, it is rare to encounter milk that is truly fat free. Most of the skim milk that is sold commercially has very low fat content, but is rarely ever truly fat-free. Even trace amounts of fat on the surface can contribute to skin formation.


A similar phenomenon happens with soy milk, which is generally marketed as fat free. Natural fats still occur in trace amounts, and can be drawn to the surface when exposed to very high temperatures. Soy film can be discarded, but is also considered a delicacy in many Asian cultures. When removed and dried, it is referred to as yuba, or soybean curd, which is used in a variety of recipes.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Milk skin (en.wikipedia.org)
Content: Milk skin or lactoderm refers to a sticky film of protein that forms on top of dairy milk and foods containing dairy milk (such as hot chocolate and some soups). Milk film can be produced both through conventional boiling and by microwaving the liquid, and as such can often be observed when heating milk for use in drinks such as drinking chocolate. It is caused by the denaturation of proteins such as beta-lactoglobulin (whey protein). The thickness of the skin varies dependent on a number of factors, including the temperature of the milk, the shape of the container, and the amount of milk in the container.


When milk is boiled, soluble milk proteins are denatured and then coagulate with milk's fat and form a sticky film across the top of the liquid, which then dries by evaporation. The layer does not need to be discarded and can be consumed, as protein's nutritional value is unaffected by the denaturation process. Milk film is often considered to be desirable and is used in several recipes for various foods.
---

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Why does Milk Form a Skin When It is Heated? (with pictures) (www.delightedcooking.com)
Content: Milk forms a skin on top when heated because of a chemical reaction that affects how protein and fat molecules interact with each other. When milk is heated rapidly, some of the water in it evaporates from the surface. This exposes proteins and fat molecules, which bind and dry out as warming continues. Skin most commonly forms when milk is heated over a stove top, as stoves are generally capable of reaching very high temperatures quite quickly, though it can happen in the microwave as well. The film is not harmful, but is distasteful to many and can be prevented with constant stirring and a close eye on temperature.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Why does Milk Form a Skin When It is Heated? (with pictures) (www.delightedcooking.com)
Content: It is often surprising to see a film or skin on nonfat or “skim” milk, since it would seem that, without fat, the proteins would have nothing to bind to. In truth, it is rare to encounter milk that is truly fat free. Most of the skim milk that is sold commercially has very low fat content, but is rarely ever truly fat-free. Even trace amounts of fat on the surface can contribute to skin formation.


A similar phenomenon happens with soy milk, which is generally marketed as fat free. Natural fats still occur in trace amounts, and can be drawn to the surface when exposed to very high temperatures. Soy film can be discarded, but is also considered a delicacy in many Asian cultures. When removed and dried, it is referred to as yuba, or soybean curd, which is used in a variety of recipes.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Milk skin (en.wikipedia.org)
Content: Milk skin or lactoderm refers to a sticky film of protein that forms on top of dairy milk and foods containing dairy milk (such as hot chocolate and some soups). Milk film can be produced both through conventional boiling and by microwaving the liquid, and as such can often be observed when heating milk for use in drinks such as drinking chocolate. It is caused by the denaturation of proteins such as beta-lactoglobulin (whey protein). The thickness of the skin varies dependent on a number of factors, including the temperature of the milk, the shape of the container, and the amount of milk in the container.


When milk is boiled, soluble milk proteins are denatured and then coagulate with milk's fat and form a sticky film across the top of the liquid, which then dries by evaporation. The layer does not need to be discarded and can be consumed, as protein's nutritional value is unaffected by the denaturation process. Milk film is often considered to be desirable and is used in several recipes for various foods.
---

question_src: Je! Watu wanawezaje kulala salama? Je! Kwanini watu hufanya maamuzi wanayofanya wakati wanalala?
all_claims: Ili mtu anayetembea usingizini abaki salama, ziba au ondoa vitu vikali, funga milango na madirisha, kisha ukimkuta akitembea mgeuze kwa upole na umpeleke kitandani; ikiwa anakataa, kaa karibu naye na umkinge dhidi ya hatari badala ya kumtikisa au kumwamsha ghafla, na ukilazimika kumwamsha tumia kelele kubwa, si mguso mkali [3].

Njia hizi hupunguza hatari ya kujeruhiwa kwani somnambulisti huanza kutembea katika usingizi mzito wa NREM, mara nyingi ndani ya saa 1–2 baada ya kulala, wakati macho yao yanaweza kuwa wazi lakini bado hawajitambui [2].

Hali hii hutokea kwa sababu sehemu za ubongo zinazodhibiti harakati zimeamka kidogo ilhali maeneo ya ufahamu na mantiki bado yamelala, hivyo “maamuzi” wanayofanya—kama kukaa juu au kufungua mlango—ni vitendo vya kiotomatiki visivyochujwa na ufahamu wa hatari au nia halisi [2].

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Sleepwalking - Causes, Symptoms, & Treatments - Sleep Foundation (www.sleepfoundation.org)
Content: Sleepwalking, formally known as somnambulism, is a behavior disorder that originates during deep sleep and results in walking or performing other complex behaviors while still mostly asleep. It is more common in children than adults and is more likely to occur if a person has a family history of the condition, is sleep deprived, or is prone to repeated nighttime awakenings.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Why Do People Sleepwalk? Causes, Symptoms, Dangers, More (www.healthline.com)
Content: Sleepwalking is a sleeping disturbance that occurs in the deepest part of your nonrapid eye movement (NREM) sleep. It most often occurs within 1 to 2 hours of falling asleep.


During an episode of sleepwalking, you may sit up, walk around, and even perform ordinary activities — all while sleeping. Your eyes are open, but you’re actually still in a deep state of sleep.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: 5 Steps for Stopping a Sleepwalker (www.webmd.com)
Content: Waking someone who is sleepwalking can be dangerous, but allowing a sleepwalker to roam about a room filled with sharp objects or to jump into the driver's seat of a vehicle is what's really hazardous.


The lesson: Stop sleepwalkers and get them back to bed. How? Gently turn them around and make sure they return to the bedroom safely. If they resist, stay with them and help them avoid perilous objects and situations. If you must awaken them, do so with loud noises rather than by shaking or touching them roughly.
---

Title: Sleepwalking - Causes, Symptoms, & Treatments - Sleep Foundation (www.sleepfoundation.org)
Content: Sleepwalking, formally known as somnambulism, is a behavior disorder that originates during deep sleep and results in walking or performing other complex behaviors while still mostly asleep. It is more common in children than adults and is more likely to occur if a person has a family history of the condition, is sleep deprived, or is prone to repeated nighttime awakenings.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Why Do People Sleepwalk? Causes, Symptoms, Dangers, More (www.healthline.com)
Content: Sleepwalking is a sleeping disturbance that occurs in the deepest part of your nonrapid eye movement (NREM) sleep. It most often occurs within 1 to 2 hours of falling asleep.


During an episode of sleepwalking, you may sit up, walk around, and even perform ordinary activities — all while sleeping. Your eyes are open, but you’re actually still in a deep state of sleep.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: 5 Steps for Stopping a Sleepwalker (www.webmd.com)
Content: Waking someone who is sleepwalking can be dangerous, but allowing a sleepwalker to roam about a room filled with sharp objects or to jump into the driver's seat of a vehicle is what's really hazardous.


The lesson: Stop sleepwalkers and get them back to bed. How? Gently turn them around and make sure they return to the bedroom safely. If they resist, stay with them and help them avoid perilous objects and situations. If you must awaken them, do so with loud noises rather than by shaking or touching them roughly.
---

claim: Tupac Shakur ametoa jumla ya albamu sita za solo baada ya kifo chake, si tano kama inavyodhaniwa, kutokana na hazina kubwa ya nyimbo ambazo hazikuwahi kutolewa kabla
question_src: 2Pac ina albamu kama 5 tangu kifo chake. Nini kinaendelea, nani ana haki? Inaonekana kuwa na wasanii tofauti milioni
all_claims: Tupac Shakur ametoa jumla ya albamu sita za solo baada ya kifo chake, si tano kama inavyodhaniwa, kutokana na hazina kubwa ya nyimbo ambazo hazikuwahi kutolewa kabla [2].
Mauzo ya kazi hizi yamefikia mamilioni ya nakala, yakidumisha umaarufu wake duniani [2].
Haki za muziki zimeshikiliwa na Death Row Records pamoja na Amaru Entertainment ya mama yake, Afeni Shakur, ambao wamesimamia uhariri na usambazaji wa miradi hiyo tangu 1996 [2].

Baadhi ya matoleo yamehusisha watayarishaji wapya kama Eminem na Luis Resto, waliotengeneza nyimbo 13 kati ya 17 kwenye albamu ya tano, jambo lililoibua mijadala kuhusu mabadiliko ya mtindo wa Tupac [1].
Albamu nyingine ilitolewa kama CD mara mbili miaka mitatu na nusu baada ya kupoa kwa matoleo, ikionyesha uzalishaji wa washirika wa muda mrefu kama Johnny “J,” QDIII na L.T.
Hutton, na kurejesha ladha ya nyimbo alizorekodi 1995–1996 [3].
Hivyo idadi kubwa ya wasanii na sauti tofauti hutokana na juhudi za wamiliki wa hakimiliki kuendelea kuwasilisha urithi wa Tupac na kuvutia soko jipya.

Title: What Could Be Causing Your Chronic Nausea? (www.verywellhealth.com)

question_src: Je! Ni kwanini watu wengine wanaota kwa undani na wazi wakati wengine huwa wanakumbuka yao?
all_claims: Watu wanaoota kwa undani na kuwaza ndoto zao hushawishiwa na mchanganyiko wa kibiolojia, kisaikolojia na kitabia: Kwanza, nadharia ya uchakataji kumbukumbu inaeleza kuwa ndoto hutokea wakati ubongo unapanga taarifa, hivyo watu wenye uwezo bora wa kukariri mambo kwa jumla hukumbuka ndoto kwa urahisi zaidi [1].

Pili, tafiti za picha-finyu za ubongo zinaonyesha shughuli kubwa katika makutano ya temporoparietal kwa “waotaji” wanaokumbuka ndoto nyingi, eneo linalohusishwa na uangalifu na usindikaji taarifa [2].

Tatu, watu hawa huamshwa kirahisi na vichocheo vya nje usiku, na kila mchanguko mfupi unampa ubongo nafasi ya kuhamisha ndoto kwenye kumbukumbu ya muda mrefu, tofauti na wale wasioitikia sauti au mguso [3].

Aidha, usingizi wa REM mchache kutokana na uchovu hupunguza kukumbuka ndoto, ilhali tabia za ubunifu, mawazo ya mchana na hata msongo au kiwewe huongeza uwezekano wa kuota wazi na kukumbuka yaliyoota [2].

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Why Some People Always Remember Their Dreams and Others Forget (www.healthline.com)
Content: Basically, this theory suggests that dreams occur when our brain is processing information, eliminating the unnecessary stuff and moving important short-term memories into our long-term memory. So people who recall dreams may have a difference in their ability to memorize things in general.


Beyond that, a person’s brain may actually block out a dream so we don’t remember it the following day. “The dream activity can be so real and intense that our brains actually hide, or mask away the dream, so [it doesn’t] get lost between our waking experience, and our dream lives. Thus it is normal to forget dreams, most of the time.” Dimitriu says.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Why Some People Always Remember Their Dreams and Others Forget (www.healthline.com)
Content: A study published in the journal Neuropsychopharmacology and reported by International Business Times suggested that those people who reported high dream recall had more activity in the temporoparietal junction than those who didn’t recall their dreams often.


Lambert tells Healthline that if someone consistently doesn’t get enough sleep, the amount of REM sleep they experience will drop, making it harder for them to remember their dreams the following day.


Even personality traits can be an indicator of whether someone will be able to remember their dreams.


Lambert continues: “Researchers also looked at the most common personality traits that are presented in people who can recall their dreams. Overall, such people are prone to daydreaming, creative thinking, and introspection. At the same time, those who are more practical and focused on what is outside themselves tend to have difficulty remembering their dreams.”


This may mean that some people are naturally more likely to recall their dreams than others, despite their quality of sleep.


Other factors, like stress or experiencing a trauma, can also cause people to have vivid dreams or nightmares that they’re more likely to recall the next day. For example, a person who’s coping with grief after losing a loved one may dream about the death in elaborate detail. Remembering the dream the next day may affect mood and cause even more stress or anxiety.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Do Frequent Dreams and the Ability to Recall Them Indicate Depression? - Guardian Liberty Voice (guardianlv.com)
Content: People who have the ability to recall their dreams five mornings per week, on average, have more spontaneous activity occurring in certain parts of their brains than others. The parts of the brain that host these increased levels of activity are called the temporo-parietal junction, which is an information-processing hub, and the prefrontal cortex, which is responsible for the expression of personality as well as the planning of complex cognitive behaviors. And, interestingly, this escalation in liveliness is higher during both wakefulness and sleep, so says a study of 41 people recently published online February 19 in the journal Neuropsychopharmacology. The activity in the brains of the people in this study were measured by Positron Emission Tomography while they were awake and sleeping. What do these findings tell us?


In combination with previous research from one of the study’s authors, Perrine Ruby, the findings tell us why some people remember their dreams and some do not. Ruby co-authored related research that was published last year in the journal Cerebral Cortex, which showed that people who have the ability to regularly recall their dreams are also more reactive to sounds when they are both asleep and awake. Ruby made some comments in a recent statement that synthesized the findings for both of these studies. Ruby stated that the brain needs to awaken from sleep in order to memorize new information. This, said Ruby, may explain the reason that those who react more to environmental stimuli can remember their dreams better; they simply are awakened more often and can therefore better encode into memory their dreams than others who are less reactive to sounds. In addition, the researchers said that people who often recall their dreams may also have more dreams than “low-recall” dreamers.
---

Beyond that, a person’s brain may actually block out a dream so we don’t remember it the following day. “The dream activity can be so real and intense that our brains actually hide, or mask away the dream, so [it doesn’t] get lost between our waking experience, and our dream lives. Thus it is normal to forget dreams, most of the time.” Dimitriu says.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Why Some People Always Remember Their Dreams and Others Forget (www.healthline.com)
Content: A study published in the journal Neuropsychopharmacology and reported by International Business Times suggested that those people who reported high dream recall had more activity in the temporoparietal junction than those who didn’t recall their dreams often.


Lambert tells Healthline that if someone consistently doesn’t get enough sleep, the amount of REM sleep they experience will drop, making it harder for them to remember their dreams the following day.


Even personality traits can be an indicator of whether someone will be able to remember their dreams.


Lambert continues: “Researchers also looked at the most common personality traits that are presented in people who can recall their dreams. Overall, such people are prone to daydreaming, creative thinking, and introspection. At the same time, those who are more practical and focused on what is outside themselves tend to have difficulty remembering their dreams.”


This may mean that some people are naturally more likely to recall their dreams than others, despite their quality of sleep.


Other factors, like stress or experiencing a trauma, can also cause people to have vivid dreams or nightmares that they’re more likely to recall the next day. For example, a person who’s coping with grief after losing a loved one may dream about the death in elaborate detail. Remembering the dream the next day may affect mood and cause even more stress or anxiety.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Do Frequent Dreams and the Ability to Recall Them Indicate Depression? - Guardian Liberty Voice (guardianlv.com)
Content: People who have the ability to recall their dreams five mornings per week, on average, have more spontaneous activity occurring in certain parts of their brains than others. The parts of the brain that host these increased levels of activity are called the temporo-parietal junction, which is an information-processing hub, and the prefrontal cortex, which is responsible for the expression of personality as well as the planning of complex cognitive behaviors. And, interestingly, this escalation in liveliness is higher during both wakefulness and sleep, so says a study of 41 people recently published online February 19 in the journal Neuropsychopharmacology. The activity in the brains of the people in this study were measured by Positron Emission Tomography while they were awake and sleeping. What do these findings tell us?


In combination with previous research from one of the study’s authors, Perrine Ruby, the findings tell us why some people remember their dreams and some do not. Ruby co-authored related research that was published last year in the journal Cerebral Cortex, which showed that people who have the ability to regularly recall their dreams are also more reactive to sounds when they are both asleep and awake. Ruby made some comments in a recent statement that synthesized the findings for both of these studies. Ruby stated that the brain needs to awaken from sleep in order to memorize new information. This, said Ruby, may explain the reason that those who react more to environmental stimuli can remember their dreams better; they simply are awakened more often and can therefore better encode into memory their dreams than others who are less reactive to sounds. In addition, the researchers said that people who often recall their dreams may also have more dreams than “low-recall” dreamers.

question_src: Ni nini huzuia bahari isifufuke dunia?
all_claims: Ukoko wa Dunia ulitawanyika mapema wakati mwamba mwepesi ulipoinuka na kuunda mabara, huku mwamba mzito ukizama na kuacha mabonde makubwa ya bahari yenye kina kikubwa kupita sehemu nyingi za ardhi [1].
Mabonde haya manne makuu—Pasifiki, Atlantiki, Hindi na Aktiki—ni mashimo yaliyofungwa na maeneo ya ardhi na matuta ya bahari, hivyo yanadhibiti maji yasiweze kuenea na kufunika mabara [2].
Hata kandokando ya mabara, rafu tambarare ya bara hukaa hadi takriban mita 600 chini ya usawa wa bahari, ikifanya kama kingo za bwawa kabla mteremko mkali wa bara kushuka kwenye sakafu ya bahari [2].
Kwa mpangilio huu, zaidi ya 96 % ya maji yote duniani hukaa salama ndani ya mabonde haya bila kufunika uso wa nchi kavu [3].
Mzunguko wa maji—uvukizi unaopunguza kiasi cha juu, mawingu na mvua inayorudisha maji baharini—unadumisha usawa wa kiasi cha bahari, ukizuia kuongezeka kupita mipaka ya miinuko ya mabara [3].
Kiasi kipya cha maji kinachotolewa polepole na gesi moto kutoka chini ya bahari ni kidogo sana kulinganisha na uwezo wa mabonde hayo [1].

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: All About the Ocean (www.nationalgeographic.org)
Content: After the Earth began to form about 4.6 billion years ago, it gradually separated into layers of lighter and heavier rock. The lighter rock rose and formed the Earth’s crust. The heavier rock sank and formed the Earth’s core and mantle.


The ocean’s water came from rocks inside the newly forming Earth. As the molten rocks cooled, they released water vapor and other gases. Eventually, the water vapor condensed and covered the crust with a primitive ocean. Today, hot gases from the Earth’s interior continue to produce new water at the bottom of the ocean.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Oceans. Formation of the Oceans. Facts about the Oceans (encyclopedia.lubopitko-bg.com)
Content: The largest features of the Earth's surface are the continents and ocean basins. The four major ocean basins (Arctic, Atlantic, Indian, and Pacific) are bound by landmasses and major oceanic ridges. Each continent is rimmed by a submerged, gently sloping continental margin. This includes the relatively flat continental shelf, generally found at depths of less than 600 feet (183 meters) with a width of a few miles to more than 200 miles (322 kilometers). At the shelf break portion of the margin, there is a rise in the continental shelf before the continental slope begins its plunge to the deep-sea bottom. Deep submarine canyons frequently cut into the continental margin.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: The Water Cycle (oceantoday.noaa.gov)
Content: Over 96% of total global water is in the ocean, so let’s start there. Energy from the sun causes water on the surface to evaporate into water vapor – a gas. This invisible vapor rises into the atmosphere, where the air is colder, and condenses into clouds. Air currents move these clouds all around the earth.


Water drops form in clouds, and the drops then return to the ocean or land as precipitation - let’s say this time, it’s snow. The snow will fall to the ground, and eventually melts back into a liquid and runs off into a lake or river, which flows back into the ocean, where it starts the process again.
---

question_src: Je! Ni kwanini vitu vya bei huisha kila wakati katika ".99" badala ya ".00"?
all_claims: Bei huishia kwenye “.99” kwa sababu wauzaji hutumia mbinu ya “bei ya kisaikolojia” inayotegemea athari ya tarakimu ya kushoto: tunaposoma kutoka kushoto kwenda kulia, tunaathiriwa zaidi na tarakimu ya kwanza kuliko zile za mwisho, hivyo bidhaa ya $9.99 huonekana kuwa katika safu ya dola 9 badala ya dola 10, hata kama tofauti ni senti moja tu [1].
Mpangilio huu hupunguza juhudi za kiakili tunazotumia kuchakata nambari nzima, hasa kwa vitu vya bei ya chini, na kutufanya tuone mpango bora kabla ya kufikiria zaidi [2].

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: The Real Reason Most Prices End in .99 (www.rd.com)
Content: Prices are more likely to end in .99 more than any other pair of numbers—and certainly more than the even .00. We probably don’t think twice about buying something for $5.99 or $16.99, but it is a little strange when you think about it. Why aren’t prices just even dollar amounts? Is it an elaborate marketing scheme to get you to spend more?

Well, essentially…yes. But there’s really nothing “elaborate” about it; it’s actually pretty simple. “It’s a type of psychological pricing,” says Julie Ramhold, consumer analyst with DealNews.com. “Because we read from left to right, we pay less attention to the end of the number versus the beginning.” This is especially effective if you’re just quickly perusing several prices in a row; the first number will definitely stand out to you more. Psychological pricing is powerful, but luckily, there are also plenty of psychology tricks to help you spend less while shopping.

Of course, we still know that $9.99 is basically ten dollars, not nine dollars. But the $.99 trick takes advantage of the way our brains process prices. When we see a price of $9.99, we associate it as part of the $9–$9.99 “range” rather than the $10–$10.99 “range.” “Consumers don’t want to transcend a certain category, so even a penny less may make a huge psychological difference,” explains Subimal Chatterjee, Distinguished Teaching Professor of Marketing at Binghamton University School of Management.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Why Do Most Prices End in .99? (www.livescience.com)
Content: Ending a price in .99 is based on the theory that, because we read from left to right, the first digit of the price resonates with us the most, Hibbett explained. That's why shoppers are more likely to buy a product for $4.99 than an identical one for $5 the item that starts with a 4 just seems like a better deal than the one that starts with 5.

"We also tend to attempt to reduce the amount of effort expended on making product decisions, especially with lower-cost items," Hibbett told Life's Little Mysteries. "So we may not really process the numbers after the dollar amount."

Additionally, the .99 alone serves to make an item appear to be on sale, according to the article "Mind Your Pricing Cues," published in the September 2003 issue of the Harvard Business Review. Price-conscious consumers have become conditioned to believe that they are getting a good deal when they buy something with a price ending in .99 even if the markdown is minimal.

question_src: Mama yangu aliniambia tu hisa nyingi hawalipi gawio. Je! Hii ndio kesi? Ikiwa ni hivyo kwa nini soko la hisa linapatikana, je! Sisi sote tukubali tu kufanya uwanja wa kamari ambapo tunapiga bet kwa wengine juu ya kile tunachokiuza? Na ikiwa ni hivyo kwa nini kampuni inafaa kwa wafanyabiashara?
all_claims: Ni kweli kwamba sio kila hisa hulipa gawio; wasimamizi wa kampuni zenye faida wanaweza kuchagua kulipa wanahisa au kuwekeza tena faida ili kukuza biashara, hivyo kuwapa wawekezaji chaguo kati ya “hisa za gawio” na “hisa za ukuaji” [2].

Hata hivyo, soko la hisa lipo kwa sababu faida za muda mrefu za uwekezaji katika kampuni zinazokua huenda zikawa kubwa kuliko gawio la papo hapo, na kwa wastani soko la hisa limethibitisha kutoa mapato chanya kwa muda mrefu tofauti na kamari ambayo ina matarajio hasi [5].

Ingawa uwekezaji na kamari zote zinahusisha hatari na hutegemea bahati kwa kiwango fulani, uwekezaji unajikita katika uchanganuzi wa thamani halisi, muda mrefu na usimamizi wa hatari, ilhali kamari ni shughuli ya muda mfupi isiyo na faida tarajiwa ya kudumu [3].

Wawekezaji huchangia mtaji kwa kampuni, na kampuni hutumia fedha hizo kupanua uzalishaji, kutengeneza bidhaa bora au kuingia masoko mapya; ukuaji huu unaweza kuongeza bei ya hisa na hivyo kuwa faida kwa wafanyabiashara na jamii kwa ujumla kupitia ajira, bidhaa na uvumbuzi.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: How and When Are Stock Dividends Paid Out? (www.investopedia.com)
Content: A dividend is the distribution of some of a company's earnings to a class of its shareholders. Dividends are usually paid in the form of a dividend check. However, they may also be paid in additional shares of stock. The standard practice for the payment of dividends is a check that is mailed to stockholders a few days after the ex-dividend date, which is the date on which the stock starts trading without the previously declared dividend.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Do All Stocks Have Dividends? (Why Don’t Some Stocks Pay Dividends?) (therobusttrader.com)
Content: All stocks do not pay a dividend. Profitable companies’ managers have the option of either compensating shareholders directly (through a dividend), or investing back into the company to fuel growth and increase the value of the company. Because of this, investors have the option to either go for dividend-paying stocks or stocks which emphasize growth over shareholder compensation.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Is Investing in Stocks Just a Form of Gambling? (realmoney.thestreet.com)
Content: Gambling, trading, speculation, and investment are perceived in very different ways but they have two core similarities. First, they all involve risking money in hopes of a positive return. Second, the results are dependent in part on luck.
---
Document ID: 4
Title: Is Investing in Stocks Just a Form of Gambling? (realmoney.thestreet.com)
Content: A number of distinctions between the various endeavors are usually drawn. Gambling is typically viewed as a form of entertainment that carries a higher level of risk and has a less certain outcome. Speculation and investment are generally viewed as business enterprises in which risk is understood and steps are taking to mitigate and manage it.
---
Document ID: 5
Title: Going All-In: Investing vs. Gambling (www.investopedia.com)
Content: True, investing and gambling both involve risk and choice—specifically, the risk of capital with hopes of future profit. But gambling is typically a short-lived activity, while equities investing can last a lifetime. Also, there is a negative expected return to gamblers, on average and over the long run. On the other hand, investing in the stock market typically carries with it a positive expected return on average over the long run.
---

Title: Is Snapchat Privacy-Friendly? [Analysis] - Choose To Encrypt (choosetoencrypt.com)

Document ID: 4
Title: How To Fix ‘Random People Adding Me On Snapchat’ Problem (nerdschalk.com)
Content: When you create an account on Snapchat, you give Snapchat the permission to display your profile to users that look you up. In this case, if a user knows your Snapchat ID, they can search for you and then add you from the search results.


If you have added your phone number on the app, you may show up on the accounts of people who have your number saved on their phones under ‘People you may know’. This is because Snapchat lets you sync your phone contacts to help you add your friends easily.


Users can also scan your Snapcode to be redirected to your Snapchat profile. If you posted your Snapcode in a public forum, anyone could scan it and add you using that code.


Related: What Happens When You Block Someone On TikTok?


## Who are the random people on my Snapchat?


Recently, a number of users have complained about getting an influx of ‘Adds’ on Snapchat. While this should not raise any red flags if it was organic growth, the users adding have no mutual friends. So the question arises, where did they get your profile info from?


Well, it seems a number of users have resorted to using bots to gain followers on the app. These bot accounts add you and wait for you to add them back. Once you do, they remove you as a friend. This allows users to reach a larger audience.


So if you are wondering why you have a bunch of strangers trying to add you on Snapchat, they could just be bot accounts.
---

Well, it seems a number of users have resorted to using bots to gain followers on the app. These bot accounts add you and wait for you to add them back. Once you do, they remove you as a friend. This allows users to reach a larger audience.


So if you are wondering why you have a bunch of strangers trying to add you on Snapchat, they could just be bot accounts.
---

all_claims: PayPal ni huduma ya malipo mtandaoni inayosifika kwa kuruhusu wateja kufanya ununuzi kwa njia salama bila kufichua maelezo yao ya kifedha [1].
Kwa mnunuzi, hakuna ada unaponunua au kuhamisha pesa kutoka benki au mizani ya PayPal; ukitumia kadi ya mkopo/malipo au mkopo wa PayPal, utatozwa 2.9% ya kiasi pamoja na senti 30 [2].
Muuzaji hulipa ada hiyo hiyo ya msingi ya 2.9% + $0.30 kwa kila muamala [4].

Akaunti ya Kibinafsi ina kikomo cha uondoaji cha $500 kwa mwezi, lakini kubadilisha hadi Premier huondoa kikomo hicho na kuruhusu upokeaji wa malipo ya kadi, huku Akaunti ya Biashara ikitoa ufikiaji wa watumiaji wengi [4].
Pesa zinaweza kuhamishwa papo hapo kwenda benki au kadi yako kwa ada ndogo, au bure ndani ya siku 1-3 za kazi kwa uhamisho wa kawaida [3].
Kiasi cha juu cha uhamisho wa ununuzi huwa kati ya $4,000–$60,000 kulingana na akaunti [2].

Hivyo, PayPal ni chaguo linaloaminika, lenye ada wazi na njia rahisi za kupokea na kutuma fedha.

Document ID: 4
Title: How Does PayPal Work for Sellers? (yourbusiness.azcentral.com)
Content: There are three primary types of PayPal account, and sellers can accept payments with any of them. A Personal account allows a seller to receive payments from other PayPal users, but has a withdrawal limit of $500 per month. Connecting a bank account or credit card allows a seller to upgrade to a Premier account, which removes this limit and offers the ability to accept credit and debit card payments as well. A Business account is the same as a Premier account, but allows access by multiple users. The standard fee for selling via PayPal is 2.9 percent plus 30 cents per transaction.
---
Document ID: 5
Title: Getting paid with PayPal (www.ebay.com)
Content: You need a Paypal account in order to use PayPal to receive payment for eBay sales. If you don’t have an account, we’ll ask you to sign up when you create your first listing.


When you create a listing, select PayPal as a payment method and enter the email address associated with your PayPal account in the Payment options section of the listing form.


Remember, if you offer PayPal as a payment option on eBay (using either logos or text in the item description), you must accept all forms of PayPal payment, including payments from an existing PayPal account balance, bank account transfers, and credit card payments. You can’t tell buyers that you only accept specific forms of PayPal payment. See the Payment methods policy for more information. When a buyer sends you a payment through PayPal, the money is usually available in your PayPal account right away.

Title: How Does PayPal Work for Sellers? (yourbusiness.azcentral.com)
Content: There are three primary types of PayPal account, and sellers can accept payments with any of them. Title: Getting paid with PayPal (www.ebay.com)
Content: You need a Paypal account in order to use PayPal to receive payment for eBay sales. If you don’t have an account, we’ll ask you to sign up when you create your first listing.


When you create a listing, select PayPal as a payment method and enter the email address associated with your PayPal account in the Payment options section of the listing form.


Remember, if you offer PayPal as a payment option on eBay (using either logos or text in the item description), you must accept all forms of PayPal payment, including payments from an existing PayPal account balance, bank account transfers, and credit card payments. You can’t tell buyers that you only accept specific forms of PayPal payment. See the Payment methods policy for more information. When a buyer sends you a payment through PayPal, the money is usually available in your PayPal account right away.

Response: Kiasi cha juu cha uhamisho wa ununuzi huwa kati ya $4,000–$60,000 kulingana na akaunti [

claim: Mfumo wa uchaguzi wa rais wa Marekani hutegemea Chuo cha Uchaguzi, njia ya muafaka iliyobuniwa kati ya kumchagua rais na Bunge na kumchagua moja kwa moja kwa kura ya wananchi
question_src: Mfumo wa uchaguzi wa rais wa Merika. Sipati.
all_claims: Mfumo wa uchaguzi wa rais wa Marekani hutegemea Chuo cha Uchaguzi, njia ya muafaka iliyobuniwa kati ya kumchagua rais na Bunge na kumchagua moja kwa moja kwa kura ya wananchi [2].
Kila jimbo hupata idadi ya wateule sawa na wabunge wake katika Baraza la Wawakilishi jumlisha maseneta wake wawili, na Wilaya ya Columbia hupata wateule watatu, na hivyo jumla ya wateule ni 538 [4].
Wakati wa Uchaguzi Mkuu wa Novemba, mpiga kura huwaelekeza wateule wa jimbo lake kumpigia kura mgombea huyo, na katika majimbo 48 na Washington, D.C.
mshindi wa kura maarufu hupata kura zote za wateule wa jimbo (“winner-take-all”) [3].
Maine na Nebraska huwasambaza wateule kwa mfumo wa mgao, hivyo mshindi anaweza kupata sehemu tu ya kura [1].
Mgombea anahitaji kura angalau 270 za wateule—zaidi ya nusu—ili kushinda urais [1].
Ingawa matokeo hutangazwa usiku wa uchaguzi, wateule hukutana katikati ya Desemba kupiga kura rasmi, na baadhi ya majimbo huwabana kisheria kupiga kura kulingana na matokeo ya jimbo [1].

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Presidential Election Process | USAGov (www.usa.gov)
Content: After you cast your ballot for president, your vote goes to a statewide tally. In 48 states and Washington, D.C., the winner gets all the electoral votes for that state. Maine and Nebraska assign their electors using a proportional system.


A candidate needs the vote of at least 270 electors—more than half of all electors—to win the presidential election.


In most cases, a projected winner is announced on election night in November after you vote. But the actual Electoral College vote takes place in mid-December when the electors meet in their states. See the Electoral College timeline of events for the 2020 election.


While the Constitution doesn’t require electors to vote for the candidate chosen by their state's popular vote, some states do. The rare elector who votes for someone else may be fined, disqualified and replaced by a substitute elector, or potentially even prosecuted.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: How the US Electoral College System Works (www.thoughtco.com)
Content: The Founding Fathers created the Electoral College system as a compromise between having the president elected by Congress and having the president elected by the popular vote of qualified citizens.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: How the US Electoral College System Works (www.thoughtco.com)
Content: When you vote for a presidential candidate, you are in fact voting to instruct the electors from your state to cast their votes for the same candidate.


For example, if you vote for the Republican candidate in the November election, you are really just picking an elector who will be pledged to vote for the Republican candidate when the Electoral College votes in December. The candidate who wins the popular vote in a state wins all the pledged votes of the state's electors in the 48 winner-take-all states and District of Columbia.﻿﻿ Nebraska and Maine award electors proportionally.
---
Document ID: 4
Title: How the US Electoral College System Works (www.thoughtco.com)
Content: Each state gets a number of electors equal to its number of members in the U.S. House of Representatives plus one for each of its two U.S. senators. The District of Columbia gets three electors.﻿﻿ State laws determine how electors are chosen, but they are generally selected by the political party committees within the states.


Each elector gets one vote. Thus, a state with eight electors would cast eight votes. As of the 1964 election, there are 538 electors, and the votes of a majority of them—270—are required to be elected.﻿﻿ Because Electoral College representation is based on congressional representation, states with larger populations get more Electoral College votes.
---

Wakati wa Uchaguzi Mkuu wa Novemba, mpiga kura huwaelekeza wateule wa jimbo lake kumpigia kura mgombea huyo, na katika majimbo 48 na Washington, D.C.
mshindi wa kura maarufu hupata kura zote za wateule wa jimbo (“winner-take-all”) [3].
Maine na Nebraska huwasambaza wateule kwa mfumo wa mgao, hivyo mshindi anaweza kupata sehemu tu ya kura [1].
Mgombea anahitaji kura angalau 270 za wateule—zaidi ya nusu—ili kushinda urais [1].

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Presidential Election Process | USAGov (www.usa.gov)
Content: After you cast your ballot for president, your vote goes to a statewide tally. In 48 states and Washington, D.C., the winner gets all the electoral votes for that state. Maine and Nebraska assign their electors using a proportional system.


A candidate needs the vote of at least 270 electors—more than half of all electors—to win the presidential election.


In most cases, a projected winner is announced on election night in November after you vote. But the actual Electoral College vote takes place in mid-December when the electors meet in their states. See the Electoral College timeline of events for the 2020 election.


While the Constitution doesn’t require electors to vote for the candidate chosen by their state's popular vote, some states do. The rare elector who votes for someone else may be fined, disqualified and replaced by a substitute elector, or potentially even prosecuted.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: How the US Electoral College System Works (www.thoughtco.com)
Content: The Founding Fathers created the Electoral College system as a compromise between having the president elected by Congress and having the president elected by the popular vote of qualified citizens.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: How the US Electoral College System Works (www.thoughtco.com)
Content: When you vote for a presidential candidate, you are in fact voting to instruct the electors from your state to cast their votes for the same candidate.


For example, if you vote for the Republican candidate in the November election, you are really just picking an elector who will be pledged to vote for the Republican candidate when the Electoral College votes in December. The candidate who wins the popular vote in a state wins all the pledged votes of the state's electors in the 48 winner-take-all states and District of Columbia.﻿﻿ Nebraska and Maine award electors proportionally.
---
Document ID: 4
Title: How the US Electoral College System Works (www.thoughtco.com)
Content: Each state gets a number of electors equal to its number of members in the U.S. House of Representatives plus one for each of its two U.S. senators. The District of Columbia gets three electors.﻿﻿ State laws determine how electors are chosen, but they are generally selected by the political party committees within the states.


Each elector gets one vote. Thus, a state with eight electors would cast eight votes. As of the 1964 election, there are 538 electors, and the votes of a majority of them—270—are required to be elected.﻿﻿ Because Electoral College representation is based on congressional representation, states with larger populations get more Electoral College votes.
---

claim: Hii ni suala la “bioavailability,” yaani virutubishi kuwapo hakumaanishi mwili vitavifyonza vyote
question_src: Ikiwa na jinsi kiasi kikubwa cha mlozi kinaweza kuwa na kalori kidogo na mdalasini na sukari iliyoongezwa (picha ya lishe katika maandishi)
all_claims: Inaweza kuonekana ajabu kwamba kikombe kizima cha mlozi kilichochanganywa na mdalasini na kiasi kidogo cha sukari kinaonyesha kalori chache kuliko ungetarajia, lakini utafiti unaeleza kwamba takriban 20 % ya kalori za mlozi hazipatikani kwa mwili kwa sababu mafuta mengi hubaki yamefungwa katika kuta zake ngumu za seli, hivyo hayanyonywi ipasavyo [1].
Watafiti wa USDA walithibitisha jambo hili kwa kupima kinyesi na mkojo wa walaji na wakaona tofauti hiyo kubwa ya upatikanaji wa nishati [2].
Hii ni suala la “bioavailability,” yaani virutubishi kuwapo hakumaanishi mwili vitavifyonza vyote [3].
Kama umetumia mdalasini pekee hauongezi kalori kiasi—kijiko cha chai kina karibu 6 kcal—lakini sukari inaweza kuongeza: kijiko kidogo (4 g) kina ~16 kcal.

Hata hivyo, ukitumia gramu chache tu za sukari, jumla ya kalori ya mchanganyiko bado inaweza kuwa chini ya lebo za jadi za mlozi, kwa sababu punguzo la 20 % ya mlozi (mfano, 160 kcal → 129 kcal kwa huduma ya karanga 23) mara nyingi “hufidia” ongezeko dogo la sukari.
Kumbuka kwamba kusaga au kusaga sana mlozi hupunguza ufanisi huu kwa kuvunja kuta za seli na kuruhusu kalori zaidi kufyonzwa [4].
claims_retained: Hii ni suala la “bioavailability,” yaani virutubishi kuwapo hakumaanishi mwili vitavifyonza vyote [3].
Kumbuka kwamba kusaga au kusaga sana mlozi hupunguza ufanisi huu kwa kuvunja kuta za seli na kuruhusu kalori zaidi kufyonzwa [4].
prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: New Study Reveals Fewer Calories in Almonds | Food Network Healthy Eats: Recipes, Ideas, and Food News | Food Network (www.foodnetwork.com)
Content: A new study published in the American Journal of Clinical Nutrition found that almonds have 20% fewer calories than originally thought. The results found that a one-ounce serving of almonds (about 23 nuts) has 129 calories as opposed to 160 that’s currently listed on the Nutrition Facts Panel.


Interestingly, it has nothing to do with the composition of the almond—rather, the way we metabolize it.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: New Study Reveals Fewer Calories in Almonds | Food Network Healthy Eats: Recipes, Ideas, and Food News | Food Network (www.foodnetwork.com)
Content: several studies published over the past 10 years have suggested that when people eat almonds, not all of the fat is digested and absorbed. Some of the fat remains intact within the almonds’ rigid cell walls. Recognizing that this could affect the number of calories actually available from almonds, researchers at USDA's Agricultural Research Service decided to specifically determine the calories absorbed. We were not at all surprised to learn from Dr. Baer’s work that fewer calories from almonds are available for absorption. However, we were pleasantly surprised by the magnitude of the difference. In 2011, Dr. Baer conducted research using the same methodology to find out available calories from pistachios and found that the number was only 5% lower than previously thought, while the number for almonds was 20% lower.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Almonds Have 20% Fewer Calories Than Thought, Based On Research (www.womenshealthmag.com)
Content: Why the change in almonds and cashews? The difference in the calorie counts is because research found your body doesn’t actually break down and use all of the calories that are in nuts, explains Alissa Rumsey, RD, nutrition therapist and owner of Alissa Rumsey Nutrition and Wellness. “This concept is called bioavailability,” she says. “Basically, just because nutrients are present in a food, that doesn’t automatically mean that the body will readily use them. Therefore fewer calories may actually be absorbed.”
---
Document ID: 4
Title: The Skinny on Almond Calories (www.almonds.com)
Content: The resulting data from this new study showed that, with the exception of almond butter, all of the almond forms analyzed provide fewer calories than is listed on packages:


[Image: almond nutrients]


Wondering why the discrepancy in calories? Mechanical processes, such as roasting, chopping and grinding play a role because they disrupt the cell wall of almonds and affect particle size. Particle size is also affected when almonds are chewed and digested in the body. The larger the particle size, the less the almond is broken down by digestive enzymes and the more of the almond is excreted, so fewer calories are absorbed. The reverse is also true: the smaller the particle size, the more calories are absorbed. Further research is needed to better understand the results of this study and how this method of measuring calories could potentially affect the calorie count of other foods.
---

question_src: Nini kingetokea kwa mwili wangu ikiwa ningeshikwa mahali pengine na usambazaji wa maji wa kuaminika lakini hakuna chakula
all_claims: Iwapo ungelazimika kukaa mahali penye maji ya kutosha lakini bila chakula, mwili wako ungeanza kutumia akiba ya glikojeni ndani ya saa chache, kisha mafuta yaliyohifadhiwa na hatimaye tishu za misuli ili kupata nishati, jambo litakalopunguza uzito, nguvu na kinga ya mwili; mchakato huu unaweza kuendelea kwa muda mrefu kiasi lakini unaambatana na hatari ya kupungua kwa misuli ya moyo, kushuka kwa shinikizo la damu, matatizo ya umeme wa moyo na hatimaye kushindwa kwa viungo muhimu.

claim: Ndiyo; “share/like/comment” zilizoundwa kimakusudi huongeza “ushiriki wa maana”, kigezo ambacho Facebook hutumia kupandisha machapisho kwenye ‘feed’ na kuyapa ufikiaji mpana zaidi
question_src: Machapisho ya FB yanayoweka watu "kushiriki ikiwa unaona X" au "Timmy mdogo ana saratani na ataishi na 1m anapenda" au puzzles rahisi iliyoundwa kupigwa na ego yako na kutuma jibu. Je! Kuna mtu anapata pesa kutoka kwa hii?
all_claims: Ndiyo; “share/like/comment” zilizoundwa kimakusudi huongeza “ushiriki wa maana”, kigezo ambacho Facebook hutumia kupandisha machapisho kwenye ‘feed’ na kuyapa ufikiaji mpana zaidi [1].

Kadri ufikiaji unavyoongezeka, ndivyo thamani ya kibiashara inavyopanda: kurasa au akaunti zenye wafuasi wengi huuzwa moja kwa moja kwenye makundi kama “Buy or Trade” yaliyo na maelfu ya wanachama wanaotangaza akaunti pamoja na bei zao kulingana na hesabu ya wafuasi [4].

Mbali na kuuza akaunti, biashara zinaweza kuongeza mauzo kupitia machapisho yenye ushiriki mkubwa; mfano kampuni moja iliongeza mapato yake kutoka takribani $20,000–30,000 hadi zaidi ya $100,000 kwa mwezi kwa kushirikisha watumiaji zaidi kwenye mitandao ya kijamii [2].

Hivyo, watengenezaji wa maudhui ya “share ikiwa…” hutumia ushiriki kama mtaji: ama kuuza bidhaa au nafasi za matangazo, kukusanya data, au hata kuuza akaunti yenyewe—yote yakiwa njia halisi za kupata pesa kutokana na mbinu hizo.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: How does my phone know, when I am in the deep sleep? (docs.sleep.urbandroid.org)
Content: The phone has an accelerometer sensor build in which is very sensitive and if placed in your bed we have a record of your movement over the nigh. In deep sleep your muscular movements are suppressed (otherwise you would be running or jumping around according to your dreams :)) and thus in this phase the sleep graph gets nearly flat.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Tracking sleep with your phone (exist.io)
Content: There are plenty of options for sleep-tracking apps, and a couple of the most popular apps have recently expanded to cover both iOS and Android. For most of these apps, you'll need to leave them running and place your phone on your mattress near your pillow so they can detect your movement during the night.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Tracking sleep with your phone (exist.io)
Content: The problem with this is that your movement can snap your sleep-tracker out of sleep mode (has happened to me many times) or your movement can be tracked as restless sleep when in fact you're up out of bed completely, grabbing a drink.
---
Document ID: 4
Title: How Does Fitbit Track Sleep and What is the Fitbit Sleep Score? | Fitbit Health Solutions (healthsolutions.fitbit.com)
Content: While you’re sleeping, your device tracks the beat-to-beat changes in your heart rate, known as heart rate variability (HRV). These numbers fluctuate as you transition between light sleep, deep sleep, and REM sleep stages.
---

question_src: Kama mtu aliye na astigmatism, kwa nini ni wakati mimi hupiga macho yangu kidogo naweza kuona wazi zaidi?
all_claims: Unapokuwa na astigmatism, kornea yako ina umbo lisilo la kawaida, hivyo mionzi ya mwanga huelekezwa kwenye sehemu tofauti za retina na kusababisha taswira iliyopinda au isiyo wazi; ukikandamiza kope (kusquint) unasaidia kurekebisha hilo kwa njia kadhaa.

Kwanza, unapofanya upenyo kati ya kope kuwa mwembamba unaacha “athari ya pini”; ni idadi ndogo tu ya miale ya mwanga iliyo katikati na iliyonyooka ndiyo inayoingia, na miale ya pembeni—inayochangia ukungu kwa astigmatism—huzuiliwa, hivyo picha inakuwa makini zaidi [2].

Pili, kitendo cha kukaza kope hufanya shinikizo dogo mbele ya macho ambalo hubadilisha kidogo umbo la lenzi na uso wa mbele wa jicho, na marekebisho haya madogo yanaweza kufidia kwa muda sehemu isiyo sawa ya kornea na kuboresha uakisi wa mwanga kwenye retina [1].

Tatu, kwa kuwa kope zimefanya uwazi wa mwanafunzi uwe mdogo, mwanafunzi hupungua na kuongeza “kina cha uwanja,” yaani mwanga mdogo huingia na huelekezwa vizuri zaidi, kama kutumia kipenyo kidogo cha kamera, nalo husababisha maono kuonekana makali zaidi [3].
Ndiyo maana unapopiga macho kidogo, maandishi au vitu vya mbali huonekana wazi kuliko kawaida licha ya astigmatism yako.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Why Can I See Better When I Squint My Eyes? - Grosinger, Spigelman & Grey (www.eyemichigan.com)
Content: What Does Squinting Do to Your Eye?


Even though it doesn’t feel much different, squinting does three things to our eyes that lead to slightly clearer vision.


* Our Eye Lens Changes Shape – The lens of the eye is flexible and changes shape when we squint.
* The Eye Lens Adjusts – Small adjustments in the lens allow us to focus better, much like a camera.
* Less Light Enters the Eye – Less light enters, reducing the impact on the retina and allowing the object we view to look sharper.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Why Do I See Better When I Squint? (www.invision2020.com)
Content: A small amount of the increased clarity of vision is due to changing the shape of the eye as you squint. However, the main optical principle at work, and one that is quite fascinating, is called the “pinhole effect”. Clear vision is a result of light rays that properly focused on the retina located in the back of the eye. Typically, this is done with glasses or contact lenses; both of which bend light into focus and therefore correct vision.


When we squint it creates the same effect as looking through a pinhole. Basically only a small amount of focused central light rays are allowed into the eye. This prevents the unfocused light rays in the periphery from reaching the retina. The result is better vision. Photographers understand this as “depth of field”.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Vision Hack: How to See Clearly Without Your Glasses or Contacts (vision-and-hearing.wonderhowto.com)
Content: The reason that squinting helps you see is because it changes the shape of your eye, making the pupil smaller, thus letting less light in and making an image clear. This is similar to the way a larger aperture works; a smaller hole in your camera lets less light in, with better focus.
---
Document ID: 4
Title: Cornell Center for Materials Research (www.ccmr.cornell.edu)
Content: By limiting the rays of light that come in through the bottom and top of the pupil, squinting allows rays to pass closer to the center of the lens, thereby creating a more focused image. So, that means that squinting works by two mechanisms – by both changing the shape of the eye and by letting in light that can be focused more precisely by the lens.
---

question_src: Je! Dawa za kuhalalisha zinafanyaje kwa walevi duni?
all_claims: Kuhalalisha dawa na hasa kutoa dawa chini ya usimamizi wa serikali kunaweza kuleta manufaa makubwa kwa walevi duni (hard-core users).

Katika mpango wa Uswizi wa kuandikisha heroin, watumiaji ‘wa msingi ngumu’ walipata dozi za kisheria, jambo lililosababisha kupungua kwa kiwango kikubwa cha matumizi yao ya heroin haramu na hivyo kupunguza hitaji la kujihusisha na biashara ya dawa na uhalifu mwingine [1].

Kwa kuwa walipata njia thabiti na salama ya kushughulikia uraibu, walihitaji fedha chache kwa ajili ya ununuzi wa dawa haramu, wakapunguza kuiba au kuuza barabarani, na hivyo kuwaondoa kama kiungo kati ya waagizaji na watumiaji wengine [1].

Kutoka kwa mtazamo mpana, wanasera wanaoegemea uhalalishaji wanasema upatikanaji wa dawa zenye ubora unaodhibitiwa na bei nafuu ungeondoa soko la magendo, kushusha gharama za utekelezaji wa sheria na kupunguza uhalifu unaohusiana na dawa, jambo linalowanufaisha zaidi walevi maskini ambao mara nyingi hukumbwa na kukamatwa na gharama kubwa za uraibu [3].
Kwa hivyo, uhalalishaji na usambazaji uliodhibitiwa unaweza kupunguza utegemezi wa walevi duni kwenye masoko haramu, kuimarisha afya zao na kupunguza mgongano wao na mifumo ya kisheria.

Title: Does drug legalization lower drug abuse and drug addiction? - The Sociological Mail (thesociologicalmail.com)
Content: > The Swiss heroin prescription program was targeted at hard-core drug users with very well established heroin habits. These people were heavily engaged in both drug dealing and other forms of crime.


> They also served as a link between importers, few of whom were Swiss, and the — primarily Swiss — users. As these hard-core users found a steady, legal means for addressing their addiction, they reduced their illicit drug use. This reduced their need to deal in heroin and engage in other criminal activities. Thus, the program had three effects on the drug market:


>   * It substantially reduced the consumption among the heaviest users, and this reduction in demand affected the viability of the market.

Title: Drug Legalization | Institute for Behavior and Health (www.ibhinc.org)
Content: Advocates of drug legalization believe that making high-quality drugs cheaply and widely available will eliminate the illegal drug market, regulate quality and price, and decrease law enforcement costs including arrest and incarceration. question_src: Je! Dawa za kuhalalisha zinafanyaje kwa walevi duni?
all_claims: Kuhalalisha dawa na hasa kutoa dawa chini ya usimamizi wa serikali kunaweza kuleta manufaa makubwa kwa walevi duni (hard-core users).

Katika mpango wa Uswizi wa kuandikisha heroin, watumiaji ‘wa msingi ngumu’ walipata dozi za kisheria, jambo lililosababisha kupungua kwa kiwango kikubwa cha matumizi yao ya heroin haramu na hivyo kupunguza hitaji la kujihusisha na biashara ya dawa na uhalifu mwingine [1].

Kwa kuwa walipata njia thabiti na salama ya kushughulikia uraibu, walihitaji fedha chache kwa ajili ya ununuzi wa dawa haramu, wakapunguza kuiba au kuuza barabarani, na hivyo kuwaondoa kama kiungo kati ya waagizaji na watumiaji wengine [1].

Kutoka kwa mtazamo mpana, wanasera wanaoegemea uhalalishaji wanasema upatikanaji wa dawa zenye ubora unaodhibitiwa na bei nafuu ungeondoa soko la magendo, kushusha gharama za utekelezaji wa sheria na kupunguza uhalifu unaohusiana na dawa, jambo linalowanufaisha zaidi walevi maskini ambao mara nyingi hukumbwa na kukamatwa na gharama kubwa za uraibu [3].
Kwa hivyo, uhalalishaji na usambazaji uliodhibitiwa unaweza kupunguza utegemezi wa walevi duni kwenye masoko haramu, kuimarisha afya zao na kupunguza mgongano wao na mifumo ya kisheria.

question_src: Je! Meteors (au uchafu mwingine wa nafasi) huharibu au husababisha hatari kwa tabaka za anga na vile? Ikiwa ni hivyo, ni hatari gani kwetu? Ikiwa sivyo, kwa nini sivyo?
all_claims: Kila siku takriban tani 48 za vumbi na micrometeoriti huanguka kwenye anga, lakini nyingi huchoma papo hapo kabla ya kufika ardhini, hivyo haziharibu tabaka za anga bali zinachangia ulinzi wetu dhidi ya miili mikubwa zaidi [1].

Watafiti wamebaini kuwa shinikizo la hewa linalojengeka ndani ya miili midogo yenye mashimo husababisha ilipuke na kuvunjika vipande vidogo, jambo linaloongeza uwezo wa anga kuizika kabla haijafika chini [4].
Kwa hiyo, meteor nyingi ndogo si hatari kubwa kwa binadamu wala kwa tabaka kama ozoni.

Hata hivyo, athari ya asteroid kubwa (urefu wa km 1–2) inaweza kuingiza nishati na uchafu mwingi kiasi cha kuvuruga safu ya ozoni, na kuongeza mwanga wa ultraviolet kwenye uso kwa miaka takriban miwili, hatua ambayo ingeongeza saratani, kuathiri mimea na kusababisha mabadiliko ya maumbile [3].
Vilevile, uchafu na gesi za athari kama hiyo zingefunika anga, zikizuia jua kisha baadaye kuchochea ongezeko la joto duniani, na kusababisha msukosuko wa hali ya hewa duniani kwa miaka kadhaa [2].
Kwa ujumla, hatari iko zaidi kwa matukio ya nadra ya miili mikubwa; mawe madogo ya kila siku yanang’olewa na anga letu na hayaathiri tabaka zake kikubwa.
claims_retained: Kila siku takriban tani 48 za vumbi na micrometeoriti huanguka kwenye anga, lakini nyingi huchoma papo hapo kabla ya kufika ardhini, hivyo haziharibu tabaka za anga bali zinachangia ulinzi wetu dhidi ya miili mikubwa zaidi [1].

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Long Term Effects of an Asteroid Impact on Earth (education.seattlepi.com)
Content: It may seem like meteors crashing to Earth are rare, but more than 48 tons of debris falls into Earth's atmosphere every single day. Most of this comes in the form of dust and micrometeorites that burn up instantly, but on rare occasions, larger rocks may fall into the planet's gravity well. Depending on the size of the object, an impact can cause a number of different effects, and a large enough asteroid could drastically change life on Earth.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Long Term Effects of an Asteroid Impact on Earth (education.seattlepi.com)
Content: A massive asteroid impact would create long-term changes in the atmosphere and climate of the planet. Upon impact, vaporized dirt and rock would fill the atmosphere, blocking sunlight and creating a state of near-permanent darkness and winter-like conditions. After the particles in the atmosphere settle, an increase in greenhouse gases from impact fires and released stores in the crater area could actually increase temperatures substantially due to an increased greenhouse effect. The severity and length of each of these phases would depend on the size of the impact, with a one or two kilometer-wide asteroid causing enough damage to trigger worldwide disturbances for years.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Long Term Effects of an Asteroid Impact on Earth (education.seattlepi.com)
Content: Another dangerous effect of an asteroid strike would be damage to the ozone layer. The energy imparted to the atmosphere by the incoming object would be enough to disrupt the protective layer of ozone high in the stratosphere, drastically increasing the amount of ultraviolet light that made it to the surface. This would increase global cancer rates, affect the growth of plants and animals and possibly lead to genetic mutations over the period of increased exposure. Depending on the size of the asteroid, this could last for as much as two years.
---
Document ID: 4
Title: In Earth's Atmosphere, Meteors May Explode from the Inside Out (www.space.com)
Content: Earth's atmosphere may infiltrate the interior of porous meteors as they hurtle toward the planet, creating pockets of high-pressure air inside the rocky space debris. These pockets can then cause the space rocks to explode, breaking into smaller pieces.
---
Document ID: 5
Title: In Earth's Atmosphere, Meteors May Explode from the Inside Out (www.space.com)
Content: When meteors enter the planet's atmosphere, they heat up, and ultimately disintegrate. (This is either because of something -called ram pressure or friction.). However, the new research highlights a new way in which the atmosphere may break up meteors and protect Earth, the researchers said.
---

Title: Long Term Effects of an Asteroid Impact on Earth (education.seattlepi.com)
Content: It may seem like meteors crashing to Earth are rare, but more than 48 tons of debris falls into Earth's atmosphere every single day. Most of this comes in the form of dust and micrometeorites that burn up instantly, but on rare occasions, larger rocks may fall into the planet's gravity well. Depending on the size of the object, an impact can cause a number of different effects, and a large enough asteroid could drastically change life on Earth.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Long Term Effects of an Asteroid Impact on Earth (education.seattlepi.com)
Content: A massive asteroid impact would create long-term changes in the atmosphere and climate of the planet. Upon impact, vaporized dirt and rock would fill the atmosphere, blocking sunlight and creating a state of near-permanent darkness and winter-like conditions. After the particles in the atmosphere settle, an increase in greenhouse gases from impact fires and released stores in the crater area could actually increase temperatures substantially due to an increased greenhouse effect. The severity and length of each of these phases would depend on the size of the impact, with a one or two kilometer-wide asteroid causing enough damage to trigger worldwide disturbances for years.

Document ID: 3
Title: Long Term Effects of an Asteroid Impact on Earth (education.seattlepi.com)
Content: Another dangerous effect of an asteroid strike would be damage to the ozone layer. The energy imparted to the atmosphere by the incoming object would be enough to disrupt the protective layer of ozone high in the stratosphere, drastically increasing the amount of ultraviolet light that made it to the surface. This would increase global cancer rates, affect the growth of plants and animals and possibly lead to genetic mutations over the period of increased exposure. Depending on the size of the asteroid, this could last for as much as two years.

question_src: Ikiwa mtu kwenye WiFi yangu anatumia VPN, hii inamaanisha mimi pia hutumia VPN?
all_claims: Kama mtumiaji binafsi anawasha VPN kwenye simu au kompyuta yake, usimbuaji na uelekezaji wa trafiki hutokea tu kati ya kifaa hicho na seva ya VPN, hivyo vifaa vingine kwenye Wi-Fi hiyo havinufaiki wala kuegemea VPN hiyo [2].

Hata hivyo, kama VPN imewekwa moja kwa moja kwenye router, basi kila kifaa kinachounganishwa na router hiyo – iwe chako au cha jirani – kitapitisha data kupitia handaki lililosimbwa, kumaanisha wote mtakuwa mnatumia VPN moja kwa moja bila kufanya lolote zaidi kwenye vifaa vyenu [1].
Kwa hiyo, uwepo wa mtu anayetumia VPN ndani ya mtandao wako haukufanyi wewe utumie VPN isipokuwa VPN imewekwa kiwango cha router au wewe mwenyewe uiwashe kwenye kifaa chako.
claims_retained: Kama mtumiaji binafsi anawasha VPN kwenye simu au kompyuta yake, usimbuaji na uelekezaji wa trafiki hutokea tu kati ya kifaa hicho na seva ya VPN, hivyo vifaa vingine kwenye Wi-Fi hiyo havinufaiki wala kuegemea VPN hiyo [2].

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: How to install a VPN on your router (nordvpn.com)
Content: A VPN creates an encrypted and secure connection between the device it’s installed on and the internet. It gathers all of that device’s requests to access the internet and directs them through its encrypted tunnel and VPN server so they can’t be read or redirected.


That’s easy to understand when you’re on a device with a user interface. Want to visit a website? You go through the tunnel. Want to video call your BFF? Through the tunnel. But what happens on a device with no user interface, like a router?


Once you’ve set up a router VPN, every single device connected to your router will have its traffic sent through the encrypted tunnel.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Do I need a VPN at home? (us.norton.com)
Content: If you’re using a VPN, your computer or mobile device will first connect to this outside VPN server before it connects to the web. A VPN also encrypts the data you send and receive while searching online.


This combination — your connection to the outside VPN server and the encryption of your data — helps keep your browsing private. The only people who will know what sites you visit or links you click are you, your VPN provider, and the people or companies running the sites you visit.
---

Content: Allah is the Arabic word for God, although only a relatively small amount of Muslims actually speak Arabic as their first language. There is nothing wrong with a Muslim saying ‘God’ in his/her own language, but most Muslims prefer to use the word Allah. However, the word Allah also has a unique quality.

claim: Bit ni kitengo cha msingi cha data kwenye kompyuta na mawasiliano, na kila moja huwakilisha moja ya hali mbili, 0 au 1
question_src: Je! "Bit" inamaanisha nini, kwa kuzingatia usimbuaji fiche? i.e 4096-bit iliyosimbwa
all_claims: Bit ni kitengo cha msingi cha data kwenye kompyuta na mawasiliano, na kila moja huwakilisha moja ya hali mbili, 0 au 1 [1].
Urefu wa mkusanyiko wa biti huitwa urefu wa nambari ya binary, ambapo kila biti hutoa kipimo cha kutokuwa na uhakika cha chaguo kati ya 0 na 1 [3].

Katika usimbuaji fiche, “4096-bit iliyosimbwa” humaanisha ufunguo wa RSA wenye biti 4096 mfululizo—yaani safu ya tarakimu 4096 za 0/1—hivyo nafasi ya mchanganyiko unaowezekana ni 2^4096 na kufanya mashambulizi ya nguvu-kupitia kuwa magumu sana ikilinganishwa na funguo fupi kama 2048-bit [5].

Kadiri idadi ya biti inavyoongezeka, kiwango cha usalama hupanda lakini gharama ya kihesabu pia huongezeka; kwa hivyo 4096-bit huonekana kuwa chaguo la “usalama mzuri” kwenye vifaa vya kisasa, ingawa huweza kupunguza kasi ya operesheni takribani mara tano kuliko urefu mfupi wa ufunguo [5].
claims_retained: Bit ni kitengo cha msingi cha data kwenye kompyuta na mawasiliano, na kila moja huwakilisha moja ya hali mbili, 0 au 1 [1].
Urefu wa mkusanyiko wa biti huitwa urefu wa nambari ya binary, ambapo kila biti hutoa kipimo cha kutokuwa na uhakika cha chaguo kati ya 0 na 1 [3].

Content: A bit, short for binary digit, is defined as the most basic unit of data in telecommunications and computing. Each bit is represented by either a 1 or a 0 and this can be executed in various systems through a two-state device.

Title: Bit (www.techopedia.com)
Content: A computer not only initiates multiple instructions that can manipulate and test bits, but it also performs these instructions and stores accumulated data in eight-bit parcels called bytes

Content: The length of a binary number may be referred to as its bit-length. In information theory, one bit is typically defined as the uncertainty of a binary random variable that is 0 or 1 with equal probability

Content: * unless you can accept a relatively low level of security and are running on modest hardware, you should generally choose an RSA key length of at least 2048 bits (current NIST recommendation);

* you could consider higher key lengths, but the performance overhead increase almost exponentially with key length, meaning in practice a doubling of key length makes decryption some 5 times slower

Urefu wa mkusanyiko wa biti huitwa urefu wa nambari ya binary, ambapo kila biti hutoa kipimo cha kutokuwa na uhakika cha chaguo kati ya 0 na 1 [3].

Katika usimbuaji fiche, “4096-bit iliyosimbwa” humaanisha ufunguo wa RSA wenye biti 4096 mfululizo—yaani safu ya tarakimu 4096 za 0/1—hivyo nafasi ya mchanganyiko unaowezekana ni 2^4096 na kufanya mashambulizi ya nguvu-kupitia kuwa magumu sana ikilinganishwa na funguo fupi kama 2048-bit [5].

Kadiri idadi ya biti inavyoongezeka, kiwango cha usalama hupanda lakini gharama ya kihesabu pia huongezeka; kwa hivyo 4096-bit huonekana kuwa chaguo la “usalama mzuri” kwenye vifaa vya kisasa, ingawa huweza kupunguza kasi ya operesheni takribani mara tano kuliko urefu mfupi wa ufunguo [5].
claims_retained: Bit ni kitengo cha msingi cha data kwenye kompyuta na mawasiliano, na kila moja huwakilisha moja ya hali mbili, 0 au 1 [1].

Kadiri idadi ya biti inavyoongezeka, kiwango cha usalama hupanda lakini gharama ya kihesabu pia huongezeka; kwa hivyo 4096-bit huonekana kuwa chaguo la “usalama mzuri” kwenye vifaa vya kisasa, ingawa huweza kupunguza kasi ya operesheni takribani mara tano kuliko urefu mfupi wa ufunguo [5].

Content: A bit, short for binary digit, is defined as the most basic unit of data in telecommunications and computing. Each bit is represented by either a 1 or a 0 and this can be executed in various systems through a two-state device.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Bit (www.techopedia.com)
Content: A computer not only initiates multiple instructions that can manipulate and test bits, but it also performs these instructions and stores accumulated data in eight-bit parcels called bytes
---
Document ID: 3
Title: What does BIT mean? (www.definitions.net)
Content: The length of a binary number may be referred to as its bit-length. In information theory, one bit is typically defined as the uncertainty of a binary random variable that is 0 or 1 with equal probability
---

Title: Should We Start Using 4096 bit RSA keys? (www.jscape.com)

Document ID: 5
Title: RSA key lengths (www.javamex.com)
Content: * unless you can accept a relatively low level of security and are running on modest hardware, you should generally choose an RSA key length of at least 2048 bits (current NIST recommendation);
* if you are running on recent dedicated hardware and/or require good security, then consider a key size of 4096 bits;
* you could consider higher key lengths, but the performance overhead increase almost exponentially with key length, meaning in practice a doubling of key length makes decryption some 5 times slower

all_claims: Kiwango cha S huonekana kuwa cha juu kwa sababu kilianzia katika mfumo wa upimaji wa masomo wa Japan ambako herufi S inawakilisha “Shū” (秀), neno linalomaanisha “kielelezo” au “bora kabisa,” na huwa linapewa wanafunzi waliopata alama 90 – 100 %—juu ya daraja la A ambalo huanza 80 %—hivyo likachukua nafasi ya cheo cha kipekee kinachoashiria ubora uliozidi kiwango cha kawaida cha “nzuri sana” [3].

Kwa kuwa daraja hili la kipekee lilitofautisha wahitimu wa hali ya juu sana na walioshika A, dhana ya “S” ilienea hadi mifumo mingine ya upangaji, kutoka kwenye orodha za michezo ya video hadi sanaa za mapigano na hata bahati ya viumbe katika sayansi ya uhifadhi, ikitumika kuashiria tabaka la juu au lenye umuhimu wa kipekee kuliko viwango vilivyopo kama A, B, n.k.
Hivyo, historia yake kama cheo adimu cha alama kamilifu ndicho kinachoifanya S ionekane “juu ya A” na kuwa kiashiria cha kilele cha mafanikio katika miktadha mingi.

claim: Katika nusu karne iliyopita, ukuaji wa kiteknolojia umechochewa na Sheria ya Moore, inayodai kuwa idadi ya transistor kwenye mzunguko mmoja huongezeka mara mbili takriban kila baada ya miaka miwili, jambo lililoongeza uwezo wa usindikaji huku gharama ikipungua sana
question_src: Je! Ukuaji wa kiteknolojia umeongezeka vipi katika miaka 50 iliyopita?
all_claims: Katika nusu karne iliyopita, ukuaji wa kiteknolojia umechochewa na Sheria ya Moore, inayodai kuwa idadi ya transistor kwenye mzunguko mmoja huongezeka mara mbili takriban kila baada ya miaka miwili, jambo lililoongeza uwezo wa usindikaji huku gharama ikipungua sana [1].

Tangu Gordon Moore atabiri hili mwaka 1965, sekta imeunda transistor ndogo, za haraka na za bei nafuu, na hivyo kufanya kompyuta ziwe na nguvu zaidi lakini pia ziwe rahisi kumilikiwa na watu wengi [2].

Hatua hii imeongeza ufanisi wa nishati, kupunguza gharama za utengenezaji na kufungua tasnia mpya kama simu janja, uchambuzi wa data kubwa na mitandao ya kijamii, zote zikitegemea kompyuta zenye gharama nafuu na uwezo mkubwa [2].

Mbali na nguvu ya usindikaji, vipengele vingine kama uwezo wa kumbukumbu, kasi ya kuhamisha data na hata idadi ya saizi kwenye kamera za dijiti vimeongezeka kwa kasi sambamba na ongezeko la transistor, vikithibitisha athari ya Sheria ya Moore kwenye nyanja nyingine nyingi za kielektroniki [1].

Kwa jumla, kwa miaka 50 iliyopita tumeona mapinduzi ya dijiti yanayobadilisha jinsi tunavyofanya kazi, kujifunza na kuwasiliana, yote yakisukumwa na kasi hii ya kipekee ya maendeleo ya nusu kondakta [2].
