prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Technological Progress (ourworldindata.org)
Content: Moore’s Law is the observation that the number of transistors on integrated circuits doubles approximately every two years. This aspect of technological progress is important as the capabilities of many digital electronic devices are strongly linked to Moore’s Law. Below I will show how aspects as diverse as processing speed, product price, memory capacity, and even the number and size of pixels in digital cameras have also been progressing exponentially.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Over 50 Years of Moore's Law (www.intel.com)
Content: In 1965, Gordon Moore made a prediction that would set the pace for our modern digital revolution. From careful observation of an emerging trend, Moore extrapolated that computing would dramatically increase in power, and decrease in relative cost, at an exponential pace. The insight, known as Moore’s Law, became the golden rule for the electronics industry, and a springboard for innovation. As a co-founder, Gordon paved the path for Intel to make the ever faster, smaller, more affordable transistors that drive our modern tools and toys. Even over 50 years later, the lasting impact and benefits are felt in many ways.


### Economic Impact


### Economic Impact


Performance—aka power—and cost are two key drivers of technological development. As more transistors fit into smaller spaces, processing power increased and energy efficiency improved, all at a lower cost for the end user. This development not only enhanced existing industries and increased productivity, but it has spawned whole new industries empowered by cheap and powerful computing.


### Technological Impact


### Technological Impact


Moore’s observation transformed computing from a rare and expensive venture into a pervasive and affordable necessity. All of the modern computing technology we know and enjoy sprang from the foundation laid by Moore’s Law. From the Internet itself, to social media and modern data analytics, all these innovations stem directly from Moore and his findings.


### Societal Impact


### Societal Impact


The inexpensive, ubiquitous computing rapidly expanding all around us is fundamentally changing the way we work, play and communicate. The foundational force of Moore’s Law has driven breakthroughs in modern cities, transportation, healthcare, education, and energy production.
---

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Technological Progress (ourworldindata.org)
Content: Moore’s Law is the observation that the number of transistors on integrated circuits doubles approximately every two years. This aspect of technological progress is important as the capabilities of many digital electronic devices are strongly linked to Moore’s Law. Below I will show how aspects as diverse as processing speed, product price, memory capacity, and even the number and size of pixels in digital cameras have also been progressing exponentially.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Over 50 Years of Moore's Law (www.intel.com)
Content: In 1965, Gordon Moore made a prediction that would set the pace for our modern digital revolution. From careful observation of an emerging trend, Moore extrapolated that computing would dramatically increase in power, and decrease in relative cost, at an exponential pace. The insight, known as Moore’s Law, became the golden rule for the electronics industry, and a springboard for innovation. As a co-founder, Gordon paved the path for Intel to make the ever faster, smaller, more affordable transistors that drive our modern tools and toys. Even over 50 years later, the lasting impact and benefits are felt in many ways.


### Economic Impact


### Economic Impact


Performance—aka power—and cost are two key drivers of technological development. As more transistors fit into smaller spaces, processing power increased and energy efficiency improved, all at a lower cost for the end user. This development not only enhanced existing industries and increased productivity, but it has spawned whole new industries empowered by cheap and powerful computing.


### Technological Impact


### Technological Impact


Moore’s observation transformed computing from a rare and expensive venture into a pervasive and affordable necessity. All of the modern computing technology we know and enjoy sprang from the foundation laid by Moore’s Law. From the Internet itself, to social media and modern data analytics, all these innovations stem directly from Moore and his findings.


### Societal Impact


### Societal Impact


The inexpensive, ubiquitous computing rapidly expanding all around us is fundamentally changing the way we work, play and communicate. The foundational force of Moore’s Law has driven breakthroughs in modern cities, transportation, healthcare, education, and energy production.
---

claim: Aidha, ikiwa mwezi au kometi hupita ndani ya mpaka huo, mvutano wa mawimbi ya sayari kubwa huuvunja na mabaki yake yanaumba pete nyingine
question_src: Kwa nini sayari zingine huunda pete wakati zingine huunda mwezi?
all_claims: Tofauti kati ya pete na miezi inategemea umbali wa nyenzo kutoka kwa sayari na nguvu za mvutano.

Wakati wa kutokea kwa mfumo wa jua, vumbi na barafu vilivyokuwa karibu sana na sayari vilishindwa kung’ana kuwa mwili mmoja kwa sababu mvuto wa sayari ulikuwa mkubwa, hivyo chembe hizo zilibaki zikizunguka kama pete nyembamba badala ya kuzalisha mwezi thabiti [1].
Nyenzo iliyowekwa mbali kidogo—nje ya mpaka unaoitwa Roche limit—iliweza kuungana na kuunda miezi ya kawaida tunayoiona leo [2].
Aidha, ikiwa mwezi au kometi hupita ndani ya mpaka huo, mvutano wa mawimbi ya sayari kubwa huuvunja na mabaki yake yanaumba pete nyingine [2].

Sayari kubwa za nje kama Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus na Neptune zilikuwa na diski baridi ya vumbi na barafu na hivyo zikapata vifaa vingi vya kuunda pete huku sehemu ya mbali ya diski ikiunda miezi nyingi nje ya Roche limit [3].
Kwa upande mwingine, sayari za ndani ziko karibu sana na Jua kiasi kwamba barafu huyeyuka na pete za aina hiyo haziwezi kudumu [1].
claims_retained: Aidha, ikiwa mwezi au kometi hupita ndani ya mpaka huo, mvutano wa mawimbi ya sayari kubwa huuvunja na mabaki yake yanaumba pete nyingine [2].

Kwa upande mwingine, sayari za ndani ziko karibu sana na Jua kiasi kwamba barafu huyeyuka na pete za aina hiyo haziwezi kudumu [1].
prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: UCSB Science Line (scienceline.ucsb.edu)
Content: There's actually still scientific dispute about the exact answer to this question. The solar system formed from a giant cloud of gas and particles (literally stardust--the remains of a star that had exploded) billions of years ago. The "dust" clumped together to form the planets. Some of the leftover dust formed the moons of the planets (although the origin of Earth's moon is still up for debate). Some of this dust was too close to the planet to form stable moons, and instead formed rings. It is likely that large rings couldn't form on inner planets (Mercury, Venus, Earth, Mars) because the rings are made of frozen icy dust, and the sun is too hot this close to it for the rings to form.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Curiosities: Why do some planets have rings? (news.wisc.edu)
Content: “There are various theories about planetary rings, like the fantastic rings around Saturn, but we cannot say for sure how they are formed,” explains Lattis.


One theory is that the rings formed at the same time as the planet and its major moons. In this case, if material is close to the planet, the planet’s gravitational pull is too strong to coalesce into a moon and the particles that would otherwise form a moon spread out in orbit around the planet as a ring.


Another idea is that a close call by a moon or comet results in the planet’s gravitational tidal force breaking up those bodies, the debris of which then becomes a ring system.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Deanna Rostic, St. Catharines, Ontario, Canada (astronomy.com)
Content: The larger volume of space and lower gravity of the Sun in the giant-planet region allowed Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, and Neptune to form like solar systems in miniature. We think each of them pulled in lots of material and had a disk of gas, dust, and ice surrounding it during formation. Any dust and ice not incorporated into the planet itself would have coalesced into the regular moons we see today around the giant planets. These satellites are in nearly circular orbits near the equators of their host planets, such as the four Galilean satellites around Jupiter and Titan around Saturn, which are all composed of large fractions of ice.


Because the giant planets gravitationally dominate a very large area, they also can efficiently capture passing objects as moons, which we call irregular satellites. These irregular moons are relatively small and have orbits with large inclinations, eccentricities, and semimajor axes.


In contrast, the terrestrial planets formed much closer to the Sun with much less material around them. They grew slowly by accreting many small rocky planetesimals and never grew massive enough to capture a disk of gas and dust. Earth’s Moon probably formed through a direct collision. Any large object striking a planet would have thrown material off the world into orbit, allowing it to coalesce into a moon.
---

In this case, if material is close to the planet, the planet’s gravitational pull is too strong to coalesce into a moon and the particles that would otherwise form a moon spread out in orbit around the planet as a ring.


Another idea is that a close call by a moon or comet results in the planet’s gravitational tidal force breaking up those bodies, the debris of which then becomes a ring system.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Deanna Rostic, St. Catharines, Ontario, Canada (astronomy.com)
Content: The larger volume of space and lower gravity of the Sun in the giant-planet region allowed Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, and Neptune to form like solar systems in miniature. We think each of them pulled in lots of material and had a disk of gas, dust, and ice surrounding it during formation. Any dust and ice not incorporated into the planet itself would have coalesced into the regular moons we see today around the giant planets. These satellites are in nearly circular orbits near the equators of their host planets, such as the four Galilean satellites around Jupiter and Titan around Saturn, which are all composed of large fractions of ice.


Because the giant planets gravitationally dominate a very large area, they also can efficiently capture passing objects as moons, which we call irregular satellites. These irregular moons are relatively small and have orbits with large inclinations, eccentricities, and semimajor axes.


In contrast, the terrestrial planets formed much closer to the Sun with much less material around them. They grew slowly by accreting many small rocky planetesimals and never grew massive enough to capture a disk of gas and dust. Earth’s Moon probably formed through a direct collision. Any large object striking a planet would have thrown material off the world into orbit, allowing it to coalesce into a moon.
---

question_src: Je! Kwa nini Clown nyekundu alichaguliwa kuwa mascot ya McDonalds?
all_claims: Clown mwekundu, anayeitwa Ronald McDonald, alichaguliwa kuwa mascot wa McDonald’s baada ya mtendaji wa matangazo Barry Klein kutambua kwamba kufutwa kwa kipindi maarufu cha televisheni Bozo The Clown mwaka 1963 kumeacha pengo la burudani kwa watoto, hivyo akapendekeza kampuni itengeneze clown wake mwenyewe ili kuendeleza mvuto huo na kuvutia wateja wachanga kupitia matangazo ya runinga [1].

Klein alimletea mradi huo Willard Scott—ambaye tayari alikuwa ameigiza Bozo—ili achukue nafasi ya “Ronald McDonald, The Hamburger-appy Clown,” akivaa pua iliyotengenezwa na kikombe cha McDonald na kofia ya treyi ya chakula, hivyo kuunganisha moja kwa moja vichekesho vya clown na bidhaa za mgahawa na kuimarisha utambulisho wa chapa [1].
Uamuzi huo uliweka uso wa kirafiki, mchangamfu na wenye rangi nyekundu ang’avu ili kuwavutia watoto, kuongeza utambuzi wa chapa na kuhamasisha mauzo kupitia uhusiano wa kihisia.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: The Real Reason Ronald McDonald Is the McDonald’s Mascot (www.rd.com)
Content: Bozo the Clown was the star of several television shows during the 1950s, ‘60s, and ‘70s (the character was a franchise, so local TV stations across the country could produce their own Bozo-themed shows—fitting, since McDonald’s would also find success through franchises). At the time, advertising executive Barry Klein worked with the Bozo show in Washington, D.C. and a local McDonald’s franchise, so he convinced the McDonald’s to run commercials during the show, the Baltimore Sun reports.

Unfortunately, the show was canceled in 1963, but Klein saw an opportunity to capitalize on Bozo’s popularity: McDonald’s could create their own clown. Klein brought the actor who had played Bozo, Willard Scott, onto the project, and soon the clown came to life. His nose was a McDonald’s cup, his hat a food tray holding a fake burger, bag of fries, and milkshake. He could even pull hamburgers from his belt. His name? Ronald McDonald, the Hamburger-Happy Clown.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: The Real Reason the McDonald's Logo Is Yellow and Red (www.rd.com)
Content: The colors red and yellow were chosen for a specific reason—and no, it wasn’t because they looked nice with Ronald McDonald’s clown-like face. It actually has to do with science. The color red is stimulating and is associated with being active. It also increases heart rate, which helps to jumpstart your appetite. The color yellow is associated with happiness and is the most visible color in daylight, so that’s why a McDonald’s logo is so easy to spot on a crowded road.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Ronald McDonald (mcdonalds.fandom.com)
Content: The origin of Ronald McDonald involves Willard Scott (at the time, a local radio personality who also played Bozo the Clown from 1959 until 1962), who performed using the name "Ronald McDonald, the Hamburger-Happy Clown" in 1963 on three separate television spots. These were the first three television advertisements featuring the character.

There have been online disputes over Ronald McDonald's original origins with several people claming stories other than Willard Scott's which has a proven reliable source. They started in the late 2000's on several websites.
---

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Why Is The Solar System Flat? (www.scienceabc.com)
Content: The flatness of our solar system can be ascribed to the law of conservation of total angular momentum. Due to this, whenever particles collide, they may move in any direction, but all the up and down motion cancels out, always following the rule that the total spin in that plane must be constant.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Why is the Solar System flat? – How It Works (www.howitworksdaily.com)
Content: This is due to a rule known as the conservation of angular momentum – the total amount of spinning in any isolated system, such as the Solar System, will always remain constant. This allowed the cloud to flatten over time, losing its height and becoming the roughly two-dimensional disc we see today.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Discover how the solar system, which started as a shapeless spherical blob ended up being flat (www.britannica.com)
Content: As the particles bump into each other, all the up and down motion tends to cancel out, it's energy lost in crashing and clumping. Yet, the whole mass must continue spinning, inexorably, because in our universe, the total amount of spinning in any isolated system always stays the same. So over time, through collisions and crashes, the cloud loses its loft and flattens into a spinning, roughly two dimensional, disk shape, like a solar system or spiral galaxy.
---

question_src: Je! Kwa nini magari mengi yanaelekeza katika safu ya 6,250-6,500 rpm: kamwe chini, mara chache juu?
all_claims: Magari mengi ya uzalishaji huwekewa redline ya takribani 6,250-6,500 rpm kwa sababu hiyo ndiyo sehemu ya juu ya kasi ya mzunguko ambayo watengenezaji wameithibitisha kuwa salama katika matumizi ya kila siku bila kuathiri kudumu kwa injini, na kikao hicho hufafanuliwa moja kwa moja kwenye tachometer kama kikomo kilichojaribiwa na kuthibitishwa [1].

Kiwango hicho pia kiko ndani ya wigo wa jumla wa injini za kawaida za magari, ambazo huweza kufikia kasi ya juu kati ya 4,000 na 7,000 rpm kulingana na teknolojia ya mwako, hivyo 6,500 rpm huwa karibu na makubwa ya kimaumbile ya miundo mingi ya sasa [3].

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Redlining a Car: 3 Common Automotive Myths Debunked (knowhow.napaonline.com)
Content: The redline on your car’s tachometer is there to indicate the maximum safe rotational speed of the motor, measured in revolutions per minute. The key word here is safe. This is the limit that the manufacturer has tested and found to be perfectly fine in regular operation. Running an engine up to that point will in no way damage it.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Revolutions per minute (en.wikipedia.org)
Content: Modern automobile engines are typically operated around 2,000–3,000 rpm (33–50 Hz) when cruising, with a minimum (idle) speed around 750–900 rpm (12.5–15 Hz), and an upper limit anywhere from 4500 to 10,000 rpm (75–166 Hz) for a road car, or nearly (sometimes over) 20,000 rpm for racing engines such as those in Formula 1 cars (during the 2006 season, with the 2.4 L N/A V8 engine configuration; currently limited to 15,000 rpm, with the 1.6 L V6 turbo-hybrid engine configuration).
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Measurements at 36,000 RPM (www.fst.com)
Content: While the internal combustion engines in cars today reach a maximum rotational speed between 4,000 and 7,000 rpm, depending on the combustion process, the figure for electric motors is significantly higher. Today electric motors for series production vehicles reach a maximum rotational speed of more than 20,000 rpm.

Kiwango hicho pia kiko ndani ya wigo wa jumla wa injini za kawaida za magari, ambazo huweza kufikia kasi ya juu kati ya 4,000 na 7,000 rpm kulingana na teknolojia ya mwako, hivyo 6,500 rpm huwa karibu na makubwa ya kimaumbile ya miundo mingi ya sasa [3].
prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Redlining a Car: 3 Common Automotive Myths Debunked (knowhow.napaonline.com)
Content: The redline on your car’s tachometer is there to indicate the maximum safe rotational speed of the motor, measured in revolutions per minute. The key word here is safe. This is the limit that the manufacturer has tested and found to be perfectly fine in regular operation. Running an engine up to that point will in no way damage it.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Revolutions per minute (en.wikipedia.org)
Content: Modern automobile engines are typically operated around 2,000–3,000 rpm (33–50 Hz) when cruising, with a minimum (idle) speed around 750–900 rpm (12.5–15 Hz), and an upper limit anywhere from 4500 to 10,000 rpm (75–166 Hz) for a road car, or nearly (sometimes over) 20,000 rpm for racing engines such as those in Formula 1 cars (during the 2006 season, with the 2.4 L N/A V8 engine configuration; currently limited to 15,000 rpm, with the 1.6 L V6 turbo-hybrid engine configuration).
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Measurements at 36,000 RPM (www.fst.com)
Content: While the internal combustion engines in cars today reach a maximum rotational speed between 4,000 and 7,000 rpm, depending on the combustion process, the figure for electric motors is significantly higher. Today electric motors for series production vehicles reach a maximum rotational speed of more than 20,000 rpm.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Can you disable a surveillance camera with an infrared laser? (www.a1securitycameras.com)
Content: Unfortunately, the answer is yes and it applies to all surveillance cameras. If the criminals using infrared illuminator, powerful LED torch light or even a reflective board, the camera cannot catch the image during the nighttime.


Infra Red lasers can blind your camera for sure, but the criminals must have a perfect aim of the camera lens to do this. So using dome cameras with shaded/smoked glasses will make it very hard to target the lenses.


Also keep it in mind, this lasers work best at total darkness while your cameras using IR lenses. You might close the IR and have the camera stay color and use some lighting to avoid this.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: ILDA - Laser damage to cameras and sensors (ilda.com)
Content: However, there are no MPEs for sensors such as CMOS or CCD chips. This means a show may be perfectly safe for eyes, but could possibly damage a camera sensor. One reason is that camera lenses may gather more laser light, and concentrate it to a finer point. Another reason is that a CMOS or CCD sensor may be more easily damaged than the eye.


Due to the many varying factors involved with lenses and sensors, laser show producers cannot be responsible for audience-member damage to cameras or camcorders.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Laser Pointer Safety - Laser effects on cameras, camcorders and DLPs (www.laserpointersafety.com)
Content: Lasers emit concentrated beams of light, which can heat up sensitive surfaces (like the eye's retina) and cause damage. Camera sensors are, in general, more susceptible to damage than the human eye.


For large scale shows such as televised concerts, laser show producers work with clients to avoid TV camera locations and video projectors (ILDA Members, see this page for details; login required). However, it is not possible for laser show producers to be responsible for all cameras, smartphones and camcorders which might be used at a show.


Tips for audience members with cameras when lasers are in use




If you attend a laser show as an audience member, you should take reasonable precautions not to let a laser beam DIRECTLY enter your camera lens.


* You can photograph the beams in midair, or doing graphics on a screen. If you can't see the laser source (projector output aperture or bounce mirror) in your viewfinder, this means you're not getting the full beam power into your lens. Indirect viewing like this should not cause damage.




* Avoid beams which are coming straight into your lens (or bounced off a mirror or other reflective surface and then into your lens). The damage potential is much greater when the entire beam power enters the camera lens.


Degree of camera damage




The degree of damage can vary widely.


* We have seen cases of minor damage, such as small areas of a few pixels which no longer work. The pixels are not noticeable unless in an area of uniform color such as a blue sky.




* In more extreme cases, there may be larger or more extensive dead-pixel areas. Or there may be "burn in" of a laser image. The damage is readily noticeable in most photos or videos. In this case, the camera is ruined for quality use. The image below shows numerous laser-
---

claim: Hata hivyo, kwa sababu nishati ya jua na upepo hubadilika na haiwezi kuwashwa au kuzimwa papo hapo, uwekezaji mkubwa katika hifadhi—kama vile betri, pampu za maji, na hidrojeni—unaongezeka kuwa nyenzo kuu ili nishati isipotee na kuhakikisha upatikanaji wa umeme saa zote
question_src: 100% nishati endelevu
all_claims: Ili kufikia mfumo wa nishati ambao unategemea 100 % vyanzo endelevu, tunahitaji kuchanganya uzalishaji wa jua, upepo na miundombinu ya kuhifadhi umeme ili kusawazisha utofauti wa uzalishaji na mahitaji ya watumiaji [1].
Paneli bora za jua kwa sasa hubadili karibu 23 % ya mwanga kuwa umeme, hivyo kuongeza ufanisi na kupanua maeneo ya PV ni muhimu [5].

Kwa upande mwingine, turbine za upepo hubadilisha takriban 50 % ya nishati ya upepo iliyokamatwa kuwa umeme, na uwezo wao kufanya kazi usiku humpa upepo faida ya kupunguza pengo la uzalishaji wakati jua halipo [5].
Kizazi hiki cha usiku husaidia kukabiliana na changamoto ya kutokuwepo kwa mwanga wa mchana na kupunguza kutokubaliana kwa mfumo [6].

Hata hivyo, kwa sababu nishati ya jua na upepo hubadilika na haiwezi kuwashwa au kuzimwa papo hapo, uwekezaji mkubwa katika hifadhi—kama vile betri, pampu za maji, na hidrojeni—unaongezeka kuwa nyenzo kuu ili nishati isipotee na kuhakikisha upatikanaji wa umeme saa zote [1].
Mfumo huu utahitaji pia sera thabiti, uboreshaji wa gridi na ushirikiano wa kimikoa na kiteknolojia ili kutimiza lengo la 100 % nishati mbadala.
claims_retained: Hata hivyo, kwa sababu nishati ya jua na upepo hubadilika na haiwezi kuwashwa au kuzimwa papo hapo, uwekezaji mkubwa katika hifadhi—kama vile betri, pampu za maji, na hidrojeni—unaongezeka kuwa nyenzo kuu ili nishati isipotee na kuhakikisha upatikanaji wa umeme saa zote [1].
prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: The U.S. can be powered 100% by renewable energy. How do we get there? (pv-magazine-usa.com)
Content: The sun shines, the wind blows — until it doesn’t. On the flip side, sometimes it’s too sunny out, or too windy. This leads to large spikes in power that dip way below and rise way above consumer energy demand. However, because renewable energy is variable, it can’t be dispatched, meaning it can’t be turned on and off. If the energy can’t be absorbed into the supply or transmitted along the line, it’s wasted.


One of the best ways to make sure VRE is not wasted? Store it.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Wind Energy (www.nationalgeographic.org)
Content: The wind blows the blades of the turbine, which are attached to a rotor. The rotor then spins a generator to create electricity.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: solar energy (www.nationalgeographic.org)
Content: About 30% of the solar energy that reaches Earth is reflected back into space. The rest is absorbed into Earth’s atmosphere.
---
Document ID: 4
Title: solar energy (www.nationalgeographic.org)
Content: Active solar technologies use electrical or mechanical devices to actively convert solar energy into another form of energy, most often heat or electricity. Passive solar technologies do not use any external devices. Instead, they take advantage of the local climate to heat structures during the winter, and reflect heat during the summer.
---
Document ID: 5
Title: Which Energy is More Efficient Solar or Wind Energy? - Verde Energy (www.verdeenergy.com)
Content: The most efficient solar panels can capture and convert about 23% of sunlight into energy. Not bad, but wind turbines turn roughly 50% of captured wind into energy.
---
Document ID: 6
Title: Which Energy is More Efficient Solar or Wind Energy? - Verde Energy (www.verdeenergy.com)
Content: Wind may not be as abundant and consistent as sunlight, but turbines can catch a breeze at any time of day. This nighttime energy generation gives wind turbines a serious advantage over solar panels and helps offset issues of inconsistency.

question_src: Je! Kwa nini mashambulio ya DDOS yaliyokuzwa hayawezekani kupunguza?
all_claims: Mashambulio ya DDOS yaliyokuzwa ni magumu kupunguza kwa sababu hutegemea idadi kubwa ya vifaa vilivyoathirika kushambulia lengwa kwa pamoja, jambo linalofanya trafiki iwe kubwa kuliko uwezo wa miundombinu ya kawaida kuhimili [1].

Response: Kwa sababu ya mabadiliko haya, risasi nyingi za mafua hulenga upya protini za uso za virusi [

claim: Mfumo wa neva wa uhuru huendesha “mzunguko wa pua” kwa kusababisha mishipa ya damu kwenye turbinati kufura upande mmoja na kusinyaa upande mwingine, hivyo kuziba pua moja kwa takribani saa 3–6 kisha kubadilisha upande bila hiari yako
question_src: Ikiwa pua iliyozuiwa inasababishwa na uchochezi basi blockage inabadilisha vipi pande kwa uhuru?
all_claims: Mfumo wa neva wa uhuru huendesha “mzunguko wa pua” kwa kusababisha mishipa ya damu kwenye turbinati kufura upande mmoja na kusinyaa upande mwingine, hivyo kuziba pua moja kwa takribani saa 3–6 kisha kubadilisha upande bila hiari yako [1].
Wakati uchochezi—kama ule wa mafua au mzio—unapoongeza uvimbe na ute, huupakia tu upande unaofura lakini hauzuii amri za neva zinazoendelea kubadilisha mtiririko wa damu.

Matokeo yake, uvimbe uliokithiri huhamia upande ambao neva zimeamuru ufurike, huku ule uliopunguzwa ukitoa nafasi kidogo ya kupumua; hivyo mtu huhisi “kuhama” kwa kuziba, ingawa mchakato ni mwendelezo wa mzunguko wa kawaida.

Hivyo, hata pua ikichochewa, kubadilishana huku kunaendelea kwa sababu mwili huendelea “kugawa rasilimali” za kupasha na kunyunyiza hewa kwa zamu kati ya pande za pua ili kulinda mapafu na kufanya kazi kwa ufanisi [2].
claims_retained: Mfumo wa neva wa uhuru huendesha “mzunguko wa pua” kwa kusababisha mishipa ya damu kwenye turbinati kufura upande mmoja na kusinyaa upande mwingine, hivyo kuziba pua moja kwa takribani saa 3–6 kisha kubadilisha upande bila hiari yako [1].

Hivyo, hata pua ikichochewa, kubadilishana huku kunaendelea kwa sababu mwili huendelea “kugawa rasilimali” za kupasha na kunyunyiza hewa kwa zamu kati ya pande za pua ili kulinda mapafu na kufanya kazi kwa ufanisi [2].
prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Here's The Frustrating Reason Only One Side of Your Nose Gets Blocked at a Time (www.sciencealert.com)
Content: During the day, the sides switch and the other nostril goes into 'work mode', but why?


This process is automated by the aptly named autonomic nervous system, which is the same system that controls many things your body does all by itself such as digestion and heart rate.


For your nose, this system controls your 'nasal cycle', so that each nostril operates effectively.


The nasal cycle happens, according to the US National Library of Medicine, several times during the day, and is only brought to your attention if your nose is clogged up more than usual.


In order to open one side of your nose and close the other, your body inflates tissue with blood in the same way that a man gets an erection, except, you know, in your nose.


"Increased blood flow causes congestion in one nostril for about 3 to 6 hours before switching to the other side. There is also increased congestion when one is lying down, which can be especially noticeable when the head is turned to one side," Jennifer Shu reports for CNN.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: The Science Behind Why Only One Nostril Clogs When You’re Sick (www.menshealth.com)
Content: Structures in both sides of your nose called inferior turbinates are responsible for warming and humidifying air before it reaches your lungs, says Dr. Roditi. This protects your lungs by reducing dryness and irritation.


That process is a lot of work. So your nose funnels its resources more to one side than the other to make the process more efficient.
---

all_claims: Mfumo wa neva wa uhuru huendesha “mzunguko wa pua” kwa kusababisha mishipa ya damu kwenye turbinati kufura upande mmoja na kusinyaa upande mwingine, hivyo kuziba pua moja kwa takribani saa 3–6 kisha kubadilisha upande bila hiari yako [1].
Wakati uchochezi—kama ule wa mafua au mzio—unapoongeza uvimbe na ute, huupakia tu upande unaofura lakini hauzuii amri za neva zinazoendelea kubadilisha mtiririko wa damu.

Matokeo yake, uvimbe uliokithiri huhamia upande ambao neva zimeamuru ufurike, huku ule uliopunguzwa ukitoa nafasi kidogo ya kupumua; hivyo mtu huhisi “kuhama” kwa kuziba, ingawa mchakato ni mwendelezo wa mzunguko wa kawaida.

Hivyo, hata pua ikichochewa, kubadilishana huku kunaendelea kwa sababu mwili huendelea “kugawa rasilimali” za kupasha na kunyunyiza hewa kwa zamu kati ya pande za pua ili kulinda mapafu na kufanya kazi kwa ufanisi [2].
claims_retained: Mfumo wa neva wa uhuru huendesha “mzunguko wa pua” kwa kusababisha mishipa ya damu kwenye turbinati kufura upande mmoja na kusinyaa upande mwingine, hivyo kuziba pua moja kwa takribani saa 3–6 kisha kubadilisha upande bila hiari yako [1].

Hivyo, hata pua ikichochewa, kubadilishana huku kunaendelea kwa sababu mwili huendelea “kugawa rasilimali” za kupasha na kunyunyiza hewa kwa zamu kati ya pande za pua ili kulinda mapafu na kufanya kazi kwa ufanisi [2].
prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Here's The Frustrating Reason Only One Side of Your Nose Gets Blocked at a Time (www.sciencealert.com)
Content: During the day, the sides switch and the other nostril goes into 'work mode', but why?


This process is automated by the aptly named autonomic nervous system, which is the same system that controls many things your body does all by itself such as digestion and heart rate.


For your nose, this system controls your 'nasal cycle', so that each nostril operates effectively.


The nasal cycle happens, according to the US National Library of Medicine, several times during the day, and is only brought to your attention if your nose is clogged up more than usual.


In order to open one side of your nose and close the other, your body inflates tissue with blood in the same way that a man gets an erection, except, you know, in your nose.


"Increased blood flow causes congestion in one nostril for about 3 to 6 hours before switching to the other side. There is also increased congestion when one is lying down, which can be especially noticeable when the head is turned to one side," Jennifer Shu reports for CNN.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: The Science Behind Why Only One Nostril Clogs When You’re Sick (www.menshealth.com)
Content: Structures in both sides of your nose called inferior turbinates are responsible for warming and humidifying air before it reaches your lungs, says Dr. Roditi. This protects your lungs by reducing dryness and irritation.


That process is a lot of work. So your nose funnels its resources more to one side than the other to make the process more efficient.
---

question_src: Je! Nne kubwa hufanya nini?
all_claims: Nne Kubwa—Deloitte, PwC, KPMG na Ernst & Young—kazi yao kuu ni kukagua taarifa za fedha za maelfu ya kampuni, zikiwamo nyingi katika fahirisi ya S&P 500, ili kutoa hakikisho la uaminifu wa taarifa hizo kwa wawekezaji na wadhibiti [2].

Mbali na ukaguzi, makampuni haya hutoa huduma za ushauri na miamala kama vile tathmini na uratibu wa ununuzi na muunganisho wa biashara (M&A), uundaji wa miundo ya kifedha na uchambuzi wa hesabu kupitia vitengo vyao vya Transaction Advisory Services (TAS) [1].
Aidha yana mashirika makubwa ya ushuru yanayosaidia wateja kupanga na kutekeleza mikakati ya kodi [1].
Sehemu zao za ushauri wa biashara na hatari hushughulikia utafiti wa soko, usimamizi wa hatari, na ushauri wa kisheria au uhakikisho wa kiutawala, kisheria na udhibiti [2].
Vilevile, wahasibu wa uchunguzi (forensic) ndani ya Nne Kubwa huchunguza rekodi za kifedha na kutoa ushahidi wa kitaalamu kwenye kesi za mahakamani [1].
Kwa ukubwa na uwekezaji mkubwa katika uajiri na mafunzo, mashirika haya hutumika kama mamlaka inayoongoza katika masoko mengi ya kimataifa na sekta mbalimbali [3].

Document ID: 2
Title: What Are the Big Four? (www.investopedia.com)
Content: * The "Big Four" refers to the four largest accounting firms in the United States.
* These four firms audit the financial statements for the vast majority of companies in the S&P 500.
* In addition to their auditing services, the Big Four also provides consulting, valuation, market research, assurance, and legal advisory services.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: What Are the Big Four? (www.investopedia.com)
Content: With 360-degree views of companies and industries, the Big Four are authorities in the business. They have extensive recruiting and training programs for fresh graduates and sought-after passageways for tax and consulting professionals to and from many industrial sectors.
---
Document ID: 4
Title: Reforming the Big Four (www.economist.com)
Content: Past reforms banned them from providing both an audit and certain consulting services to the same client, but conflicts of interest remain.
---
Document ID: 5
Title: Reforming the Big Four (www.economist.com)
Content: Many countries tightened the rules after a scandal in 2001 sank Enron, an energy-trading firm, and its auditor, Arthur Andersen. In America the number of accounts that are restated because of a material error has fallen sharply over the past decade.
---
Document ID: 6
Title: Reforming the Big Four (www.economist.com)
Content: Instead regulators should sharpen tools that are already available in Europe. They could lower the cap on non-audit fees charged to an audit client from today’s generous level of 70% of the audit fee. Under rules introduced in 2016, British companies with the same auditor for ten years must re-tender; they are forced to rotate after 20. Such rules look draconian to American eyes, where the average auditor tenure for the first 21 companies in the Dow Jones Industrial Average to have made disclosures this year is a cosy 66 years. New research finds that auditors are most likely to find misstatements early in their tenure; by the tenth year, the benefits of a fresh pair of eyes are lost. Academics also find that the Big Four’s fees rise with tenure. Even Britain’s 20-year limit is too long.


Auditors in many countries are already required to add flesh to the bare bones of the audit opinion. That is to be encouraged. Transparency over the main points of contention with management, and the size of revisions made to the accounts as a result of scrutiny, would cast light on auditors’ successes, not just their failures. And that in turn would help investors to assess auditors’ performance.

Content: Instead regulators should sharpen tools that are already available in Europe. They could lower the cap on non-audit fees charged to an audit client from today’s generous level of 70% of the audit fee. Under rules introduced in 2016, British companies with the same auditor for ten years must re-tender; they are forced to rotate after 20. Such rules look draconian to American eyes, where the average auditor tenure for the first 21 companies in the Dow Jones Industrial Average to have made disclosures this year is a cosy 66 years. New research finds that auditors are most likely to find misstatements early in their tenure; by the tenth year, the benefits of a fresh pair of eyes are lost. Academics also find that the Big Four’s fees rise with tenure. Even Britain’s 20-year limit is too long.


Auditors in many countries are already required to add flesh to the bare bones of the audit opinion. That is to be encouraged. Transparency over the main points of contention with management, and the size of revisions made to the accounts as a result of scrutiny, would cast light on auditors’ successes, not just their failures. And that in turn would help investors to assess auditors’ performance.

question_src: Sote tunajua safari nyepesi husafiri maili 186,282 kwa sekunde. Lakini inasafiri vipi. Ni nini kinachotoa msukumo wake kwa kasi hiyo? Na kwa nini husafiri badala ya kukaa tu kwenye chanzo chake?
all_claims: Mwanga ni wimbi la sumaku-umeme linaloundwa na mtikisiko wa chembe iliyoshtakiwa; mtikisiko huo huunda mabadiliko ya uga wa umeme ambao huchochea mara moja uga wa sumaku, kisha uga wa sumaku unaobadilika huchochea tena uga wa umeme, na mfululizo huu wa “kujisukuma” husambaza nishati kutoka kwenye chanzo bila kuhitaji kitu kingine isipokuwa uga wenyewe [1].

Kasi ya ueneaji wake hutokana na sheria za Maxwell: katika utupu, mchangamano maalum wa umeme na sumaku wa anga husababisha mawimbi yote ya aina hii kusafiri kwa kasi ile ile—takribani maili 186,282 kwa sekunde—haijalishi ni kwa haraka gani chanzo kilibadilishwa [2].

Pindi tu mtikisiko huo umeundwa, mawimbi haya hutengana na chanzo na, kwa kuwa hakuna msuguano au kunyonya kwenye utupu, hayapotezi nguvu, hivyo yanaweza kusafiri kwa mabilioni ya miaka bila “kurudi” au kusimama [3].
Hivyo, msukumo wa mwanga ni mfululizo unaojirudia wa uga wa umeme na sumaku unaoendelezana, na asili yake ya kujitegemea ndiyo inayoufanya uondoke kwenye chanzo na kuendelea kusafiri.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: How Does Light Travel? (sciencing.com)
Content: In the mid 1800s, Scottish physicist James Clerk Maxwell established that light is a form of electromagnetic energy that travels in waves. The question of how it manages to do so in the absence of a medium is explained by the nature of electromagnetic vibrations. When a charged particle vibrates, it produces an electrical vibration that automatically induces a magnetic one -- physicists often visualize these vibrations occurring in perpendicular planes. The paired oscillations propagate outward from the source; no medium, except for the electromagnetic field that permeates the universe, is required to conduct them.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: UCSB Science Line (scienceline.ucsb.edu)
Content: When I say "waves of electric and magnetic fields," I'm talking about something similar to the waves in the rope. Similar to wiggling the end of the rope, we can change the electric or magnetic field at one point, and that disturbance travels away from us. (One way to change the magnetic field at a point is to hold a magnet there, then wiggle it back and forth.) Unlike the wave in the rope, these waves actually travel away from us in all directions. It turns out that in a vacuum, for example in outer space, these waves travel at exactly the speed of light! It doesn't matter how rapidly the fields wiggle back and forth, they will always travel at the same speed. (In air, the waves go ever so slightly slower than in vacuum, and in glass, they can go only about two-thirds as fast as they would in vacuum, but this is not important right now. From now on, when I talk about the speed of light, I mean the speed of light in a vacuum, and I'm talking about waves traveling in a vacuum.) The conclusion that physicists have drawn from this result is that light consists of waves of electric and magnetic fields. This is a fascinating result: that we learn something about light by studying magnets and electrical currents.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Q & A: Does light travel forever? | Department of Physics (van.physics.illinois.edu)
Content: In contrast, light waves can travel through a vacuum, and do not require a medium. In empty space, the wave does not dissipate (grow smaller) no matter how far it travels, because the wave is not interacting with anything else. This is why light from distant stars can travel through space for billions of light-years and still reach us on earth. However, light can also travel within some materials, like glass and water. In this case, some light is absorbed and lost as heat, just like sound. So, underwater, or in our atmosphere, light will only travel some finite range (which is different depending on the properties of the material it travels through).

question_src: Je! Wanyama hushughulikaje kupata prickles/miiba/splinters nk kwa miguu yao?
all_claims: Wanyama hukabili miiba au vipande vidogo vinavyochoma kwa njia mbili kuu: uzuiaji na uondoaji.

Baadhi ya viumbe, kama vile spiny lobster, huwekeza kwenye kinga ya mwili—miiba inayochomoza kwenye gamba lao inazuia vitu na wanyama wengine kuwachoma, hivyo kupunguza uwezekano wa “splinter” kupenya kabisa kwenye tishu laini [2].

Hata hivyo, ikiwa kilekile kinapenya, wanyama wengi hufuata mkakati wa uondoaji wa moja kwa moja; kwa mfano, katika mbwa huanza kwa kusafisha sehemu iliyoathiriwa kwa maji ya joto yenye sabuni, kisha hutumia koleo au viboreshaji kunyakua na kuvuta splinter, na hatimaye kuosha tena kwa sabuni au dawa ya kuua vijidudu ili kuzuia maambukizi [3].

Endapo chipukizi haitatolewa, mwili kawaida hauivunji wala kuimeza; badala yake, huchochea kinga ya asili na tishu zinazokua taratibu zitalazimisha kisiki hicho kusogezwa na kusukumwa nje ya ngozi kadiri muda unavyopita [4].
Hivyo, kinga ya kimofolojia hupunguza hatari ya majeraha, naye mfumo wa kinga na msaada wa kitabibu (kwa wanyama wanaohudumiwa na binadamu) hutumika kuiondoa miiba inapokwisha kudunga.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Heat death of the universe (en.wikipedia.org)
Content: The heat death of the universe (also known as the Big Chill or Big Freeze)[1] is a theory on the ultimate fate of the universe, which suggests the universe would evolve to a state of no thermodynamic free energy and would therefore be unable to sustain processes that increase entropy. Heat death does not imply any particular absolute temperature; it only requires that temperature differences or other processes may no longer be exploited to perform work. In the language of physics, this is when the universe reaches thermodynamic equilibrium
---
Document ID: 2
Title: What exactly is the heat death of the universe and where can I find out more? (www.physlink.com)
Content: The 'heat-death' of the universe is when the universe has reached a state of maximum entropy. This happens when all available energy (such as from a hot source) has moved to places of less energy (such as a colder source). Once this has happened, no more work can be extracted from the universe.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: What exactly is the heat death of the universe and where can I find out more? (www.physlink.com)
Content: Since heat ceases to flow, no more work can be acquired from heat transfer. This same kind of equilibrium state will also happen with all other forms of energy (mechanical, electrical, etc.). Since no more work can be extracted from the universe at that point, it is effectively dead, especially for the purposes of humankind.
---
Document ID: 4
Title: What is Heat Death? | Space Facts – Astronomy, the Solar System & Outer Space | All About Space Magazine (www.spaceanswers.com)
Content: Entropy, which is the number of ways in which a system can be arranged should never decrease, evolving to a state of maximum disorder (or thermodynamic equilibrium). When this happens, all energy will be evenly distributed throughout the cosmos, leaving no room for any reusable energy or heat to burst into existence.
---
Document ID: 5
Title: What Will Happen to Earth When the Sun Dies? (www.livescience.com)
Content: On the bright side, the sun's luminosity is increasing by a factor of about 10 percent every billion years. The habitable zone, where liquid water can exist on a planet's surface, right now is between about 0.95 and 1.37 times the radius of the Earth's orbit (otherwise known as astronomical units, or AU). That zone will continue to move outward. By the time the sun gets ready to become a red giant, Mars will have been inside the zone for quite some time.

In the language of physics, this is when the universe reaches thermodynamic equilibrium
---
Document ID: 2
Title: What exactly is the heat death of the universe and where can I find out more? (www.physlink.com)
Content: The 'heat-death' of the universe is when the universe has reached a state of maximum entropy. This happens when all available energy (such as from a hot source) has moved to places of less energy (such as a colder source). Once this has happened, no more work can be extracted from the universe.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: What exactly is the heat death of the universe and where can I find out more? (www.physlink.com)
Content: Since heat ceases to flow, no more work can be acquired from heat transfer. This same kind of equilibrium state will also happen with all other forms of energy (mechanical, electrical, etc.). Since no more work can be extracted from the universe at that point, it is effectively dead, especially for the purposes of humankind.
---
Document ID: 4
Title: What is Heat Death? | Space Facts – Astronomy, the Solar System & Outer Space | All About Space Magazine (www.spaceanswers.com)
Content: Entropy, which is the number of ways in which a system can be arranged should never decrease, evolving to a state of maximum disorder (or thermodynamic equilibrium). When this happens, all energy will be evenly distributed throughout the cosmos, leaving no room for any reusable energy or heat to burst into existence.
---
Document ID: 5
Title: What Will Happen to Earth When the Sun Dies? (www.livescience.com)
Content: On the bright side, the sun's luminosity is increasing by a factor of about 10 percent every billion years. The habitable zone, where liquid water can exist on a planet's surface, right now is between about 0.95 and 1.37 times the radius of the Earth's orbit (otherwise known as astronomical units, or AU). That zone will continue to move outward. By the time the sun gets ready to become a red giant, Mars will have been inside the zone for quite some time.
---

claim: Simu ya rununu huanza kazi pale unapoongea, kipaza sauti wake hubadilisha sauti yako ya masafa mbalimbali kuwa ishara dhaifu za umeme
question_src: Je! Simu zinafanyaje kazi?

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: How do cellphones work? (www.explainthatstuff.com)
Content: When you speak into a cellphone, a tiny microphone in the handset converts the up-and-down sounds of your voice into a corresponding up-and-down pattern of electrical signals. A microchip inside the phone turns these signals into strings of numbers. The numbers are packed up into a radio wave and beamed out from the phone's antenna (in some countries, the antenna is called an aerial). The radio wave races through the air at the speed of light until it reaches the nearest cellphone mast.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: How do cellphones work? (www.explainthatstuff.com)
Content: Calls made from a cellphone to another cellphone on the same network travel to their destination by being routed to the base station nearest to the destination phone, and finally to that phone itself.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: How Telephones Work (electronics.howstuffworks.com)
Content: Your voice normally travels over a fiber-optic line to the office of the receiving party, but it may also be transmitted by satellite or by microwave towers.
---
Document ID: 4
Title: How Do Cell Phones Work? – Pong Pulse (pongcase.com)
Content: When you chat with your friend on your cell phone, your phone converts your voice into an electrical signal, which is then transmitted via radio waves to the nearest cell tower. The network of cell towers then relays the radio wave to your friend’s cell phone, which converts it to an electrical signal and then back to sound again
---

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: How Do Gas Pumps “Know” When Your Car’s Tank Is Full? (www.rd.com)
Content: Well, it has to do with the way the gas pump works. When you fill your tank with gas, you’re replacing the air that’s in there. “The more gas goes in, the more air must come out,” explains Jake McKenzie, Content Manager at Auto Accessories Garage. “It comes out through a small pipe located just inside the gas nozzle.”
---
Document ID: 2
Title: How Do Gas Pumps “Know” When Your Car’s Tank Is Full? (www.rd.com)
Content: And pressure has built up in the tank; that pressure is released as the air escapes. McKenzie compares it to holding your thumb over a garden hose: “Blocking part of the hose [increases] the pressure of the water inside, [causing] the water leaving to spray out at an even greater velocity.” When you start to pump gas, the pipe, which has been “blocked” like the hose, releases the air quickly. “This expelled air brings with it a pressure that’s strong enough to hold the valve in the open position,” McKenzie says.


So that’s what happens while you’re filling up your tank. And once it’s full of gas, gasoline, not air, now reaches the pipe inside the nozzle, which evens out the pressure. As McKenzie explains, this creates “a small suctioning force (known as the Venturi effect) that switches the valve to the off position.”
---

Title: Ask a Scholar: What is the True Definition of Latino? by Dario Fernandez-Morera | NAS (www.nas.org)
Content: he Spanish word latino has narrowed its meaning when used in English untranslated as “Latin.” This narrowing was clinched when the United States government adopted the term latino officially in 1997 to complement the English word “Hispanic,” which until then had been used to classify, or rather, attempt to classify, people living in the United States who were Spanish speakers, or belonged to a household where Spanish was spoken, or who were somehow of Spanish heritage, or who self-identified with Spanish ancestry or descent. Now, with the use of the word “Latino,” with a capital, this bureaucratic category has been enlarged to include people of non-Spanish descent if they so wish to be categorized. Basically, anyone who can somehow justify the claim, can now claim to be a “latino” for bureaucratic purposes, and many do so in order to reap various forms of government benefits reserved for particular collectives, or “identity groups.”


In addition, the word Latino now serves to categorize those people who come from Latin America, or descend from people from Latin America, where the spoken language is Spanish, but who are not happy with a noun such as “Hispanic,” which is too redolent of Spain, a country to which many of those formerly categorized as “Hispanics” do not want to be connected. This is the case, for example, of some residents of Mexican descent in the United States, who do not want to be called “Hispanics,” but “Latinos.” One reason given is to have their own collective identity separate from that of other collective identities somehow associated with Spain and its heritage. Another possible reason is a desire to be associated with the Mexica (“Aztec”) culture, which was defeated by the Spaniards, and which is frequently and justifiably extolled for its numerous accomplishments and virtues. Given this desire

question_src: Ikiwa mengi ya kile tunacho ladha imedhamiriwa na harufu, kwa nini mambo kadhaa ambayo yana harufu nzuri (cologne, manukato, sabuni, nk) ladha mbaya? .
all_claims: Ingawa ladha ya mwisho huundwa na ubongo kwa kuchanganya ishara kutoka kwa harufu na ladha, michanganyiko hii hukutana nyuma ya koo baada ya kumeza chakula, si wakati wa kunusa tu [4].
Unapopuliza manukato au cologne, molekuli zake tete hupenya kiraka kidogo cha neuroni za hisia kwenye paa la pua na kutoa harufu nzuri bila kugusa ulimi au kuamsha vipokezi vya ladha [3].

Ikiwa kioevu hicho kingeingia mdomoni, seli za ladha zilizo kwenye buds tano maalum (tamu, chumvi, chachu, uchungu, umami) huchambua kemikali na mara nyingi kugundua uchungu au kuwasha badala ya utamu [4].

Hili hutokea kwa sababu manukato yanategemea alkoholi kali na vimumunyisho vingine vya kemikali vinavyohifadhi bidhaa, ambavyo ni sumu na husababisha hisia kali za uchungu au kuchoma, hata kwa kiasi kidogo kuliko mililita 30 [1].

Viungo hivyo vimebuniwa kuenea hewani ili kunukia vizuri, si kuendana na vipokezi vya ladha; hivyo, vinapokosekana harufu inayoingia njia ya nyuma ya pua wakati wa kumeza, na kuachwa na ishara za kuona uchungu pekee, ladha yake hubaki mbaya licha ya harufu kuvutia [2].

Document ID: 2
Title: Taste and Smell (www.brainfacts.org)
Content: Taste and smell are separate senses with their own receptor organs, yet they are intimately entwined. Tastants, chemicals in foods, are detected by taste buds, which consist of special sensory cells. When stimulated, these cells send signals to specific areas of the brain, which make us conscious of the perception of taste. Similarly, specialized cells in the nose pick up odorants, airborne odor molecules. Odorants stimulate receptor proteins found on hairlike cilia at the tips of the sensory cells, a process that initiates a neural response. Ultimately, messages about taste and smell converge, allowing us to detect the flavors of food.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Taste and Smell (www.brainfacts.org)
Content: Airborne odor molecules, called odorants, are detected by specialized sensory neurons located in a small patch of mucus membrane lining the roof of the nose. Axons of these sensory cells pass through perforations in the overlying bone and enter two elongated olfactory bulbs lying against the underside of the frontal lobe of the brain.
---
Document ID: 4
Title: Taste and Smell | Boundless Biology (courses.lumenlearning.com)
Content: The senses of smell and taste combine at the back of the throat. When you taste something before you smell it, the smell lingers internally up to the nose causing you to smell it. Both smell and taste use chemoreceptors, which essentially means they are both sensing the chemical environment. This chemoreception in regards to taste, occurs via the presence of specialized taste receptors within the mouth that are referred to as taste cells and are bundled together to form taste buds. These taste buds, located in papillae which are found across the tongue, are specific for the five modalities: salt, sweet, sour, bitter and umami. These receptors are activated when their specific stimulus (i.e. sweet or salt molecules) is present and signals to the brain.

claim: Deni la kitaifa la Marekani linaendelea kupanda kwa sababu msingi kwamba serikali ya shirikisho hutumia zaidi kuliko inavyokusanya katika mapato ya kodi mwaka baada ya mwaka, hivyo kuunda nakisi ambazo huongezwa moja kwa moja kwenye deni lililopo ; hali hii imeendelea hata wakati uchumi unaboreka na hakuna vita kubwa, kwa kuwa matumizi yasiyoweza kuepukika kama malipo ya Social Security, Medicare na riba kwenye deni yamekuwa yakikua haraka zaidi kuliko mapato ya kodi.
question_src: Inakuaje ingawa uchumi wa Amerika unafanya vizuri kama ilivyokuwa tangu 2007 na hatuko vitani deni yetu ya kitaifa inaendelea kuongezeka?
all_claims: Deni la kitaifa la Marekani linaendelea kupanda kwa sababu msingi kwamba serikali ya shirikisho hutumia zaidi kuliko inavyokusanya katika mapato ya kodi mwaka baada ya mwaka, hivyo kuunda nakisi ambazo huongezwa moja kwa moja kwenye deni lililopo [1]; hali hii imeendelea hata wakati uchumi unaboreka na hakuna vita kubwa, kwa kuwa matumizi yasiyoweza kuepukika kama malipo ya Social Security, Medicare na riba kwenye deni yamekuwa yakikua haraka zaidi kuliko mapato ya kodi.
Aidha, kipindi cha viwango vya chini vya riba kimeifanya serikali kuona gharama ya kukopa kuwa ndogo, hivyo kuahirisha maamuzi magumu ya kupunguza matumizi au kuongeza mapato.
Ingawa ukuaji wa Pato la Taifa (GDP) huongeza uwezo wa serikali kulipia madeni yake, athari ya deni inategemea uwiano wa deni kwa GDP; endapo deni linakua kasi kuliko uchumi, mzigo hubaki mkubwa [2].

Vilevile, misukumo ya kisiasa ya kupunguza kodi bila kupunguza matumizi, pamoja na programu za kichocheo cha uchumi (stimulus) katika nyakati za misukosuko, huchangia kuendeleza nakisi hata katika miaka ya ukuaji.
Kwa mkusanyiko wa sababu hizi—nakisi sugu, upanuzi wa matumizi ya kijamii na mazingira rafiki ya ukopaji—deni la taifa linaongezeka licha ya uchumi kufanya vizuri na kutokuwepo kwa vita vikubwa.
claims_retained: Deni la kitaifa la Marekani linaendelea kupanda kwa sababu msingi kwamba serikali ya shirikisho hutumia zaidi kuliko inavyokusanya katika mapato ya kodi mwaka baada ya mwaka, hivyo kuunda nakisi ambazo huongezwa moja kwa moja kwenye deni lililopo [1]; hali hii imeendelea hata wakati uchumi unaboreka na hakuna vita kubwa, kwa kuwa matumizi yasiyoweza kuepukika kama malipo ya Social Security, Medicare na riba kwenye deni yamekuwa yakikua haraka zaidi kuliko mapato ya kodi.
Ingawa ukuaji wa Pato la Taifa (GDP) huongeza uwezo wa serikali kulipia madeni yake, athari ya deni inategemea uwiano wa deni kwa GDP; endapo deni linakua kasi kuliko uchumi, mzigo hubaki mkubwa [2].
prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: National Debt (www.investopedia.com)
Content: The national debt level of the United States is a measurement of how much the federal government owes its creditors. Specifically, the national debt is a term referring to the level of federal debt held by the public, as opposed to the debt held by the government itself. Since the U.S. government almost always spends more than it takes in, the national debt continues to rise
---
Document ID: 2
Title: National Debt (www.investopedia.com)
Content: While the debt can be measured in trillions of dollars, it is usually measured as a percentage of gross domestic product (GDP), the debt-to-GDP ratio. That's because as a country's economy grows, the amount of revenue a government can use to pay its debts grows as well.

In addition, a larger economy generally means the country's capital markets will grow and the government can tap them to issue more debt. This means that a country's ability to pay off debt, and the effect that debt might have on the country's economy, is dependent on how large the debt is as a proportion of the overall economy, not the dollar amount
---

Content: The national debt level of the United States is a measurement of how much the federal government owes its creditors. Specifically, the national debt is a term referring to the level of federal debt held by the public, as opposed to the debt held by the government itself. Since the U.S. government almost always spends more than it takes in, the national debt continues to rise
---
Document ID: 2
Title: National Debt (www.investopedia.com)
Content: While the debt can be measured in trillions of dollars, it is usually measured as a percentage of gross domestic product (GDP), the debt-to-GDP ratio. That's because as a country's economy grows, the amount of revenue a government can use to pay its debts grows as well.

In addition, a larger economy generally means the country's capital markets will grow and the government can tap them to issue more debt. This means that a country's ability to pay off debt, and the effect that debt might have on the country's economy, is dependent on how large the debt is as a proportion of the overall economy, not the dollar amount
---

claim: Sabuni hutengenezwa kwa kuchanganya mafuta na lye, na molekuli zake za surfactant huvunja mafuta na uchafu, kuyaweka kwenye micelles yanayoshwashwa na maji, hivyo kuondoa “karibu kila kitu” kutoka mikononi mwako
question_src: Je! Ni kwanini sabuni hiyo inaweza kuosha karibu kila kitu kutoka kwa mikono yako lakini haitoi harufu yake kutoka kwako?
all_claims: Sabuni hutengenezwa kwa kuchanganya mafuta na lye, na molekuli zake za surfactant huvunja mafuta na uchafu, kuyaweka kwenye micelles yanayoshwashwa na maji, hivyo kuondoa “karibu kila kitu” kutoka mikononi mwako [1].
Ili ipendeze, watengenezaji huongeza mafuta muhimu au mafuta ya harufu yenye tabia ya lipophilic ambayo hayahitajiki kwa kusafisha bali kwa kutoa harufu [2].
Molekuli hizi za harufu huchanganyika na lipids asili za safu nyembamba ya juu ya ngozi (stratum corneum) na baadhi huingia taratibu ndani yake [4].

Mara zikiwa ndani ya safu hii yenye unyevunyevu, hutoka nje kwa kasi ndogo sana, hivyo maji na sabuni haviwezi kuziosha mara moja—natokeo ni kwamba sabuni inasafisha mikono lakini harufu yake hubaki mwilini kwa muda.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: How to Make Soap from Scratch (www.healthline.com)
Content: Soap, by definition, is fat or oil mixed with an alkali. The oil is from an animal or plant, while the alkali is a chemical called lye. In bar soapmaking, the lye is sodium hydroxide. Liquid soap requires potassium hydroxide.


When oil and lye are combined and heated, the result is soap. This chemical reaction is called saponification. Without lye, saponification isn’t possible, so lye is necessary to create soap.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: How to Make Soap from Scratch (www.healthline.com)
Content: Technically, soap doesn’t need a scent to clean the skin. But if you’d like to add a pleasant smell, you can use essential oils or fragrance oils.


Essential oils are mostly plant-based and can be combined to create custom aromas. Fragrance oils are synthetic. When selecting fragrance oils, look for skin-safe options.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Will my skin soak up the calories in skin cream? (www.thenakedscientists.com)
Content: Given that a normal sized person, a grown up person, has a skin surface area of maybe 2 square metres and given that we're about 70% made up of water on the inside, we would lose a lot of water across the skin if it didn't perform efficiently as a protected barrier. It carries out this remarkable feat primarily through a very thin specialised layer, the stratum corneum.
---
Document ID: 4
Title: Will my skin soak up the calories in skin cream? (www.thenakedscientists.com)
Content: But where do the oils of the fats go in the end? Well, they mix in with the natural lipids of the stratum corneum and some may well move gradually into the deeper layers of this thin barrier. But once on the other side, they encounter an environment which is very watery. In oily substance, this is not an attractive place and therefore, fat transfer out of the stratum corneum will be very slow and unfavourable.
---

claim: Shusha dirisha kikamilifu, zima sigara au utupe gamu, weka mikono juu ya gurudumu na, ikiwa ni usiku, washa taa ya ndani ili uonekane vyema
question_src: Je! Unafanya nini ikiwa utavutwa?
all_claims: Ukiona taa za polisi, punguza mwendo na vuta kando sehemu salama, kisha uzime injini [1].
Shusha dirisha kikamilifu, zima sigara au utupe gamu, weka mikono juu ya gurudumu na, ikiwa ni usiku, washa taa ya ndani ili uonekane vyema [1].
Kumbuka kuwa polisi hulichukulia kila zuio la trafiki kama uwezekano wa hatari, hivyo utulivu na mwonekano wa wazi wa mikono hupunguza wasiwasi wao [5].
Shirikiana na maagizo yote halali ya afisa [6].
Habari pekee unayopaswa kutoa ni leseni, usajili na kadi ya bima [2].
Ikiwa afisa anakuelekeza utoke ndani ya gari, huna haki ya kukataa, kwa hiyo fuata amri hiyo bila ubishi [3].
Afisa akiwa na sababu inayowezekana anaweza kulisaka gari lako bila idhini yako, na kujaribu kuzuia hakutazuia utafutaji [4].
Baada ya kuwasilisha nyaraka, ongea kidogo tu—maneno mafupi kama “naelewa” au “sawa” yanatosha [7].
Unaendelea kuwa na haki ya kukaa kimya kuhusu maswali ya ziada, hivyo unaweza kuikataa kwa heshima [2].
claims_retained: Shusha dirisha kikamilifu, zima sigara au utupe gamu, weka mikono juu ya gurudumu na, ikiwa ni usiku, washa taa ya ndani ili uonekane vyema [1].

Unaendelea kuwa na haki ya kukaa kimya kuhusu maswali ya ziada, hivyo unaweza kuikataa kwa heshima [2].
prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Police Stops: What to Do If You Are Pulled Over (www.nolo.com)
Content: After you've pulled over to a safe spot, you should normally turn off your engine. At this point, you might want to show the officer a few other token courtesies. You have little to lose and perhaps something to gain.


Roll down your window all the way. Put out a cigarette if you have one and discard any chewing gum (within the car). You might also want to place your hands on the steering wheel, and, if it's dark, turn on your interior light.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: What Are My Rights When I'm Pulled Over? | Meldon Law (www.meldonlaw.com)
Content: Being pulled over is more or less the same as all police encounters regarding your right to remain silent. The only information that you are required to provide is your license, registration, and insurance information.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: What Are My Rights When I'm Pulled Over? | Meldon Law (www.meldonlaw.com)
Content: Despite what you may have heard, you do not have the right to stay in your car if the police order you out.
---
Document ID: 4
Title: What Are My Rights When I'm Pulled Over? | Meldon Law (www.meldonlaw.com)
Content: if the officer has probable cause for a search, then he or she may search without consent.
---
Document ID: 5
Title: How to Talk to Police When You're Pulled Over (www.criminaldefenselawyer.com)
Content: The reality is police officers are killed during routine traffic stops, and for this reason, officers will always approach the situation as though you are dangerous.
---
Document ID: 6
Title: How to Talk to Police When You're Pulled Over (www.criminaldefenselawyer.com)
Content: You should always cooperate with any (lawful) request of the officer.
---

Title: How to Talk to Police When You're Pulled Over (www.criminaldefenselawyer.com)
Content: Your best strategy may be to engage in a bit of reflective listening, saying "Hmmm" and "I see" and "I understand," without saying anything substantive.

Response: Unaendelea kuwa na haki ya kukaa kimya kuhusu maswali ya ziada, hivyo unaweza kuikataa kwa heshima [

claim: Deni la Marekani hugawanyika kati ya “deni la umma” na “deni la ndani” ambalo idara za serikali zinadaiwa zenyewe kwa zenyewe
question_src: Kwa kuwa karibu trilioni 10 za deni la dola trilioni 14 huko Amerika linamilikiwa ndani. ELI5 jinsi tunavyodaiwa wenyewe dola trilioni 10.
all_claims: Deni la Marekani hugawanyika kati ya “deni la umma” na “deni la ndani” ambalo idara za serikali zinadaiwa zenyewe kwa zenyewe [5].

Deni hili la ndani hutokana na fedha za Usalama wa Jamii na mifuko ya pensheni: kodi za wafanyakazi huingia Hazina, na mifuko yao hupokea hati za Hazina zinazoahidi kulipwa baadaye, hivyo serikali inajiandikia ahadi kwa niaba ya wastaafu hao [1].
Kwa mfano, raia analipa FICA leo, pesa inaingia matumizi ya serikali, naye hupata karatasi inayoahidi malipo yake ya uzeeni—ndiyo kusema, tunadai sisi wenyewe [1].

Zaidi ya hapo, benki, kampuni za bima, Hifadhi ya Shirikisho, serikali za majimbo na wananchi wenyewe hushikilia takriban 40 % ya deni lote kupitia dhamana walizonunua kama uwekezaji au akiba salama [2].

Kwa sababu serikali za nje zinashikilia karibu theluthi moja tu ya deni la umma, sehemu kubwa iliyobaki—takriban dola trilioni 10 katika mfano wa trilioni 14—inamilikiwa na taasisi na watu wa Marekani wenyewe, ni kama kuhamisha pesa mfukoni mwa kulia kwenda wa kushoto [3].

Siku deni hilo likilipwa, serikali hutumia mapato mapya ya kodi au hukopa tena, hivyo “deni kwa sisi wenyewe” hubaki kuwa mpango wa ndani wa kugawanya na kusogeza akiba ya wananchi, si bili inayoenda ng’ambo [5].
claims_retained: Deni la Marekani hugawanyika kati ya “deni la umma” na “deni la ndani” ambalo idara za serikali zinadaiwa zenyewe kwa zenyewe [5].

Deni hili la ndani hutokana na fedha za Usalama wa Jamii na mifuko ya pensheni: kodi za wafanyakazi huingia Hazina, na mifuko yao hupokea hati za Hazina zinazoahidi kulipwa baadaye, hivyo serikali inajiandikia ahadi kwa niaba ya wastaafu hao [1].

Zaidi ya hapo, benki, kampuni za bima, Hifadhi ya Shirikisho, serikali za majimbo na wananchi wenyewe hushikilia takriban 40 % ya deni lote kupitia dhamana walizonunua kama uwekezaji au akiba salama [2].
prompt:

Title: The Real Owner of the US Debt Will Surprise You (www.thebalance.com)
Content: Many people believe that much of U.S. debt is owed to foreign countries like China and Japan. The truth is, most of it is owed to Social Security and pension funds. This means U.S. citizens, through their retirement money, own most of the national debt.

U.S. national debt is the sum of these two federal debt categories:

 * Public debt, held by other countries, the Federal Reserve, mutual funds, and other entities and individuals * Intragovernmental holdings, held by Social Security, Military Retirement Fund, Medicare, and other retirement funds
---

Title: Here's Who Owns The U.S. National Debt (finance.townhall.com)
Content: A diverse range of U.S. institutions, such as banks, insurance companies, independent corporations, investment firms and individuals combine to hold the largest share of money owed by the U.S. government, accounting for 40% of the total.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: The Real Owner of the US Debt Will Surprise You (www.thebalance.com)
Content: The public holds over $21 trillion, or almost 78%, of the national debt. Foreign governments hold about a third of the public debt, while the rest is owned by U.S. banks and investors, the Federal Reserve, state and local governments, mutual funds, pensions funds, insurance companies, and savings bonds.

Content: The public debt of the United States has risen quickly since 2000, more than quadrupling until 2020. The public debt is the total outstanding debt that is owed by the federal government. question_src: Ni nini kinatokea ikiwa nilirudi siku chache kwa wakati, na mtu anaita simu yangu ya rununu?
all_claims: Kulingana na uelewa wa sasa wa fizikia hakuna mtu amewahi kuonyesha njia salama ya kusafiri kurudi nyuma katika wakati, jambo ambalo hufanya tukio la “kurudi siku chache nyuma na kupokea simu” liwe la nadharia tu [1]; hivyo, kinachotokea kivitendo ni kwamba hutaweza kuwepo mahali hapo waendeapo, kwa sababu kurudi nyuma katika wakati bado haijathibitika na huenda haiwezekani kabisa.

Ikiwa tunapuuzia kikwazo hicho na kukubali dhana ya kimawazo, yapo matokeo mawili: (1) Simu yako imesafiri pamoja nawe, kwa hiyo mtandao uliopo “siku hizo” unaweza kuitambua na kupokea wito kama kawaida kadiri mitambo inavyoruhusu—lakini hii ingeunda nakala mbili za namba yako katika nyakati tofauti, jambo linaloweza kusababisha mkanganyiko wa kumbukumbu na bili; (2) Kama simu imebaki kwenye wakati wa asili, mpigaji atapata huduma ya sauti (voicemail) au “haipatikani,” kwa sababu kifaa chenyewe hakipo kwenye mtandao.

Vyovyote vile, wazushi wa fizikia huonya uwepo wa misukosuko ya mantiki kama “paradox ya babu,” inayodokeza kuwa vitendo kama hivyo vinaweza kukinzana na sababu-matokeo na kwa hivyo huenda haviwezekani kimsingi.

Title: Is time travel possible? (www.space.com)
Content: Although many people are fascinated by the idea of changing the past or seeing the future before it's due, no person has ever demonstrated the kind of back-and-forth time travel seen in science fiction, or proposed a method of sending a person through significant periods of time that wouldn't destroy them on the way. And, as physicist Stephen Hawking pointed out in his book "Black Holes and Baby Universes" (Bantam, 1994), "The best evidence we have that time travel is not possible, and never will be, is that we have not been invaded by hordes of tourists from the future."

question_src: ; Je! Ustaarabu wa zamani unafunikwaje na uchafu, mchanga, nk?
all_claims: Majengo ya ustaarabu wa kale yalifunikwa polepole na mchanganyiko wa taka za kibinadamu na nguvu za asili: wakazi walileta chakula na mawe ya ujenzi kwa wingi lakini hawakutoa taka sawia, hivyo kiwango cha ardhi mjini kilipanda hatua kwa hatua na kuzikwa sakafu na kuta za awali [2].
Miundombinu ilipoachwa, ukosefu wa matengenezo uliiweka hatarini kubomoka, mimea ikaota, kufa na kuoza, ikaunda safu mpya za udongo juu yake kwa karne nyingi [1].

Upepo ulibeba vumbi na uchafu, mvua ikaunda matope, dhoruba na mawimbi ya mchanga vikazidi kuta, na hata matetemeko ya ardhi yakaendelea kurekebisha tabaka hizo, hivyo mabaki yakajificha chini ya mchanga mzito [1].
Vipande vilivyoachwa wazi viliibwa au kumomonyoka, kwa hiyo majengo tunayoyaona leo ni yale tu yaliyokuwa tayari yamefunikwa na ardhi [2].
Hivyo wachimbuaji hulazimika kufukua mita kadhaa chini ya uso wa sasa ili kufikia “kurasa” hizi za historia zilizoandikwa kwenye udongo.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: How Did Ancient Civilizations Get Buried? (parade.com)
Content: With certain notable exceptions, such as Pompeii, only abandoned fragments of past civilizations were buried by natural forces. People migrated and disseminated, leaving unwanted structures behind. Deserted buildings degraded from a lack of maintenance; plants overtook the space, died and decayed, building layers of soil over the centuries. Dust and debris from neighboring areas blew over the land, rains caused mudslides, storms toppled walls, earthquakes reshaped the local topography over time, and more.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Why do we have to dig so deep to uncover ancient ruins? (www.sciencefocus.com)
Content: There is a survivorship bias at work here: buildings and monuments left exposed on the surface don’t last very long. Humans steal the best bits to reuse in other buildings, and erosion wears everything else to dust. So the only ancient ruins we find are the ones that were buried.


But they got buried in the first place because the ground level of ancient cities tended to steadily rise. Settlements constantly imported food and building materials for the population, but getting rid of waste and rubbish was a much lower priority
---

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: How Did Ancient Civilizations Get Buried? (parade.com)
Content: With certain notable exceptions, such as Pompeii, only abandoned fragments of past civilizations were buried by natural forces. People migrated and disseminated, leaving unwanted structures behind. Deserted buildings degraded from a lack of maintenance; plants overtook the space, died and decayed, building layers of soil over the centuries. Dust and debris from neighboring areas blew over the land, rains caused mudslides, storms toppled walls, earthquakes reshaped the local topography over time, and more.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Why do we have to dig so deep to uncover ancient ruins? (www.sciencefocus.com)
Content: There is a survivorship bias at work here: buildings and monuments left exposed on the surface don’t last very long. Humans steal the best bits to reuse in other buildings, and erosion wears everything else to dust. So the only ancient ruins we find are the ones that were buried.


But they got buried in the first place because the ground level of ancient cities tended to steadily rise. Settlements constantly imported food and building materials for the population, but getting rid of waste and rubbish was a much lower priority

claim: Hisia ya kwamba mchwa au wadudu wanatambaa juu ya ngozi mara tu baada ya kuwaona huitwa uundaji (formication), aina ya paresthesia ambapo mtu huhisi msisimko ambao hauna sababu ya mwili halisi
question_src: Ni nini husababisha sisi kufikiria kuhisi mchwa/wadudu wakitambaa juu yetu baada ya kuona moja?
all_claims: Hisia ya kwamba mchwa au wadudu wanatambaa juu ya ngozi mara tu baada ya kuwaona huitwa uundaji (formication), aina ya paresthesia ambapo mtu huhisi msisimko ambao hauna sababu ya mwili halisi [2].

Kilio cha kuona mdudu hufanya kazi kama “trigger” ya nje: ubongo unapoona ishara ya hatari kidogo, huongeza umakini kwa ngozi na huchakata kwa kasi msisimko mdogo (kama mguso wa nywele au upepo hafifu), kisha huutafsiri kimakosa kuwa kutambaa kwa wadudu [1].

Kwa maneno mengine, mwonekano wa mdudu huamsha mfumo wa tahadhari, na katika hali hii ubongo unaweza “kuchora” uzoefu wa kugusa unaoendana na kile ulichokiona, ingawa hakuna mdudu mwingine aliye kwenye ngozi.
Hivyo, ni mchanganyiko wa mwelekeo wa kisaikolojia na kinasaba wa ubongo kutafuta uthibitisho wa hatari inayotazamiwa unaosababisha mtu kufikiri au kuhisi wadudu zaidi baada ya kuona mdudu mmoja.
claims_retained: Hisia ya kwamba mchwa au wadudu wanatambaa juu ya ngozi mara tu baada ya kuwaona huitwa uundaji (formication), aina ya paresthesia ambapo mtu huhisi msisimko ambao hauna sababu ya mwili halisi [2].
