prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Your Brain Has 2 Clocks (www.scientificamerican.com)
Content: Neuroscientists believe that we have distinct neural systems for processing different types of time, for example, to maintain a circadian rhythm, to control the timing of fine body movements, and for conscious awareness of time passage. Until recently, most neuroscientists believed that this latter type of temporal processing – the kind that alerts you when you’ve lingered over breakfast for too long – is supported by a single brain system. However, emerging research indicates that the model of a single neural clock might be too simplistic. A new study, recently published in the Journal of Neuroscience by neuroscientists at the University of California, Irvine, reveals that the brain may in fact have a second method for sensing elapsed time. What’s more, the authors propose that this second internal clock not only works in parallel with our primary neural clock, but may even compete with it.


Past research suggested that a brain region called the striatum lies at the heart of our central inner clock, working with the brain’s surrounding cortex to integrate temporal information.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Physics explains why time passes faster as you age (qz.com)
Content: According to Bejan—who reviewed previous studies in a range of fields on time, vision, cognition, and mental processing to reach his conclusion—time as we experience it represents perceived changes in mental stimuli. It’s related to what we see. As physical mental-image processing time and the rapidity of images we take in changes, so does our perception of time. And in some sense, each of us has our own “mind time” unrelated to the passing of hours, days, and years on clocks and calendars, which is affected by the amount of rest we get and other factors.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: A stopwatch on the brain's perception of time (www.theguardian.com)
Content: It has also been shown that the cerebellum plays a key role in motor tasks requiring perception of implicit timing. Other parts of the brain may be involved in implicit-timing estimates: for example, the left parietal cortex, which manages intended movement, and the left premotor cortex, which plans and organises movement. Sometimes the right prefrontal cortex, usually involved in explicit-timing estimates, is activated for implicit estimates, for instance, when an event does not occur as soon as expected: a traffic light stays red for longer than foreseen. The brain updates its time forecasts, once again anticipating the interval.


In addition, "the regions of the brain involved differ depending on the context, particularly if the stimulus only lasts for a very short time, less than 200 milliseconds," says Coull. The visual cortex is activated when we estimate the duration of a visual stimulus. In the same way, the primary motor cortex comes into play when a timing estimate is associated with an action, whereas the auditory cortex has a part in estimating the length of a sound stimulus.


Above all, the brain's perception of time involves processes linked to memory and attention: witness the impression that time is passing more quickly when we are busy, or doing something amusing or exciting. Time flies even when we are in love. In contrast, a watched pot never boils. Minutes drag by when we are bored.
---

question_src: Je! Kwa nini biashara ya USS CVN-65 ilikataliwa?
all_claims: USS Enterprise (CVN-65) ilisitishwa matumizi kwa sababu ilikuwa imehudumu kwa zaidi ya miaka 55 na hivyo kuwa miongoni mwa meli kongwe zaidi za Jeshi la Wanamaji la Marekani, jambo lililoongeza gharama na changamoto za kuiendeleza kiteknolojia na kiusalama [1].

Jaribio la kuibakiza kama jumba la kumbukumbu lilikataliwa kwa kuwa mwaka 2012 ilikadiriwa kuwa ghali sana kufanikisha hilo, hasa kutokana na ukweli kwamba meli ingehitaji kuvunjwa kwa sehemu ili kuondoa kwa usalama rekta zake nane za nyuklia, hatua iliyoongeza zaidi gharama na hatari za kiufundi na kimazingira [2].
Hivyo, mchanganyiko wa uzee, gharama kubwa za uendeshaji na ugumu wa kushughulikia mifumo yake ya nyuklia ulipelekea kuikataa na kuiondoa rasmi katika huduma.
claims_retained: Jaribio la kuibakiza kama jumba la kumbukumbu lilikataliwa kwa kuwa mwaka 2012 ilikadiriwa kuwa ghali sana kufanikisha hilo, hasa kutokana na ukweli kwamba meli ingehitaji kuvunjwa kwa sehemu ili kuondoa kwa usalama rekta zake nane za nyuklia, hatua iliyoongeza zaidi gharama na hatari za kiufundi na kimazingira [2].
prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: USS Enterprise (CVN-65) (en.wikipedia.org)
Content: USS Enterprise (CVN-65), formerly CVA(N)-65, is a decommissioned[14] United States Navy aircraft carrier. She was the first nuclear-powered aircraft carrier and the eighth United States naval vessel to bear the name. Like her predecessor of World War II fame, she is nicknamed "Big E". At 1,123 feet (342 m),[6][7] she is the longest naval vessel ever built. Her 93,284-long-ton (94,781 t)[5] displacement ranks her as the 12th-heaviest carrier, after the ten carriers of the Nimitz class and USS Gerald R. Ford. Enterprise had a crew of some 4,600 service members.[8]


The only ship of her class, Enterprise[15] was, at the time of inactivation, the third-oldest commissioned vessel in the United States Navy after the wooden-hulled USS Constitution and USS Pueblo.[16] She was inactivated on 1 December 2012,[17] and officially decommissioned on 3 February 2017,[18][19] after over 55 years of service.

Title: USS Enterprise (CVN-65) (en.wikipedia.org)
Content: Enterprise was the first nuclear-powered aircraft carrier to be decommissioned.[82] Naval enthusiasts requested that Enterprise be converted into a museum.[83][84] By 2012 this was deemed too expensive to make such an effort practical, in addition to the fact that the ship would need to be partially dismantled anyway to remove the eight reactors safely.[21] A petition was also set up for the next carrier to be named as the ninth USS Enterprise.[85]

question_src: Kwa nini watendaji na watendaji wa sauti wanapata pesa nyingi?
all_claims: Watendaji na watendaji wa sauti wanaolipwa sana hutengeneza dau kubwa kwa sababu umaarufu wao huwafanya “sanamu” na chapa hutaka kunufaika na mvuto wao kupitia mikataba ya kazi na idhini, hivyo hulipa pesa nyingi ili kufikia hadhira kubwa na kuongeza mauzo [1].
Bei yao inachochewa pia na ukweli kwamba idadi ya watu wanaoweza kutekeleza jukumu husika ni ndogo, kwa hivyo upungufu wa vipaji maalumu huongeza thamani yao sokoni [2].
Zaidi ya hapo, jukumu lao mara nyingi huzalisha mapato au sifa kubwa kwa mtayarishaji, hivyo kampuni ziko tayari kulipa zaidi ili kuhakikisha mafanikio ya filamu, tamasha au matangazo [2].

Waigizaji mastaa hutumia nguvu ya majina yao kujadiliana kwa kila mkataba na, kwa sababu bajeti za “blockbuster” hutabiri mapato makubwa, malipo yao huongezeka kadri uzalishaji unavyopanua bajeti [3].
Hata hivyo, muigizaji wa kawaida nchini Marekani alipata wastani wa dola 20.43 kwa saa mwaka 2019, ikionyesha kuwa malipo ya juu yanahusu wachache waliopo kileleni tu [4].

all_claims: Watendaji na watendaji wa sauti wanaolipwa sana hutengeneza dau kubwa kwa sababu umaarufu wao huwafanya “sanamu” na chapa hutaka kunufaika na mvuto wao kupitia mikataba ya kazi na idhini, hivyo hulipa pesa nyingi ili kufikia hadhira kubwa na kuongeza mauzo [1].
Bei yao inachochewa pia na ukweli kwamba idadi ya watu wanaoweza kutekeleza jukumu husika ni ndogo, kwa hivyo upungufu wa vipaji maalumu huongeza thamani yao sokoni [2].
Zaidi ya hapo, jukumu lao mara nyingi huzalisha mapato au sifa kubwa kwa mtayarishaji, hivyo kampuni ziko tayari kulipa zaidi ili kuhakikisha mafanikio ya filamu, tamasha au matangazo [2].

Waigizaji mastaa hutumia nguvu ya majina yao kujadiliana kwa kila mkataba na, kwa sababu bajeti za “blockbuster” hutabiri mapato makubwa, malipo yao huongezeka kadri uzalishaji unavyopanua bajeti [3].
Hata hivyo, muigizaji wa kawaida nchini Marekani alipata wastani wa dola 20.43 kwa saa mwaka 2019, ikionyesha kuwa malipo ya juu yanahusu wachache waliopo kileleni tu [4].
claims_retained: Watendaji na watendaji wa sauti wanaolipwa sana hutengeneza dau kubwa kwa sababu umaarufu wao huwafanya “sanamu” na chapa hutaka kunufaika na mvuto wao kupitia mikataba ya kazi na idhini, hivyo hulipa pesa nyingi ili kufikia hadhira kubwa na kuongeza mauzo [1].
Zaidi ya hapo, jukumu lao mara nyingi huzalisha mapato au sifa kubwa kwa mtayarishaji, hivyo kampuni ziko tayari kulipa zaidi ili kuhakikisha mafanikio ya filamu, tamasha au matangazo [2].
Hata hivyo, muigizaji wa kawaida nchini Marekani alipata wastani wa dola 20.43 kwa saa mwaka 2019, ikionyesha kuwa malipo ya juu yanahusu wachache waliopo kileleni tu [4].

claim: Ukubwa wa faili unaweza kubadilika hata pixel zikibaki zilezile kwa sababu tofauti za kiufundi zinazohusu jinsi data ya picha imehifadhiwa na kubanwa: kwanza, kiwango cha ubora (compression) kinachochaguliwa kwenye kamera au programu kinaamua ni kiasi gani cha data kinachofutwa; ubora wa “Fine” hutumia kubanwa kidogo hivyo faili huwa kubwa, ilhali “Standard” hubana zaidi na kupunguza saizi ya faili bila kuongeza au kupunguza idadi ya pixel
question_src: Je! Kwa nini ukubwa wa faili ya picha za dijiti hutofautiana wakati hesabu ya pixel haibadilika?
all_claims: Ukubwa wa faili unaweza kubadilika hata pixel zikibaki zilezile kwa sababu tofauti za kiufundi zinazohusu jinsi data ya picha imehifadhiwa na kubanwa: kwanza, kiwango cha ubora (compression) kinachochaguliwa kwenye kamera au programu kinaamua ni kiasi gani cha data kinachofutwa; ubora wa “Fine” hutumia kubanwa kidogo hivyo faili huwa kubwa, ilhali “Standard” hubana zaidi na kupunguza saizi ya faili bila kuongeza au kupunguza idadi ya pixel [1].
Pili, mbinu ya kubanwa yenyewe—kwa mfano JPEG dhidi ya PNG—inaweza kuwa bora au hafifu; kubanwa kwa ujumla hupunguza nafasi kwa “kuingiza faili kwa njia bora, ikiruhusu iwe ndogo” [2].

Tatu, kina cha rangi (bit depth) hubadilisha kiasi cha taarifa ya rangi kinachohifadhiwa kwa kila pixel: faili ya 24-bit ni takribani mara tatu kubwa kuliko faili 8-bit yenye hesabu sawa ya pixel kwa sababu kila pixel ina taarifa zaidi ya rangi [3].
Kwa hivyo, hata bila kubadili azimio, kuchanganya mipangilio tofauti ya ubora wa kubanwa na kina cha rangi husababisha tofauti kubwa kwenye ukubwa wa faili ya picha.
claims_retained: Ukubwa wa faili unaweza kubadilika hata pixel zikibaki zilezile kwa sababu tofauti za kiufundi zinazohusu jinsi data ya picha imehifadhiwa na kubanwa: kwanza, kiwango cha ubora (compression) kinachochaguliwa kwenye kamera au programu kinaamua ni kiasi gani cha data kinachofutwa; ubora wa “Fine” hutumia kubanwa kidogo hivyo faili huwa kubwa, ilhali “Standard” hubana zaidi na kupunguza saizi ya faili bila kuongeza au kupunguza idadi ya pixel [1].
Pili, mbinu ya kubanwa yenyewe—kwa mfano JPEG dhidi ya PNG—inaweza kuwa bora au hafifu; kubanwa kwa ujumla hupunguza nafasi kwa “kuingiza faili kwa njia bora, ikiruhusu iwe ndogo” [2].

Tatu, kina cha rangi (bit depth) hubadilisha kiasi cha taarifa ya rangi kinachohifadhiwa kwa kila pixel: faili ya 24-bit ni takribani mara tatu kubwa kuliko faili 8-bit yenye hesabu sawa ya pixel kwa sababu kila pixel ina taarifa zaidi ya rangi [3].
prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: What is the difference between image size, file size, and image quality? (www.sony.com)
Content: Image size: This represents the physical size and resolution of an image measured in pixels. For example, A 10 megapixel (MP) camera may provide settings to take pictures in 10.2 MP (3872 x 2592), 5.6 MP (2896 x 1944), and 2.5 MP (1936 x 1296). A higher image size setting means a larger picture and bigger file size. A lower image size setting makes a smaller picture and smaller file size. Depending on your camera, there may be different sizes available.


File size: This is the amount of space that the image file takes up on your memory card, or internal memory if your camera has one. It is measured in megabytes. The actual file size depends on the image size and image quality settings selected on the camera.


Image quality: This dictates how much compression is used to record the file information. Some digital cameras have a Fine and Standard setting where the Fine setting uses less compression than the Standard setting. Therefore, the detail of a picture taken with the Fine setting is a sharper than one taken with the Standard setting. Similar to the image size setting discussed above, this also affects the file size. Since the Fine setting uses less compression and records more detail, the file size will be larger than one recorded with the standard setting.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Factors affecting file size (digitalmediaresources.weebly.com)
Content: Compression is the process of reducing the size of a file. It is achieved by encoding the file in an efficient way, allowing it to be smaller.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Bitmaps and File Size | Understand How Color Works in Photoshop (www.peachpit.com)
Content: If each pixel is defined using 8 bits of color information, then the file is eight times bigger than a black-and-white bitmap. Similarly, a 24-bit file is a full three times bigger than the 8-bit image, and a 48-bit file is twice the size of a 24-bit one.
---
Document ID: 4
Title: Color Depth (65k, 262k, 16.7M colors) (focuslcds.com)
Content: Color depth is the number of colors that can be used for each pixel on the display. This can range from 8- bit color, 16-bit high color to 24-bit true color. The range of color is determined by how many bits of red, green and blue (RGB) each pixel is assigned to the frame buffer.
---

all_claims: Sababu kuu ni kwamba baiskeli inayosimama ina sehemu mbili tu za mawasiliano na ardhi, hivyo msingi wake wa msaada ni mstari mwembamba badala ya pointi tatu au zaidi zinazohitajika kwa uthabiti; matokeo yake ni rahisi kuanguka ukiwa umesimama [2].

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Why Does A Moving Bicycle Stay Up? (www.science20.com)
Content: Since the bicycle was invented, s cientists have postulated various reasons as to why a bicycle is self stable above a certain speed. The consensus has been that a bicycle's stability is related to two factors: First, the rotating wheels of the bicycle provide stability through gyroscopic effects; secondly, that the ‘trail’, the distance by which the contact point of the front wheel trails behind the steering axis, plays an important part.

A new study in Science claims to have settled the issue - gyroscopic effects and trail help, says researcher Dr Arend Schwab of the 3mE faculty at TU Delft, but are not necessary above a certain speed . In a 2007 Proceedings of the Royal Society article (doi:10.1098/rspa.2007.1857), a mathematical model with around 25 physical parameters was developed at the time which appeared to predict whether, and at what speeds, a particular design of bicycle would be stable.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Balancing on a Bicycle: The Phenomena (www.mentalfloss.com)
Content: A bicycle, on the other hand, is statically unstable because it only has two contact points with the ground (whatever portion of the front and back wheels happen to be touching the ground) and its base of support is a line segment. A good base of support needs at least three contact points with the ground, so bikes are hard to keep upright when they're still. Bikes are, however, dynamically stable, or stable when moving forward, because steering allows a rider to move the bike's points of support around under the center of gravity and keep it balanced, often with steering adjustments small enough that the rider may not even realize they're making them. It's sort of like standing on one foot. If you don't hop around a little, and you start falling sideways, you can't recover and you fall over. If you do hop, though, you can move your foot around to keep your center of gravity above it and keep your balance.


A bike has two features that help this dynamic stability immensely: its wheels. Spinning wheels have angular momentum, and when you're sitting on a bike, you and it and its wheels make up a system that obeys the principle of conservation of angular momentum. Unless torque, or twisting force, is applied from outside the system to change the wheels' angular momentum, that momentum and the direction of the momentum remain constant. In a nutshell, once the wheels line up a certain way, they want to stay lined up like that. It's easy for you to move them, but hard for an outside force to do the same, and so the bike is easy to keep balanced but doesn't topple easily. A non-moving bike has wheels that aren't spinning and zero angular momentum, which makes it very easy for external torque to change the wheels' direction, making the bike harder to balance.
---

question_src: Je! Ni kwanini video ya YouTube iliyojaa kikamilifu itatoka tena kutoka ambapo bonyeza kwenye bar ya maendeleo wakati unaruka sekunde chache mbele?
all_claims: Ingawa sehemu uliyoitazama tayari ilikuwa imehifadhiwa, wakati unapo-ruka mbele YouTube hukata mfululizo wa data uliokuwa umehifadhiwa na kuomba sehemu mpya (video segments) zilizoanzia mahali ulipobonyeza; kama muunganisho wako hauwezi kuhamisha data hizo mpya haraka vya kutosha au seva zao zipo chini ya msongamano, mchakato huo husababisha buffering upya [1].

Seva za YouTube huhudumia mamilioni ya watumiaji kwa wakati mmoja, na chini ya trafiki nzito zinaweza kuchelewa kujibu ombi lako jipya la sehemu ya video, jambo linalofanya uone tena gurudumu la kupakia hata ikiwa kasi yako ya intaneti ni kubwa [2].

Mfumo huu wa “adaptive streaming” unasaidia kurekebisha ubora kulingana na hali ya mtandao, lakini maana yake ni kwamba kila ukiruka mbele lazima kifaa chako kiwasiliane tena na seva kupata sehemu tofauti ya faili badala ya kutegemea kilichokuwa tayari kimehifadhiwa ndani ya kumbukumbu.
claims_retained: Ingawa sehemu uliyoitazama tayari ilikuwa imehifadhiwa, wakati unapo-ruka mbele YouTube hukata mfululizo wa data uliokuwa umehifadhiwa na kuomba sehemu mpya (video segments) zilizoanzia mahali ulipobonyeza; kama muunganisho wako hauwezi kuhamisha data hizo mpya haraka vya kutosha au seva zao zipo chini ya msongamano, mchakato huo husababisha buffering upya [1].

Seva za YouTube huhudumia mamilioni ya watumiaji kwa wakati mmoja, na chini ya trafiki nzito zinaweza kuchelewa kujibu ombi lako jipya la sehemu ya video, jambo linalofanya uone tena gurudumu la kupakia hata ikiwa kasi yako ya intaneti ni kubwa [2].
prompt:

Title: How to Stop Buffering When Streaming | SatelliteInternet.com (www.satelliteinternet.com)
Content: Your streaming service is buffering either because your internet connection can’t keep up with the amount of data coming in or your streaming provider can’t push the data to your device fast enough.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: YouTube Keeps Buffering? - Best Way to Fix It (www.istarapps.com)
Content: Interestingly, YouTube buffering can happen even if you have a high-speed internet connection. That can happen due to slower servers from their end, and your connection speed doesn’t affect that.


As we already know, YouTube is equipped with the most powerful internet connections in the world. Also, their servers and other infrastructure come with cutting edge technology. However, that doesn’t prevent YouTube from experiencing occasional hiccups, particularly when there is heavy traffic.


In fact, when plenty of users visit YouTube and watch videos simultaneously, the performance of the servers is tested. In that case, the servers have to communicate with all the clients and transfer data constantly. If something goes wrong, the users will experience various issues, and YouTube keeps buffering is one of those issues.
---

question_src: Je! Mabara, nchi na maeneo ya pwani vilikuwaje kabla ya uvumbuzi wa satelaiti?
all_claims: Kabla ya satelaiti, sura ya mabara, nchi na maeneo ya pwani ilichorwa kwa kutegemea uchunguzi kutoka meli: marubani walipima mwelekeo wa dira na umbali, kisha “kuzaa” alama kadiri walivyoiona kutoka baharini ili kufafanua mstari wa mwambao, urambazaji huu ukiwa sahihi zaidi majini kuliko ardhini [1].
Mpaka katikati ya karne ya 18, walipotumia Dead Reckoning, makosa yalijilimbikiza kadri safari ilivyorefuka, hivyo ramani zilipata upotovu unaoongezeka mbali na bandari zilizojulikana [2].

Kuanzia mwishoni mwa 1700, urambazaji wa mbinguni uliwezesha wasafiri kupata nafasi yao ndani ya maili chache, jambo lililopunguza sana hitilafu na kuongeza uaminifu wa ramani za pwani na mipaka ya nchi [2].

Wachoraji ramani walianza kutoka “vipengele vya kutegemewa” kama visiwa au miamba iliyothibitishwa ili kujenga mtandao wa vipimo unaoenea kufikia bara, kwa sababu usahihi ulitegemea kwanza kujua mahali ulipo unapotazama eneo jipya [3].

Uvumbuzi wa makadirio ya Mercator mwaka 1569 uliwaruhusu wanamaji kuchora kozi ya dira kama mstari mnyoofu, kuweka sehemu zilizopimwa kwenye ramani tambarare bila kubadili mwelekeo, na hadi karne ya 19 chati hizi zilikuwa msingi wa safari ndefu baharini [4].

Matokeo yake, kabla ya satelaiti, ramani zilikuwa na maelezo mazuri zaidi kando ya njia za majini na katika bandari muhimu, huku maeneo ya ndani yakibaki na upungufu wa usahihi na maumbo yasiyo kamili.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: How did cartographers map out shores before modern times? (outdoors.stackexchange.com)
Content: "piloting". With piloting, you are determining your location using bearings from reference points on accurate maps. Here, we are using the bearing to objects to determine position of points along the coastline. Still, it works much the same way.


Maps - especially of shorelines - were almost certainly made from observations taken from boats. Naval navigation is much more accurate than navigation on land (especially without good maps!).
---
Document ID: 2
Title: How did cartographers map out shores before modern times? (outdoors.stackexchange.com)
Content: Prior to the mid-1700's, the primary means of navigation was dead reckoning (DR). This requires that you iteratively advance your position on the map from your last known position using direction and time/distance. Of course, over time, errors will compound resulting in reduced accuracy. You must have a way of measuring your direction of travel and a (somewhat) accurate value for your speed.


Later in the 1700's, it was possible to navigate more accurately using celestial navigation. This allowed a skilled navigator to determine his position rather accurately (typically within a few miles) at any point on the globe. The position was typically found once each day and advanced using DR as necessary.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: How did cartographers map out shores before modern times? (outdoors.stackexchange.com)
Content: The topics of navigation and cartography are two sides of the same coin, and there are entire books written about each. It is interesting to study the history of cartography because it very graphically shows the corresponding improvements in navigation over time.


In order to make an accurate map, you need to know first where you are making your observations from. Making the observations from a previously known position will result in much greater accuracy. This position may have been established by an earlier survey (eg, working from a known point on an existing map) or by being able to independently figure out your position with good certainty on the position of the globe.
---
Document ID: 4
Title: The Mystery of Extraordinarily Accurate Medieval Maps (www.discovermagazine.com)
Content: The problem was the portolan mapmakers’ lack of a systematic way of reducing the spherical Earth to a flat map. That was of little consequence for short journeys but mattered much more when sailing longer distances. In 1569, the Belgian geographer and cartographer Gerardus Mercator created his method for presenting a spherical world on a flat map, the one familiar to us today. This mapmaking technique, though it stretched and compressed landmarks and distances between them, had the great advantage that a straight compass course was represented by a straight line on the map.


Mercator’s projections began to be used to sail the open seas by the early 1800s, by which time portolan charts had pretty much disappeared. But their importance is undeniable. “The development of these maps revolutionized how people perceived space, much like Google Earth has done in our lifetimes,” Hessler says. “Understanding how the technology was developed gives us insight into how we got here, and perhaps into where we’re going.”
---

question_src: Je! Kwa nini amevaa swastika anachukuliwa mwiko lakini kila baiskeli naona amevaa msalaba wa chuma kwenye shati lake, koti, ngozi au pikipiki?
all_claims: Swastika imebaki kuwa mwiko kwa sababu baada ya Wanazi kuiweka katikati ya propaganda yao kama “alama ya mbio za Aryan,” inahusishwa moja kwa moja na Nazism, Holocaust na chuki dhidi ya Wayahudi, hivyo watu wengi Magharibi huiangalia kama ishara ya chuki isiyovumilika hata leo [1].

Kinyume chake, Msalaba wa Chuma ulikuwa tu tuzo ya kijeshi ya Ujerumani ya karne ya 19; ingawa Wanazi waliuongezea swastika na pia waliutumia, baada ya vita ulitengwa na ukatumiwa upya na makundi mbalimbali ya Marekani—hasa waendesha pikipiki—kuashiria uasi na mshtuko kuliko itikadi ya ubaguzi, na kufikia miaka ya 2000 alama hii “iliyotengwa” (ikiuonekana bila swastika au alama nyingine za chuki) ikawa ya kawaida katika mavazi na chapa za michezo kali hadi ikawa vigumu kuihesabu kiotomatiki kama ishara ya chuki [4].

Hivyo, swastika bado ina mzigo mzito wa kihistoria unaorudisha kumbukumbu za mauaji ya mamilioni, ilhali Msalaba wa Chuma katika sura yake isiyo na swastika mara nyingi huonekana kama nembo ya “rebeli” isiyo na ujumbe wa wazi wa ubaguzi, ingawa bado huweza kutumiwa na vikundi vya chuki, na kwa hiyo muktadha wake ni muhimu [3].
claims_retained: Swastika imebaki kuwa mwiko kwa sababu baada ya Wanazi kuiweka katikati ya propaganda yao kama “alama ya mbio za Aryan,” inahusishwa moja kwa moja na Nazism, Holocaust na chuki dhidi ya Wayahudi, hivyo watu wengi Magharibi huiangalia kama ishara ya chuki isiyovumilika hata leo [1].
prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Swastika (en.wikipedia.org)
Content: In the Western world, it was a symbol of auspiciousness and good luck until the 1930s[4] when the right-facing tilted form became a feature of Nazi symbolism as an emblem of the Aryan race. As a result of World War II and the Holocaust, many people in the West still strongly associate it with Nazism and antisemitism.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: History of the Swastika (encyclopedia.ushmm.org)
Content: The Nazi Party was not the only party to use the swastika in Germany. After World War I, a number of far-right nationalist movements adopted the swastika. As a symbol, it became associated with the idea of a racially “pure” state. By the time the Nazis gained control of Germany, the connotations of the swastika had forever changed.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Iron Cross (www.adl.org)
Content: The Iron Cross is a famous German military medal dating back to the 19th century. During the 1930s, the Nazi regime in Germany superimposed a swastika on the traditional medal, turning it into a Nazi symbol. After World War II, the medal was discontinued but neo-Nazis and other white supremacists subsequently adopted it as a hate symbol and it has been a commonly-used hate symbol ever since.
---
Document ID: 4
Title: Iron Cross (www.adl.org)
Content: In the United States, however, the Iron Cross also became one of several Nazi-era symbols adopted by outlaw bikers, more to signify rebellion or to shock than for any white supremacist ideology. By the early 2000s, this other use of the Iron Cross had spread from bikers to skateboarders and many extreme sports enthusiasts and became part of the logo of several different companies producing equipment and clothing for this audience. Consequently, the use of the Iron Cross in a non-racist context has greatly proliferated in the United States, to the point that an Iron Cross in isolation (i.e., without a superimposed swastika or without other accompanying hate symbols) cannot be determined to be a hate symbol.
---

claim: CRISPR ni zana ya uhariri wa jeni inayotumia mlolongo mfupi wa RNA unaoongoza protini ya Cas9 kutambua na kukata sehemu mahususi ya DNA; jina lake linatokana na vichapuko vinavyorudiarudia vinavyoitwa “clustered regularly interspaced palindromic repeats”
question_src: Je! CRISPR inafanyaje kazi kwa maana?
all_claims: CRISPR ni zana ya uhariri wa jeni inayotumia mlolongo mfupi wa RNA unaoongoza protini ya Cas9 kutambua na kukata sehemu mahususi ya DNA; jina lake linatokana na vichapuko vinavyorudiarudia vinavyoitwa “clustered regularly interspaced palindromic repeats” [1].
Mfumo huu wa CRISPR/Cas9 ulielezewa kwa mara ya kwanza miaka ya 2012–2013 na kuifanya maabara nyingi duniani kuanza kubadilisha jenomu za viumbe mbalimbali [2].

Cas9 hufanya kama mkasi wa molekuli: ikifika kwenye mlengo unaolingana na mwongozo wa RNA hukata nyuzi zote mbili za DNA, kisha seli hutumia michakato yake ya kurekebisha DNA ama “kuzima” jeni kwa kuunganisha vipande visivyolingana, ama “kuandika upya” jeni kwa kutumia kiolezo kipya cha DNA kilichoingizwa na mtafiti.
Uchaguzi sahihi wa mwongozo wa RNA huwezesha karibu kila jeni katika mmea au mnyama kubadilishwa haraka na kwa ufanisi [3].
Vifaa vya CRISPR sasa vinapatikana mtandaoni kwa takribani dola 130, jambo linalorahisisha kuenea kwa teknolojia hii [5].
Tayari imetumika kutibu magonjwa ya urithi kwa wanyama, kupambana na virusi na kuandaa viungo vya kupandikiza kwa binadamu [3].

Title: Explainer: How CRISPR works (www.sciencenewsforstudents.org)
Content: CRISPR stands for “clustered regularly interspaced short palindromic repeats.”
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Explainer: How CRISPR works (www.sciencenewsforstudents.org)
Content: This CRISPR/Cas9 tool was first described in 2012 and 2013. Science labs around the world soon started using it to alter an organism’s genome — the entire set of its DNA instructions.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Explainer: How CRISPR works (www.sciencenewsforstudents.org)
Content: This tool can quickly and efficiently tweak almost any gene in any plant or animal. Researchers already have used it to fix genetic diseases in animals, to combat viruses and to sterilize mosquitoes. They have also used it to prepare pig organs for human transplants and to beef up the muscles in beagles.
---
Document ID: 4
Title: The Xenobot Future Is Coming—Start Planning Now (www.wired.com)
Content: Crispr might be new, but the key points of our conversation were hardly original. We focused on the scientists’ concerns—regulatory uncertainties, access to research funding, intellectual property ownership—and on the government officials’ concerns—national security and public backlash to engineered “designer babies.” The same conversation happened in 1991 when the first gene therapy trials started on humans, and again in 1996 with the birth of Dolly, a cloned sheep. A few years later, in 2003, the sequencing of the first human genome raised the same concerns. The questions were always narrow and reductive, in part because those asking the questions only imagined a future in which we cut, copied, and pasted existing genetic material. They failed to see a future in which anyone could create life from scratch.
---

claim: Katika Ugiriki ya kale hakukuwa na mfumo mmoja wa kuhesabu mwaka; Waathene, kwa mfano, walitumia “kalenda ya tamasha” ya miezi ya kibulaniti iliyobadilishana kati ya siku 29 na 30 kulingana na uchunguzi wa mwezi, bila fomula ngumu iliyowekwa
question_src: Kuhesabu mwaka katika Ugiriki ya kale
all_claims: Katika Ugiriki ya kale hakukuwa na mfumo mmoja wa kuhesabu mwaka; Waathene, kwa mfano, walitumia “kalenda ya tamasha” ya miezi ya kibulaniti iliyobadilishana kati ya siku 29 na 30 kulingana na uchunguzi wa mwezi, bila fomula ngumu iliyowekwa[1].

Sambamba nao kulikuwapo “kalenda ya kisiasa” iliyogawanya mwaka katika prytany, kila moja ikiendana na phyle (kabila la uraia); hadi 307 KK kulikuwa na phyle 10, kisha idadi ikabadilika kati ya 11 na 13 (mara nyingi 12), hivyo pia idadi ya prytany ilibadilika[1].
Kwa kuwa ulinganifu kati ya kalenda hizi mbili haukuwa thabiti, hati zilizotiwa tarehe kwa prytany huwa ngumu kubadili kuwa tarehe za Juliano, na watafiti hutoa makadirio tu[1].
Mbali na kalenda za miji, wanahistoria wa Kiaugiriki waliweka majira makuu ya Panheleni kwa kuhesabu Olimpiki; kila mzunguko ulidumu miaka minne, na mwaka wa kwanza ulioitwa Ol.
1,1 umeunganishwa na 776 KK, ambao hutumiwa kama nukta sahihi ya ulinganifu na enzi ya kawaida[2].
Orodha za washindi na kulinganisha na maafisa wa miji husaidia kubadilisha matukio, kama vile kupatwa kwa jua katika Ol.
117,3 linalolingana na 15 Agosti 310 KK[2].

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: The Ancient Greek Calendar | Polysyllabic (www.polysyllabic.com)
Content: The Athenians seem to have taken a rather casual attitude towards their calendar. It appears they used neither a regular formula nor continuous direct observation to determine the length of the months. Most likely, they followed a general rule of alternating months (29 and 30 days long), subject to periodic correction by observation.

In addition to this calendar, which has been called the festival calendar, Athenians maintained a second calendar for the political year. This "conciliar" year divided the year into "prytanies," one for each of the "phylai," the subdivisions of Athenian citizens. The number of phylai, and hence the number of prytanies, varies over time. Until 307 BCE, there were 10 phylai.

After that the number varies between 11 and 13 (usually 12). Even more confusing, while the conciliar and festival years were basically the same length in the 4th century BCE, such was not regularly the case earlier or later. Thus documents dated by prytany are frequently very difficult to assign to a particular equivalent in the Julian calendar, although we are usually secure in assigning an approximate date
---
Document ID: 2
Title: The Ancient Greek Calendar | Polysyllabic (www.polysyllabic.com)
Content: Ancient historians date by Olympiad by giving both the number of the Olympiad and the year within the cycle, 1-4 (the Olympiad itself was held on year 1). Additionally, lists of Olympic winners were maintained, and the 3rd c. BCE writer Timaios compiled a synchronic list comparing Olympic winners, Athenian archons, Spartan kings, and the priests of Hera from Argos.

Olympiad 1,1 correlates to 776 BCE. We do not actually need to believe an actual festival was held on this date, but when Greek historians are writing in later times, they date their own events using this as the epoch. We can establish a precise correlation to the common era from a variety of different sources, but the most definitive comes from a passage in Diodorus, where he dates the year of a total solar eclipse to the reign of the Athenian archon Hieromnemon, which he also gives as Ol. 117,3. The only astronomically possible date for this event is August 15, 310 BCE, which fixes our epoch

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: The Ancient Greek Calendar | Polysyllabic (www.polysyllabic.com)
Content: The Athenians seem to have taken a rather casual attitude towards their calendar. It appears they used neither a regular formula nor continuous direct observation to determine the length of the months. Most likely, they followed a general rule of alternating months (29 and 30 days long), subject to periodic correction by observation.

In addition to this calendar, which has been called the festival calendar, Athenians maintained a second calendar for the political year. This "conciliar" year divided the year into "prytanies," one for each of the "phylai," the subdivisions of Athenian citizens. The number of phylai, and hence the number of prytanies, varies over time. Until 307 BCE, there were 10 phylai.

After that the number varies between 11 and 13 (usually 12). Even more confusing, while the conciliar and festival years were basically the same length in the 4th century BCE, such was not regularly the case earlier or later. Thus documents dated by prytany are frequently very difficult to assign to a particular equivalent in the Julian calendar, although we are usually secure in assigning an approximate date
---
Document ID: 2
Title: The Ancient Greek Calendar | Polysyllabic (www.polysyllabic.com)
Content: Ancient historians date by Olympiad by giving both the number of the Olympiad and the year within the cycle, 1-4 (the Olympiad itself was held on year 1). Additionally, lists of Olympic winners were maintained, and the 3rd c. BCE writer Timaios compiled a synchronic list comparing Olympic winners, Athenian archons, Spartan kings, and the priests of Hera from Argos.

Olympiad 1,1 correlates to 776 BCE. We do not actually need to believe an actual festival was held on this date, but when Greek historians are writing in later times, they date their own events using this as the epoch. We can establish a precise correlation to the common era from a variety of different sources, but the most definitive comes from a passage in Diodorus, where he dates the year of a total solar eclipse to the reign of the Athenian archon Hieromnemon, which he also gives as Ol. 117,3. The only astronomically possible date for this event is August 15, 310 BCE, which fixes our epoch

claim: Mara tu wimbo unapoanzishwa kwenye simu, kigeuzi cha ndani hubadilisha data ya dijiti kuwa ishara ya sauti ya analog, kisha ishara hiyo huingia kwenye kebo ya aux yenye waya wa shaba; hapa inasafiri kama wimbi linalobadilika la umeme kwa sababu nyaya za AUX husambaza tu ishara za analog na si dijiti
question_src: Je! Wimbo husafirishwaje kwenye kebo ya aux kutoka kwa simu na kucheza kwenye gari?
all_claims: Mara tu wimbo unapoanzishwa kwenye simu, kigeuzi cha ndani hubadilisha data ya dijiti kuwa ishara ya sauti ya analog, kisha ishara hiyo huingia kwenye kebo ya aux yenye waya wa shaba; hapa inasafiri kama wimbi linalobadilika la umeme kwa sababu nyaya za AUX husambaza tu ishara za analog na si dijiti [2].
Waya huo wa shaba hubeba “wimbi endelevu la habari ya umeme” kuelekea pembejeo ya aux ya redio ya gari [1].
Redio huchukua ishara hiyo, huiimarisha na kuielekeza kwenye spika.

Ndani ya spika, mkondo wa umeme unaopita kwenye koili unaunda uga wa sumaku unaobadilika ambao unashirikiana na sumaku ya kudumu, kusukuma na kuvuta koni ya spika na hivyo kutikisa hewa, hatua inayofanya tufe sauti halisi inayosikika ndani ya gari [3].
Hivyo mchakato ni: ubadilishaji dijiti-kuwa-analog → usafirishaji wa mkondo katika kebo ya shaba → ukuzaji (amplification) → mwendo wa koni ya spika → sauti.

Title: Plugging in: differences between optical and aux audio (www.orbitsound.com)
Content: In the timeline of these two formats, aux came first, in the 1960s. It’s an analogue medium, meaning it can only transmit sound. In addition to this aux cables are made of copper, and the data transmitted through it do so via the continuous waveform of electrical information.

Document ID: 2
Title: Aux Inputs vs. USB Connections (www.lifewire.com)
Content: The main difference between a USB (Universal Serial Bus) connection and an auxiliary input is that USB cords send digital information while aux cables send analog signals. USB cords transfer data as you would to a computer, while aux cables transmit audio as you would to an amplifier or pair of headphones.
---

Title: The Physics of How Your Earphone Jack Works (Just in Time to Say Goodbye) (www.wired.com)
Content: At the most basic level, an earphone is a loop of wire with current running through it. This electric current in the loop then interacts with a permanent magnet which in turn pushes the air---that's sound.

claim: Mtu anaweza kukuweka gerezani hata ukiwa huna hatia kutokana na mchanganyiko wa makosa na ufisadi katika mchakato wa upelelezi na mashtaka, jambo linaloeleza kwa nini asilimia 2–10 ya waliopo gerezani Marekani—sawa na watu 46,000–230,000—huenda hawana hatia
question_src: Mtu anawezaje kuniweka gerezani ikiwa sina hatia?
all_claims: Mtu anaweza kukuweka gerezani hata ukiwa huna hatia kutokana na mchanganyiko wa makosa na ufisadi katika mchakato wa upelelezi na mashtaka, jambo linaloeleza kwa nini asilimia 2–10 ya waliopo gerezani Marekani—sawa na watu 46,000–230,000—huenda hawana hatia [1].
Polisi wasio waaminifu wanaweza kuficha, kubadilisha au kutunga ushahidi, kutisha mashahidi, na hata kupanga utambulisho wa shuhuda ili kukuonyesha kama mkosaji [2].
Waendesha mashtaka wanaopindisha haki huficha ushahidi unaokuondolea lawama, kuwahamasisha mashahidi kutoa taarifa za uongo, au kuwasilisha “wataalamu” hewa kuthibitisha tuhuma batili [3].

Vilevile, ukizuiliwa na kuhojiwa kwa muda mrefu—hadi masaa 10—ukikabiliwa na mbinu za kisaikolojia na vitisho, unaweza kukiri uhalifu usiolifanya; karibu robo ya watu 330 waliotakaswa kwa DNA kati ya 1989–2015 walitoa maungamo ya uwongo baada ya mazingira kama hayo [4].
Mbinu hizi zinapoungana, zinatengeneza kesi bandia inayoweza kumshawishi jaji au baraza la mahakama kwamba una hatia, hivyo kukuhukumu kifungo bila makosa yako.
claims_retained: Mtu anaweza kukuweka gerezani hata ukiwa huna hatia kutokana na mchanganyiko wa makosa na ufisadi katika mchakato wa upelelezi na mashtaka, jambo linaloeleza kwa nini asilimia 2–10 ya waliopo gerezani Marekani—sawa na watu 46,000–230,000—huenda hawana hatia [1].
Polisi wasio waaminifu wanaweza kuficha, kubadilisha au kutunga ushahidi, kutisha mashahidi, na hata kupanga utambulisho wa shuhuda ili kukuonyesha kama mkosaji [2].

claim: Kulingana na “Nadharia ya Nadra ya Dunia”, uwepo wa viumbe vyenye akili kama wanadamu unaweza kuwa tukio adimu sana kwa sababu unategemea mfululizo mrefu wa bahati mbaya ya hali mahususi: nyota na mfumo wa sayari lazima wawe katika eneo linaloweza kuishi, sayari yenyewe iwe na ulinganifu sahihi wa misa, iwe na walinzi wa gesi kama Mshtarii kuikinga na athari nyingi, iwe na satelaiti kubwa, gesi uhamaji (tectonics) na uwanja wa sumaku unaoleta utulivu wa muda mrefu kwa angahewa, pamoja na mzunguko sahihi wa elementi za kemikali katika bahari na angahewa
question_src: Kwa kusema kisayansi, kuna uwezekano gani kwamba uwepo wetu ni mdogo sana?
all_claims: Kulingana na “Nadharia ya Nadra ya Dunia”, uwepo wa viumbe vyenye akili kama wanadamu unaweza kuwa tukio adimu sana kwa sababu unategemea mfululizo mrefu wa bahati mbaya ya hali mahususi: nyota na mfumo wa sayari lazima wawe katika eneo linaloweza kuishi, sayari yenyewe iwe na ulinganifu sahihi wa misa, iwe na walinzi wa gesi kama Mshtarii kuikinga na athari nyingi, iwe na satelaiti kubwa, gesi uhamaji (tectonics) na uwanja wa sumaku unaoleta utulivu wa muda mrefu kwa angahewa, pamoja na mzunguko sahihi wa elementi za kemikali katika bahari na angahewa [1].

Zaidi ya hayo, hatua muhimu za kibiolojia—kuibuka kwa seli za eukaryoti, uzazi wa kijinsia, “mlipuko” wa Cambrian, na hatimaye mageuzi ya akili ya kibinadamu—zinaweza kuwa zinahitaji matukio mengine adimu yasiyotarajiwa [1].

Kwa kujumlisha vichujio hivi vyote, wanasayansi wanaodai hipotesi hii hupendekeza kwamba ingawa ulimwengu una nyota bilioni nyingi, nafasi ya upatikanaji wa mchanganyiko huu kamili ni ndogo sana, hivyo kuweka uwezekano wa uwepo wetu kuwa “mdogo sana” katika mizani ya kozmolojia.
claims_retained: Kulingana na “Nadharia ya Nadra ya Dunia”, uwepo wa viumbe vyenye akili kama wanadamu unaweza kuwa tukio adimu sana kwa sababu unategemea mfululizo mrefu wa bahati mbaya ya hali mahususi: nyota na mfumo wa sayari lazima wawe katika eneo linaloweza kuishi, sayari yenyewe iwe na ulinganifu sahihi wa misa, iwe na walinzi wa gesi kama Mshtarii kuikinga na athari nyingi, iwe na satelaiti kubwa, gesi uhamaji (tectonics) na uwanja wa sumaku unaoleta utulivu wa muda mrefu kwa angahewa, pamoja na mzunguko sahihi wa elementi za kemikali katika bahari na angahewa [1].

Zaidi ya hayo, hatua muhimu za kibiolojia—kuibuka kwa seli za eukaryoti, uzazi wa kijinsia, “mlipuko” wa Cambrian, na hatimaye mageuzi ya akili ya kibinadamu—zinaweza kuwa zinahitaji matukio mengine adimu yasiyotarajiwa [1].
prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Rare Earth hypothesis (en.wikipedia.org)
Content: The Rare Earth hypothesis argues that the evolution of biological complexity anywhere in the universe requires the coincidence of a large number of fortuitous circumstances, including, among others, a galactic habitable zone; a central star and planetary system having the requisite character (i.e. a circumstellar habitable zone); a terrestrial planet of the right mass; the advantage of one or more gas giant guardians like Jupiter and possibly a large natural satellite to shield the planet from frequent impact events; conditions needed to ensure the planet has a magnetosphere and plate tectonics; a chemistry similar to that present in the Earth's lithosphere, atmosphere, and oceans; the influence of periodic "evolutionary pumps" such as massive glaciations and bolide impacts; and whatever factors may have led to the emergence of eukaryotic cells, sexual reproduction, and the Cambrian explosion of animal, plant, and fungi phyla. The evolution of human beings and of human intelligence may have required yet further specific events and circumstances, all of which are extremely unlikely to have happened

claims_retained: Kulingana na “Nadharia ya Nadra ya Dunia”, uwepo wa viumbe vyenye akili kama wanadamu unaweza kuwa tukio adimu sana kwa sababu unategemea mfululizo mrefu wa bahati mbaya ya hali mahususi: nyota na mfumo wa sayari lazima wawe katika eneo linaloweza kuishi, sayari yenyewe iwe na ulinganifu sahihi wa misa, iwe na walinzi wa gesi kama Mshtarii kuikinga na athari nyingi, iwe na satelaiti kubwa, gesi uhamaji (tectonics) na uwanja wa sumaku unaoleta utulivu wa muda mrefu kwa angahewa, pamoja na mzunguko sahihi wa elementi za kemikali katika bahari na angahewa [1].

Zaidi ya hayo, hatua muhimu za kibiolojia—kuibuka kwa seli za eukaryoti, uzazi wa kijinsia, “mlipuko” wa Cambrian, na hatimaye mageuzi ya akili ya kibinadamu—zinaweza kuwa zinahitaji matukio mengine adimu yasiyotarajiwa [1].
prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Rare Earth hypothesis (en.wikipedia.org)
Content: The Rare Earth hypothesis argues that the evolution of biological complexity anywhere in the universe requires the coincidence of a large number of fortuitous circumstances, including, among others, a galactic habitable zone; a central star and planetary system having the requisite character (i.e. a circumstellar habitable zone); a terrestrial planet of the right mass; the advantage of one or more gas giant guardians like Jupiter and possibly a large natural satellite to shield the planet from frequent impact events; conditions needed to ensure the planet has a magnetosphere and plate tectonics; a chemistry similar to that present in the Earth's lithosphere, atmosphere, and oceans; the influence of periodic "evolutionary pumps" such as massive glaciations and bolide impacts; and whatever factors may have led to the emergence of eukaryotic cells, sexual reproduction, and the Cambrian explosion of animal, plant, and fungi phyla. The evolution of human beings and of human intelligence may have required yet further specific events and circumstances, all of which are extremely unlikely to have happened
---

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: How Do Birds Know Which Way is South? (www.wonderopolis.org)
Content: One thing birds definitely rely upon is the Sun. The Sun rises in the east and sets in the west. Birds flying south for the winter can stay on track by using the Sun's position in the sky throughout the day as a guide.


Of course, once the Sun sets, it isn't much help as a guide. Luckily, many birds can also navigate by the position of the stars in the sky once night rolls around. Constellations guided many sailors at night before modern technology came along. Birds can use the stars as navigational aids in the same way.


Birds also have the benefit of a bird's eye view. Human hikers lost in the woods sometimes must climb to the top of the nearest mountain to be able to see natural or man-made landscape features, like roads or coastlines, to find their way home. Birds just take to the sky where they get an awesome view of everything below them. Sometimes traveling south is as simple as following the path of a river that travels south to warmer temperatures.


Finally, some scientists believe some birds may also get some of their guidance from Earth's magnetic field. Some species of birds have a highly-magnetic mineral called magnetite in their brains. Experts believe this mineral may help birds detect Earth's magnetic field and use it to guide them south.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: How Do Birds Navigate? (www.nationalgeographic.org)
Content: The flight paths used by birds in their annual migrations are called flyway s.


Scientists are not entirely sure how birds navigate their flyways. They seem to have an internal global positioning system (GPS) that allows them to follow the same pattern every year. A young bird imprint s on the sun and stars to help orient it. Some researchers think a bird may also recognize landmark s.


Individual organ s also contribute to a bird’s remarkable navigational ability. A bird’s eyes interact with its brain in a region called “cluster N”, which probably helps the bird determine which way is north. Tiny amounts of iron in the neurons of a bird’s inner ear also help in this determination.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: How do migratory birds find their way ? - News - EducaPoles (www.educapoles.org)
Content: nother tool is the earth's magnetic field (earth's north and south magnetic poles). Some birds, like pigeons, have a small zone in their brain made of magnetite (magnetic mineral), just like a small compass. But other scientists think it's rather in their eyes that some birds have a system which indicates them where the magnetic north is...


Of course, birds also use their knowledge of the landscape: they follow rivers, valleys or roads, or locate themselves with particular mountain peaks.


Other tracks are still to be explored. For example it seems that some birds could find their way by following their sense of smell...
---

Title: ORION: The algorithm proving that left isn't right | UPS (www.ups.com)
Content: Left turns mean idling, which increases the time a route takes. Left turns mean going against traffic, which increases exposure to oncoming cars. Right turns are faster. Right turns save fuel.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Why UPS trucks (almost) never turn left (www.cnn.com)
Content: Left turns are also three times more likely to kill pedestrians than right ones, according to data collected by New York City’s transportation planners.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: The Science Behind Why UPS Trucks Avoid Making Left Turns (bigthink.com)
Content: By keeping left-hand turns to a minimum, UPS says it's saved 10 million gallons of fuel, avoided the emission of 20,000 tons of CO2, and delivered 350,000 more packages a year. UPS senior vice president Bob Stoffel told Fortune, “We'll never have a person turn left to deliver on that side. We'll have someone go down the right-hand side and someone coming back down the right-hand side to avoid those left-hand turns. And that's where you get stuck in traffic trying to come back across."

claim: “Mfano mdogo” (model minority) ni dhana iliyoibuka katika vyombo vya habari zaidi ya miaka 50 iliyopita inayodai kuwa kuna kundi la wachache—linalotajwa mara nyingi kuwa ni Wamarekani wa Asia—linalofanikiwa kupita kiasi katika elimu, uchumi na utamaduni, na hivyo linawekwa kama mfano wa kuigwa kwa makundi mengine ya wachache
question_src: Je! "Mfano mdogo" ni nini?
all_claims: “Mfano mdogo” (model minority) ni dhana iliyoibuka katika vyombo vya habari zaidi ya miaka 50 iliyopita inayodai kuwa kuna kundi la wachache—linalotajwa mara nyingi kuwa ni Wamarekani wa Asia—linalofanikiwa kupita kiasi katika elimu, uchumi na utamaduni, na hivyo linawekwa kama mfano wa kuigwa kwa makundi mengine ya wachache[1].

Hadithi hii husifiwa kwa kuonyesha takwimu za ufaulu wa kikundi hicho, lakini pia hutumika kuashiria kwamba mafanikio yao yanatokana na maadili ya “kufanya kazi kwa bidii” na “nidhamu ya kitamaduni,” na hivyo kuibua presha na matarajio yasiyo na msingi kwa watu kutoka jamii husika[2].

Wataalamu wanaonya kuwa simulizi hili hupunguza utajiri wa tofauti za tabaka, kabila na historia ndani ya kundi hilo, na hata kuwalaumu wale wasiopata mafanikio kana kwamba hawajajituma vya kutosha[4].

Aidha, simulizi hilo linaweza kusababisha msongo wa kisaikolojia kwa makundi mengine ya wachache, kama vile watu wanaojitambulisha kama Amerika ya Kusini, ambao hukabiliwa na shinikizo la kuifikia “kiwango” hicho kinachodhaniwa[3].
claims_retained: “Mfano mdogo” (model minority) ni dhana iliyoibuka katika vyombo vya habari zaidi ya miaka 50 iliyopita inayodai kuwa kuna kundi la wachache—linalotajwa mara nyingi kuwa ni Wamarekani wa Asia—linalofanikiwa kupita kiasi katika elimu, uchumi na utamaduni, na hivyo linawekwa kama mfano wa kuigwa kwa makundi mengine ya wachache[1].

Wataalamu wanaonya kuwa simulizi hili hupunguza utajiri wa tofauti za tabaka, kabila na historia ndani ya kundi hilo, na hata kuwalaumu wale wasiopata mafanikio kana kwamba hawajajituma vya kutosha[4].
prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: The Model Minority Myth | The Practice (thepractice.law.harvard.edu)
Content: Since its introduction in popular media more than a half century ago, the term “model minority” has often been used to refer to a minority group perceived as particularly successful, especially in a manner that contrasts with other minority groups.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: The Model Minority Myth | The Practice (thepractice.law.harvard.edu)
Content: In particular, the model minority designation is often applied to Asian Americans, who, as a group, are often praised for apparent success across academic, economic, and cultural domains
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Model Minority Stereotype (cmhc.utexas.edu)
Content: Individuals who identify as Asian American may feel pressured to meet these cultural expectations.
---
Document ID: 4
Title: What Does Model Minority Mean—And Why Does the Term Cause Harm? Here's What Experts Say (www.msn.com)
Content: "The model minority myth reduces Asians to a stereotypical image," Chen tells Health. "It doesn't see them as individuals and groups with cultural, class, and other differences. It also attributes so-called 'success' to culture, and implicitly blames those who are deemed as not successful for not trying hard enough."
---

question_src: Je! Benki ingefanyaje pesa ikiwa ningeweka dola bilioni 1 kwenye akiba yangu, ukizingatia riba itakuwa mamilioni?
all_claims: Iwapo utaweka dola bilioni 1 katika akaunti ya akiba yenye APY ya 1.50%, benki italazimika kukulipa takriban dola milioni 15 kwa riba kila mwaka; hata hivyo, benki itageuza hizo dola bilioni 1 ziwe mikopo yenye viwango vya juu zaidi na kuvuna mapato mengi zaidi [1].
Kwa mfano, sehemu ya amana yako inaweza kufadhili rehani kwa 5.50%, mkopo wa mwanafunzi kwa 6.65% au salio la kadi za mkopo kwa 16.99% APR [1].
Hata ikichukua wastani wa 6% kwenye mikopo yote, mapato ya riba yatakuwa takriban dola milioni 60 kwa mwaka.
Gharama yao ya kuku­lipa riba ikibaki milioni 15, faida ya kimsingi ya riba inaweza kufikia karibu dola milioni 45 kabla ya gharama nyingine.

Zaidi ya hapo, benki bado hupata mapato kutoka kwa ada za akaunti, ada za ATM, tume na adhabu mbalimbali kwa wateja wengine, ambazo huongeza zaidi marupurupu yao licha ya gharama yako kubwa ya amana [2].
Hivyo, hata ukiwa umechukua “mamilioni” yako ya riba, benki bado “inavuna” makumi ya mamilioni kila mwaka kwa kutumia mtaji wako.
claims_retained: Iwapo utaweka dola bilioni 1 katika akaunti ya akiba yenye APY ya 1.50%, benki italazimika kukulipa takriban dola milioni 15 kwa riba kila mwaka; hata hivyo, benki itageuza hizo dola bilioni 1 ziwe mikopo yenye viwango vya juu zaidi na kuvuna mapato mengi zaidi [1].
Kwa mfano, sehemu ya amana yako inaweza kufadhili rehani kwa 5.50%, mkopo wa mwanafunzi kwa 6.65% au salio la kadi za mkopo kwa 16.99% APR [1].

Zaidi ya hapo, benki bado hupata mapato kutoka kwa ada za akaunti, ada za ATM, tume na adhabu mbalimbali kwa wateja wengine, ambazo huongeza zaidi marupurupu yao licha ya gharama yako kubwa ya amana [2].
prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Finance 101: How Do Banks Make Money? - Money Under 30 (www.moneyunder30.com)
Content: It all ties back to the fundamental way banks make money: Banks use depositors’ money to make loans. The amount of interest the banks collect on the loans is greater than the amount of interest they pay to customers with savings accounts—and the difference is the banks’ profit.


For example: You currently have an emergency fund of $10,000 in a high yield savings account that may pay 1.50% APY. The bank uses that money to fund someone’s:


* Mortgage at 5.50% APR
* Student loan at 6.65% APR
* Credit card at 16.99% APR


Your bank may have paid you $150 in a year’s time but they earned hundreds or thousands more from the interest on loans (made possible with your money). Now, think about this process repeated with millions of banking customers and billions of dollars.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Finance 101: How Do Banks Make Money? - Money Under 30 (www.moneyunder30.com)
Content: Yes, banks make a lot of money banks from charging borrowers interest, but the fees banks change are just as lucrative.


* Account fees. Some typical financial products that charge fees are checking accounts, investment accounts, and credit cards. These fees are said to be for “maintenances purposes” even though maintaining these accounts costs banks relatively little.
* ATM fees. There will be times when you can’t find your bank’s ATM and you must settle for another ATM just to get some cash. Well, that’s probably going to cost you $3. Such situations happen all the time and just mean more money for banks.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Finance 101: How Do Banks Make Money? - Money Under 30 (www.moneyunder30.com)
Content: * Penalty charges. Banks love to slap on a penalty fee for something a customer’s mishaps. It could a credit card payment that you sent in at 5:05PM. It could be a check written for an amount that was one penny over what you had in your checking account. Whatever it may be, expect to pay a late fee or a notorious overdraft fee or between $25 and $40. It sucks for customers, but the banks are having a blast.
* Commissions. Most banks will have investment divisions that often function as full-service brokerages. Of course, their commission fees for making trades are higher than most discount brokers.
* Application fees. Whenever a prospective borrower applies for a loan (especially a home loan) many banks charge a loan origination or application fee. And, they can take the liberty of including this fee amount into the principal of your loan—which means you’ll pay interest on it too! (So if your loan application fee is $100 and your bank rolls it into a 30-year mortgage at 5% APR, you’ll pay $94.40 in interest just on the $100 fee).
---

Title: Finance 101: How Do Banks Make Money? - Money Under 30 (www.moneyunder30.com)
Content: It all ties back to the fundamental way banks make money: Banks use depositors’ money to make loans. The amount of interest the banks collect on the loans is greater than the amount of interest they pay to customers with savings accounts—and the difference is the banks’ profit.


For example: You currently have an emergency fund of $10,000 in a high yield savings account that may pay 1.50% APY. The bank uses that money to fund someone’s:


* Mortgage at 5.50% APR
* Student loan at 6.65% APR
* Credit card at 16.99% APR


Your bank may have paid you $150 in a year’s time but they earned hundreds or thousands more from the interest on loans (made possible with your money). Now, think about this process repeated with millions of banking customers and billions of dollars.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Finance 101: How Do Banks Make Money? - Money Under 30 (www.moneyunder30.com)
Content: Yes, banks make a lot of money banks from charging borrowers interest, but the fees banks change are just as lucrative.


* Account fees. Some typical financial products that charge fees are checking accounts, investment accounts, and credit cards. These fees are said to be for “maintenances purposes” even though maintaining these accounts costs banks relatively little.
* ATM fees. There will be times when you can’t find your bank’s ATM and you must settle for another ATM just to get some cash. Well, that’s probably going to cost you $3. Such situations happen all the time and just mean more money for banks.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Finance 101: How Do Banks Make Money? - Money Under 30 (www.moneyunder30.com)
Content: * Penalty charges. Banks love to slap on a penalty fee for something a customer’s mishaps. It could a credit card payment that you sent in at 5:05PM. It could be a check written for an amount that was one penny over what you had in your checking account. Whatever it may be, expect to pay a late fee or a notorious overdraft fee or between $25 and $40. It sucks for customers, but the banks are having a blast.
* Commissions. Most banks will have investment divisions that often function as full-service brokerages. Of course, their commission fees for making trades are higher than most discount brokers.
* Application fees. Whenever a prospective borrower applies for a loan (especially a home loan) many banks charge a loan origination or application fee. And, they can take the liberty of including this fee amount into the principal of your loan—which means you’ll pay interest on it too! (So if your loan application fee is $100 and your bank rolls it into a 30-year mortgage at 5% APR, you’ll pay $94.40 in interest just on the $100 fee).
---

question_src: Ikiwa ningeunda kampuni, kuwa na deni la $ 1M, kwenda kufilisika, ni vipi kampuni ambayo nina deni kupata pesa zake? lazima nilipe?
all_claims: Ukifungua LLC/Shirika, ukakopa $1M, kisha kampuni ikafilisika, deni hilo linageuka kuwa dai dhidi ya mali za kampuni na hukidhiwa kutoka katika mali zitakazouzwa na msimamizi wa kufilisika; ikiwa mali hazitoshi, kiasi kilichobaki hakitalipwa na kampuni tena [1].

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: If A Company Goes Out of Business Do I Owe Debt to Collection Agency? (www.debtcollectionanswers.com)
Content: The debt you owe as a debtor to a company that goes into bankruptcy administration will become part of the assets of the company in bankruptcy.


However, exactly what happens if you owe money to a company that goes out of business, and how that debt will be collected, depends in part on the status of the debt.



"The fact that a company files for bankruptcy does not automatically erase any


debt you owe."


If a lender is collecting the debt but goes out of business, you will need to continue to make payments on the loan or you risk damage to your credit reports and credit scores. If the company files for bankruptcy, the court will instruct you where to make your monthly payments if that changes. If you have any dispute over whether the debt is valid, raise that dispute as soon as you are notified of the bankruptcy. If you don’t, the debt may be considered valid.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: When You Might Be Personally Liable for LLC or Corporate Debt (www.nolo.com)
Content: If you cosign on a business loan, you are as equally responsible as the corporation or LLC to pay it back. This is usually the simplest way to voluntarily make yourself liable for your company's debts. Similarly, if you personally guarantee an obligation of the corporation or LLC then the creditor can come after your personal assets if the business defaults on the loan.


## Pledging Your Property as Collateral


If you have a new company or your company does not have many assets, a creditor may require you to provide some sort of collateral before approving the loan. If you agree to pledge your house or other personal assets as collateral for the business loan, the creditor may be able to take your property and sell it to satisfy the obligations of the company.


## Piercing the Corporate Veil


Above we discussed the ways you can voluntarily make yourself personally liable for a corporate or LLC debt. However, a creditor can also try to go after your personal assets by eliminating the limited liability protection provided by the corporation or LLC. This is commonly referred to as piercing the corporate veil.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: When You Might Be Personally Liable for LLC or Corporate Debt (www.nolo.com)
Content: more likely to pierce the corporate veil if:


* Corporate formalities, such as holding annual meetings and keeping minutes, were not followed.
* Certain owners exerted too much control over the corporation or LLC.
* Owners commingled personal funds with company funds or used personal funds to satisfy company obligations.
* The company was not sufficiently capitalized when it was formed.


(To learn more, see Piercing the Corporate Veil: When LLCs and Corporations May Be at Risk.)


## Fraud


A corporation or LLC's owners may also be held personally liable if they are found to have committed fraud
---

claim: Maji huchemka wakati shinikizo la mvuke wake linalingana na shinikizo la anga, hivyo yakifika milimani ambako shinikizo la anga ni dogo, kiwango hicho hushuka na kuwaruhusu kuchemka chini ya 100 °C
question_src: Maji yanawezaje kuchemsha chini ya 100 ° C?
all_claims: Maji huchemka wakati shinikizo la mvuke wake linalingana na shinikizo la anga, hivyo yakifika milimani ambako shinikizo la anga ni dogo, kiwango hicho hushuka na kuwaruhusu kuchemka chini ya 100 °C [3].
Molekuli za maji huondoka uso wake kwa urahisi zaidi kwa sababu hewa inayozizuia ni kidogo, kwa hiyo huanza kuyeyuka na kuchemka mapema kuliko ilivyo ngazini ya bahari [2].
Katika futi 5,000 (≈1,524 m) juu ya usawa wa bahari maji huchemka karibu 95 °C (203 °F), na kwenye futi 10,000 (≈3,048 m) huchemka takriban 90 °C (194 °F) [3].
Hali hii inaonyesha kuwa kupunguza shinikizo—iwe kwa kupanda mlima au kutumia pampu ya utupu—ndiyo sababu kuu inayofanya maji yaweze kuchemka chini ya 100 °C.
Kwa kuwa joto la kupikia hupungua pamoja na kiwango cha kuchemsha, chakula hupikwa katika joto la chini kuliko kawaida, jambo linaloweza kuongeza muda wa mapishi [1].

Title: What Is the Boiling Point of Water at Various Altitudes? (www.thespruceeats.com)
Content: One of the most significant changes that occur in high altitude areas concerning cooking is the boiling point of water. As the altitude increases, the atmospheric pressure pushing down on water decreases, which allows the water to boil at lower temperatures.


A lower boiling point means that food cooks at a lower temperature, despite the fact that the water is boiling. It is important to recognize just how much the temperature of boiling water is reduced as the altitude increases.

Title: Why Does Water Boil Quickly At High Altitudes? » Science ABC (www.scienceabc.com)
Content: Water molecules have an easy time escaping off the surface when the air pressure above them is less. Since this is a naturally-occurring condition in high altitude regions, the boiling point of water is reduced and thus it attains the boiling
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Effects of Altitude on Water Boiling Time (mountainhouse.com)
Content: It also impacts the boiling point of water: the temperature at which liquid water begins turning to vapor, which occurs when its vapor pressure equals the atmospheric pressure. At a higher elevation, the lower atmospheric pressure means heated water reaches its boiling point more quickly—i.e., at a lower temperature. Water at sea level boils at 212 degrees Fahrenheit; at 5,000 feet above sea level, the boiling point is 203 degrees F. Up at 10,000 feet, water boils at 194 degrees F.

At a higher elevation, the lower atmospheric pressure means heated water reaches its boiling point more quickly—i.e., at a lower temperature. Water at sea level boils at 212 degrees Fahrenheit; at 5,000 feet above sea level, the boiling point is 203 degrees F. Up at 10,000 feet, water boils at 194 degrees F.

question_src: Je! Kwa nini idadi ya watu wa Amerika ya Kusini ilikataliwa na kufichua magonjwa ya Ulaya, lakini wachunguzi wa Ulaya hawakupata magonjwa makubwa kutoka kwa wenyeji?
all_claims: Wachunguzi wa Ulaya walipoleta mabomba kama ndui na surua, yalienea haraka miongoni mwa wenyeji wa Amerika Kusini ambao hawakuwa wamewahi kukutana nayo wala kutengeneza kinga ya asili, hivyo vifo vikubwa vilifuata [1].
Katika Ulimwengu wa Kale magonjwa hayo yalikuwa yamesambaa kwa karne nyingi, hivyo Waulaya wengi walikuwa tayari wamenusurika ama kupata kinga ya kudumu, jambo lililowalinda walipovuka Atlantiki [1].

Maendeleo ya magonjwa ya mlipuko hutegemea eneo lenye watu wengi na mfumo mbovu wa kutenganisha maji taka na maji safi; miji mikubwa ya Ulaya kama London ilitoa mazingira bora kwa vimelea kubadilika na kuwa hatari zaidi [2].

Kinyume chake, kabla ya uvamizi, Amerika ya Kusini ilikuwa na miji michache na idadi ndogo ya watu ikilinganishwa na Ulaya, hivyo magonjwa makubwa ya kuambukiza yalikuwa machache au hayakuweza kubadilika huko [3].

Zaidi, magonjwa mengi hatari ya binadamu hutokana na zoonoses; Ulaya ilikuwa na mifugo mingi kama ng'ombe, nguruwe na farasi, ilhali Ulimwengu Mpya uliishi na wanyama wachache waliowekwa, na hivyo haukuzalisha magonjwa mapya yanayoweza kusambaa kwa wageni [4].
Kwa sababu hiyo, Waulaya hawakupata magonjwa makubwa mapya, wakati wakazi wa Amerika Kusini walipungua kwa makadirio ya hadi 90 % katika karne ya kwanza ya mawasiliano.

question_src: Je! Kisafishaji kizito cha koti nzito kinaweza kufanya kazi kwa kiwango kikubwa cha maji yaliyosimama?
all_claims: Ndiyo; kisafishaji kizito cha kukimbia, hasa aina za asidi au caustic, kinaweza kufanya kazi hata panapokuwa na kiwango kikubwa cha maji yaliyosimama kwa sababu fomula yake ni nzito kuliko maji, hivyo hupenya na kushuka moja kwa moja hadi kwenye kizibo kilipo badala ya kuelea juu ya uso wa maji [2].

Mara kinapofika kwenye kizibo, athari zake za kemikali—kuchukua au kutoa elektroni—hutengeneza joto na gesi zinazosaidia kuyeyusha mafuta, sabuni au taka nyingine zilizoganda, na hivyo kuondoa kizuizi bila haja ya kuondoa maji yaliyosimama kwanza [2].

Hata hivyo, ili kuongeza ufanisi, fuata maelekezo ya mtengenezaji kama vile kumwaga vikombe 1½–2 vya kisafishaji, kusubiri karibu dakika 15, kisha kusafisha bomba kwa maji baridi kwa dakika tano ili kuondoa mabaki na kulinda bomba [1].

Title: Buyer’s Guide: The Best Drain Cleaners (www.bobvila.com)
Content: Sulfuric acid is the key ingredient of this ultra-strength acidic drain cleaner. It’s potent enough to clear sink and toilet clogs that other cleaners leave behind. Use by pouring one-and-a-half to two cups of cleaner into a drain, waiting for 15 minutes, then flushing for five minutes with cold water.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: How Drain Cleaners Work (home.howstuffworks.com)
Content: * Oxidizing drain cleaners contain substances such as household bleach, peroxides and nitrates. These chemicals cause the organic material of the clog to lose electrons and become oxidized. The product is heavier than water, so it can move through standing water, and it releases heat and gas to help clear the blockage. * Acid drain cleaners aren't commonly found in stores, and some are sold only to plumbers. These typically contain high concentrations of sulfuric acid or hydrochloric acid, substances that increase hydronium ions in a solution and attract electrons from the clog. The hydronium ions react chemically with the material in the clog, and the reaction releases heat, which is necessary to melt congealed grease [source: Sheridan].
---
Document ID: 3
Title: How Drain Cleaners Work (home.howstuffworks.com)
Content: Be they liquid, gel or powder form, most of the drain cleaners you'll find on store shelves use strong chemicals, and they come in liquid, gel and powder forms. All chemical reactions involve moving electrons, and drain cleaners work by either taking or giving electrons to the clogging substance, generating heat in the process. There are three main types of drain cleaners:

 * Caustic drain cleaners contain substances such as lye and caustic potash. They're bases, so they give electrons to the clogging substance, and their hydroxide ions create the reaction that clears the clog. Their alkaline, or basic, chemicals release heat and turn grease into a soap-like substance that's more easily dissolved. These drain cleaners are typically heavier than water, which enables them to reach the clog through standing water.

claim: Kwa mtazamo wa kibaolojia wanadamu huchukuliwa kama omnivores kwa kuwa jamii zote za kibinadamu humeza nyama, ingawa kiasi chake hutofautiana
question_src: Je! Wanadamu ni omnivores? Kwa nini vegans wengi wanasema sisi ni mimea ya mimea?
all_claims: Kwa mtazamo wa kibaolojia wanadamu huchukuliwa kama omnivores kwa kuwa jamii zote za kibinadamu humeza nyama, ingawa kiasi chake hutofautiana [1].
Uchunguzi wa anatomia unaonyesha mpangilio wa meno yetu si maalumu kwa wanyama wala mimea pekee bali ni wa mchanganyiko, tabia ya wanyama wanaokula vyakula vya aina zote mbili [3].

claim: Catabolism ni mchakato wa kimetaboliki unaovunja miundo mikubwa kama protini, wanga na mafuta kuwa vitengo vidogo—mfano kuvunjwa kwa kipande cha mkate kuwa molekuli rahisi za sukari—na kutoa nishati inayotumika mara moja; ukikosa chakula, huenda hatua hii ikavunja hata misuli na mafuta ya mwili ili kupata nguvu za kuishi
question_src: Anabolism dhidi ya catabolism, ni nini kila, kila mmoja anaathirije mwili wa mwanadamu, ni nini chanya/hasi ni za kila mmoja.
all_claims: Catabolism ni mchakato wa kimetaboliki unaovunja miundo mikubwa kama protini, wanga na mafuta kuwa vitengo vidogo—mfano kuvunjwa kwa kipande cha mkate kuwa molekuli rahisi za sukari—na kutoa nishati inayotumika mara moja; ukikosa chakula, huenda hatua hii ikavunja hata misuli na mafuta ya mwili ili kupata nguvu za kuishi [1].
Huchukua chochote usichotumia sasa na kukihifadhi kama mafuta, hivyo huweza kuongeza uzito bila kujali ubora wa chakula unachokula [3].

Anabolism ni kinyume: huchukua vitengo vidogo kama asidi ya amino, virutubishi na seli, kisha kuvifunga kuunda tishu mpya, kuponya majeraha na kujenga misuli, jambo linaloonekana pia kwenye ukuaji wa watoto na kuimarika kwa nguvu ya misuli [2].
Hutegemea upatikanaji wa virutubishi bora kama mboga, matunda na nyama konda ili mwili upate “vifaa vya ujenzi” vya kutosha [3].
Kiumsingi, catabolism hutoa nishati ilhali anabolism hutumia nishati kuunda molekuli mpya [4].
Chanya za catabolism ni upatikanaji wa nishati ya haraka; hasi ni hatari ya kupoteza misuli na kuhifadhi mafuta kupita kiasi.
Chanya za anabolism ni ukarabati wa tishu, ukuaji na kujenga misuli; hasi ni utegemezi wake kwa nishati na lishe bora, hivyo hukwama ukikosa virutubishi.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Anabolism vs. Catabolism: The Role They Play in Your Metabolism (health.clevelandclinic.org)
Content: When you think catabolism, think digestion, says DiMarino. This process takes larger structures like proteins, fats or tissues and breaks them down into smaller units such as cells or fatty acids. 


Catabolism occurs when you’re digesting food. For example, it’s the process that dissolves a piece of bread into simple nutrients your body can use, like glucose (blood sugar). And if your body isn’t getting the food and nutrients it needs to fuel daily living, catabolism is the mechanism that breaks down muscle and fat for energy.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Anabolism vs. Catabolism: The Role They Play in Your Metabolism (health.clevelandclinic.org)
Content: ### What is anabolism? 


Anabolism is the opposite of catabolism: It’s the mechanism that takes smaller units like nutrients, cells, or amino acids and bonds them together to create bigger structures. 


“One example of anabolism in action is when your body is trying to heal a cut. It adds tissue and structures around that wound,” DiMarino explains. “It’s also the process involved in a child’s growth and in building stronger muscles.”
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Anabolism vs. Catabolism: The Role They Play in Your Metabolism (health.clevelandclinic.org)
Content: Catabolism functions no matter what you give your body, states DiMarino. It breaks down food, whether it’s junky or nutritious. Whatever it doesn’t use for energy now, it stores for later (hello, extra pounds). 


But anabolism is entirely different. It only functions properly when you’re getting enough nutrients through foods like vegetables, fruits and lean meats. Your body needs high-quality building blocks to heal, repair and grow.
---
Document ID: 4
Title: Difference Between Anabolism and Catabolism - An Overview (byjus.com)
Content: The major differences between Catabolism and Anabolism are the way the molecules are utilized in the body. Anabolism creates molecules the body needs for functionality and it uses energy in the process. Catabolism, on the other hand, breaks down complex molecules and releases energy which is available for the body to use.
