Anabolism ni kinyume: huchukua vitengo vidogo kama asidi ya amino, virutubishi na seli, kisha kuvifunga kuunda tishu mpya, kuponya majeraha na kujenga misuli, jambo linaloonekana pia kwenye ukuaji wa watoto na kuimarika kwa nguvu ya misuli [2].
Hutegemea upatikanaji wa virutubishi bora kama mboga, matunda na nyama konda ili mwili upate “vifaa vya ujenzi” vya kutosha [3].
Kiumsingi, catabolism hutoa nishati ilhali anabolism hutumia nishati kuunda molekuli mpya [4].
prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Anabolism vs. Catabolism: The Role They Play in Your Metabolism (health.clevelandclinic.org)
Content: When you think catabolism, think digestion, says DiMarino. This process takes larger structures like proteins, fats or tissues and breaks them down into smaller units such as cells or fatty acids. 


Catabolism occurs when you’re digesting food. For example, it’s the process that dissolves a piece of bread into simple nutrients your body can use, like glucose (blood sugar). And if your body isn’t getting the food and nutrients it needs to fuel daily living, catabolism is the mechanism that breaks down muscle and fat for energy.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Anabolism vs. Catabolism: The Role They Play in Your Metabolism (health.clevelandclinic.org)
Content: ### What is anabolism? 


Anabolism is the opposite of catabolism: It’s the mechanism that takes smaller units like nutrients, cells, or amino acids and bonds them together to create bigger structures. 


“One example of anabolism in action is when your body is trying to heal a cut. It adds tissue and structures around that wound,” DiMarino explains. “It’s also the process involved in a child’s growth and in building stronger muscles.”
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Anabolism vs. Catabolism: The Role They Play in Your Metabolism (health.clevelandclinic.org)
Content: Catabolism functions no matter what you give your body, states DiMarino. It breaks down food, whether it’s junky or nutritious. Whatever it doesn’t use for energy now, it stores for later (hello, extra pounds). 


But anabolism is entirely different. It only functions properly when you’re getting enough nutrients through foods like vegetables, fruits and lean meats. Your body needs high-quality building blocks to heal, repair and grow.
---
Document ID: 4
Title: Difference Between Anabolism and Catabolism - An Overview (byjus.com)
Content: The major differences between Catabolism and Anabolism are the way the molecules are utilized in the body. Anabolism creates molecules the body needs for functionality and it uses energy in the process. Catabolism, on the other hand, breaks down complex molecules and releases energy which is available for the body to use.

claim: Kampuni huweka maadili ili yawe dira ya maamuzi, kwani thamani hizo “husaidia kampuni katika michakato ya kufanya maamuzi” na kusimama katikati ya usimamizi wa utendaji [1];
question_src: Kwa nini kampuni zina 'maadili'?
all_claims: Kampuni huweka maadili ili yawe dira ya maamuzi, kwani thamani hizo “husaidia kampuni katika michakato ya kufanya maamuzi” na kusimama katikati ya usimamizi wa utendaji [1];[5].
Kwa upande wa soko, maadili “huelimisha wateja na wateja wanaowezekana kuhusu kampuni hiyo inahusu na kufafanua utambulisho wa kampuni,” hivyo kuongeza uaminifu na kutofautisha chapa [2].

Kwenye rasilimali watu, maadili ni “zana za kuajiri za msingi na za kutunza,” zikivutia na kubakiza vipaji bora [3], na wafanyakazi wanaojitambulisha kwa nguvu na maadili hayo “wana uwezekano mkubwa wa kushikamana kwa muda mrefu,” jambo linalopunguza gharama za mzunguko wa ajira na kulinda maarifa ya shirika [4].

Hatimaye, kuyatambua maadili kunasaidia “kufafanua vyema utamaduni wa kampuni—dhamira yake kubwa na sababu iliyopo,” hivyo kuleta mshikamano wa ndani na kufafanua mchango wa kampuni kwa jamii zaidi ya bidhaa au huduma zake [6].
Kwa kifupi, maadili ni msingi wa mkakati, tamaduni, ushiriki wa wateja na nguvu kazi endelevu.

Response: Kampuni huweka maadili ili yawe dira ya maamuzi, kwani thamani hizo “husaidia kampuni katika michakato ya kufanya maamuzi” na kusimama katikati ya usimamizi wa utendaji [1]; [

claim: Kampuni huweka maadili ili yawe dira ya maamuzi, kwani thamani hizo “husaidia kampuni katika michakato ya kufanya maamuzi” na kusimama katikati ya usimamizi wa utendaji [1];
question_src: Kwa nini kampuni zina 'maadili'?
all_claims: Kampuni huweka maadili ili yawe dira ya maamuzi, kwani thamani hizo “husaidia kampuni katika michakato ya kufanya maamuzi” na kusimama katikati ya usimamizi wa utendaji [1];[5].
Kwa upande wa soko, maadili “huelimisha wateja na wateja wanaowezekana kuhusu kampuni hiyo inahusu na kufafanua utambulisho wa kampuni,” hivyo kuongeza uaminifu na kutofautisha chapa [2].

Kwenye rasilimali watu, maadili ni “zana za kuajiri za msingi na za kutunza,” zikivutia na kubakiza vipaji bora [3], na wafanyakazi wanaojitambulisha kwa nguvu na maadili hayo “wana uwezekano mkubwa wa kushikamana kwa muda mrefu,” jambo linalopunguza gharama za mzunguko wa ajira na kulinda maarifa ya shirika [4].

Hatimaye, kuyatambua maadili kunasaidia “kufafanua vyema utamaduni wa kampuni—dhamira yake kubwa na sababu iliyopo,” hivyo kuleta mshikamano wa ndani na kufafanua mchango wa kampuni kwa jamii zaidi ya bidhaa au huduma zake [6].
Kwa kifupi, maadili ni msingi wa mkakati, tamaduni, ushiriki wa wateja na nguvu kazi endelevu.
claims_retained: Kampuni huweka maadili ili yawe dira ya maamuzi, kwani thamani hizo “husaidia kampuni katika michakato ya kufanya maamuzi” na kusimama katikati ya usimamizi wa utendaji [1];[5].
Kampuni huweka maadili ili yawe dira ya maamuzi, kwani thamani hizo “husaidia kampuni katika michakato ya kufanya maamuzi” na kusimama katikati ya usimamizi wa utendaji [1];[5].

question_src: Je! Watu huepukaje na squatting ndani ya nyumba bila kukamatwa?
all_claims: Watu wanaoingia katika mali isiyomilikiwa kisheria hupunguza hatari ya kukamatwa kwa kuhakikisha ukaaji wao unatimia masharti ya “milki mbaya,” ambayo hutegemea muda mrefu wa kumiliki bila pingamizi; kwa mfano, New York inahitaji wakae miaka 10 bila mmiliki kuchukua hatua ili waweze kudai haki fulani na hivyo kuepuka kushtakiwa kwa uvamizi [1].

Ili kuimarisha nafasi hii, baadhi ya majimbo yanawataka kuonyesha hati, kulipa kodi au ushuru wa mali, na kukidhi masharti haya kunaweza hata kupunguza muda unaotakiwa kabla ya kudai umiliki, hivyo kupunguza uwezekano wa hatua za jinai kuchukuliwa dhidi yao [2].

Mbali na muda na nyaraka, squatter hulinda nafasi yao kwa kuishi waziwazi na kuitumia mali “kama mmiliki,” ikiwa ni pamoja na kutunza nyumba, kulipia huduma au ushuru; tabia hii huonyesha uhalali wa ukaaji na kuifanya iwe vigumu kwa mamlaka kuthibitisha uvamizi wa jinai au wizi [3].
Hivyo, mchanganyiko wa ukaaji endelevu, uwazi, malipo ya gharama za mali na ukarabati huchangia squatter “kuepuka kukamatwa” kwa kugeuza uvamizi kuwa suala la madai badala ya jinai.
claims_retained: Watu wanaoingia katika mali isiyomilikiwa kisheria hupunguza hatari ya kukamatwa kwa kuhakikisha ukaaji wao unatimia masharti ya “milki mbaya,” ambayo hutegemea muda mrefu wa kumiliki bila pingamizi; kwa mfano, New York inahitaji wakae miaka 10 bila mmiliki kuchukua hatua ili waweze kudai haki fulani na hivyo kuepuka kushtakiwa kwa uvamizi [1].

Mbali na muda na nyaraka, squatter hulinda nafasi yao kwa kuishi waziwazi na kuitumia mali “kama mmiliki,” ikiwa ni pamoja na kutunza nyumba, kulipia huduma au ushuru; tabia hii huonyesha uhalali wa ukaaji na kuifanya iwe vigumu kwa mamlaka kuthibitisha uvamizi wa jinai au wizi [3].
prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Squatters’ Rights: Guide to State Law & How-To Evict - AAOA (www.american-apartment-owners-association.org)
Content: Squatters rights refers to laws which allow a squatter to use or inhabit another person’s property in the event that the lawful owner does not evict or take action against the squatter.


Typically, squatters rights laws only apply if an individual has been illegitimately occupying a space for a specific period of time. In New York, for example, a squatter can be awarded “adverse possession” under state law if they have been living in a property for 10 years or more.’

Title: Squatters’ Rights: Guide to State Law & How-To Evict - AAOA (www.american-apartment-owners-association.org)
Content: Some of the states listed above require the squatter to possess a deed, or to have paid taxes during their occupancy, while others do not. In some states, if the squatter can produce the required documentation, the number of years may be reduced.

Content: On top of that, they also need to use the land as a real owner would. Each jurisdiction and judge will have different criteria for evidence of this, but it could include anything from the tenant maintaining the property to paying utilities or even property taxes.

question_src: Je! Ni kwanini ni faux-pa kumuuliza mtu ni pesa ngapi? Je! Ni kama hiyo katika tamaduni zingine?
all_claims: Nchini Marekani, kuuliza mtu analipwa kiasi gani huonekana kama faux-pas kwa sababu mapato hutafsiriwa kama ishara ya hadhi, hivyo swali hilo linaweza kuchochea ushindani usiofurahisha kati ya waulizwaji na waulizaji [1].
Aidha watu huogopa kuhukumiwa; wanaopata kidogo wanaweza kuhisi huruma au dharau, ilhali wanaopata zaidi wanaweza kuzushiwa wivu au chuki [3].
Kwa jumla, mazungumzo ya pesa “yanapingana na mikusanyiko ya kijamii” nchini humo, yakionekana kutokuwa na ustaarabu [4].
Unyamavu huo pia huwanufaisha wanaoingiza zaidi, kwani huficha ukosefu wa usawa wa kipato hivyo kuepuka lawama au aibu [4].
Matokeo yake, watu huficha mishahara yao isipokuwa pale inapolazimika au inapotafsiriwa kuwa tendo la kujitolea lenye faida, kama anavyobainisha Profesa Eloundou-Eyegue [1].
Hata hivyo, si tamaduni zote; nchini Paraguay, kuuliza moja kwa moja bei ya simu, zawadi au mshahara ni jambo la kawaida na halionekani kukiuka maadili [5].

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Why So Many Americans Don’t Talk About Money (www.theatlantic.com)
Content: Parfait Eloundou-Enyegue, a development-sociology professor at Cornell University, told me that when income or wealth is invoked as a status symbol, it can spark a competition with others that will be unpleasant for all involved. “For that reason,” he said, “people will refrain from the most blatant forms of self-puffery unless they are absolutely necessary or effective.”
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Why Can't We Talk About How Much We Make? (www.elle.com)
Content: "People feel sensitive about how much money they are making, they feel there is an overwhelming concern that they're going to be judged by it," explained Dr. Ryan T. Howell, an Associate Professor of Psychology at San Francisco State University, and co-founder of Beyond the Purchase, which allows individuals to discover how their spending choices affect their happiness.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Why Can't We Talk About How Much We Make? (www.elle.com)
Content: These primal definitions we attach to money (from power and control, to freedom, peace of mind, and security, to love—giving money without strings attached or giving money with strings attached) indicate that we, as a society, too often conflate earning power with success and personal value, and regard a low income as a result of poor choices or even moral failings. "I think people are generally afraid that if they reveal they make less than one of their friends they'll be regarded with pity, while if they reveal they make more they'll be treated with resentment," said Jennifer Wright
---
Document ID: 4
Title: The Extreme Discomfort of Sharing Salary Information (www.theatlantic.com)
Content: “It goes against social conventions to talk about how much money you have or how much money you make,” she told me. “I think there’s also reluctance, among the people I interviewed for my book, to recognize how much money they have, partly because they’re worried they have more.”


Some of that reluctance comes from having a lot of money in a society that is known to be unequal. “It’s convenient, right? That we have this taboo,” Sherman said, in the sense that not talking about money might allow people who have the most of it in a given society to ignore that fact.
---
Document ID: 5
Title: Why So Many Americans Don’t Talk About Money (www.theatlantic.com)
Content: Similar forms of this “constant chatter” are found elsewhere as well. In a 2018 article for Vice, the writer Paulette Perhach noted that in Paraguay, “people openly ask how much you make, how much your phone costs, and even, one time when I handed someone a present, how much I paid for it. prompt:

Title: Why Do Onions Make You Cry? Enzymes, Treatments & More (www.healthline.com)
Content: Onions spew enzymes and sulfenic acid when their skin is broken. These compounds combine to produce propanethial S-oxide, an irritating gas.


Propanethial S-oxide is a lachrymatory agent, meaning that it generates tears when it touches the eye. Propanethial S-oxide turns into sulfuric acid when it touches the water layer that covers and protects your eyeballs.


But just like onions, your eyes are also equipped with a defense mechanism meant to protect them from harm. When the nerves in each eye detect a lachrymatory agent, they generate tears to flush it out.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Why Do Onions Make You Cry? Enzymes, Treatments & More (www.healthline.com)
Content: The tears you shed while chopping onions are not caused by any type of emotion. They’re reflex tears stimulated by exposure to irritants.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Why Chopping Onions Makes You Cry (www.webmd.com)
Content: "Your eyes have a set of nerves that detect anything that's potentially harmful to your eyes. Your eyes react to the gas that is formed, and your eyes try to flush it out with tears," Rosa explained in a school news release.


However, onions pose no serious threat to your visual health.


"Chopping onions can cause some burning and irritation and tears. Other than that, it's pretty safe on your eyes. It's a temporary sensation with no known long-term effects, nor will it worsen any other conditions, like pink eye," Rosa said.


Goggles can prevent the gas from reaching your eyes while cutting onions, but they aren't really necessary, he added.


"Some people may cut the onions in a bowl of water," Rosa said. "I'd personally recommend using eye drops, like comfort drops, to help lubricate or rinse the eyes and dilute the gas exposure to the eyes."
---

Wakati huo huo, upunguzaji wa uwezo wa barabara—kwa mfano kufunga njia moja au zaidi kwa ajili ya ujenzi—huunda shimo la uwezo (bottleneck) linalosababisha msongamano mrefu na kuchelewesha magari kwa muda mrefu, hasa wakati shughuli hizo zinafanyika saa za kilele cha mchana [2].

Ili kupunguza msongamano, wahandisi hudhibiti mwendo kwa ishara mahususi, kuhamisha kazi za ujenzi nyakati zisizo na shughuli nyingi, na kuweka taarifa kwa madereva ili kudhibiti ongezeko la mahitaji kwa muda.

question_src: Je! Kwa nini tunasema "jozi ya suruali/jeans/kaptula" wakati unazungumza juu ya kitu kimoja cha mavazi wakati wazi sio kuzidisha?
all_claims: Tunasema “jozi ya suruali/jeans/kaptula” kwa sababu kihistoria vazi hilo lilitengenezwa kama vipande viwili tofauti—kipande kimoja kwa kila mguu—vilivyovaliwa kwa pamoja kisha kufungwa kiunoni, hivyo kuonekana kama vitu viwili vilivyo katika umoja mmoja [1]; matokeo yake, Kiingereza kikaanza kutaja vazi hilo kama “pair” (jozi).

Aidha, nomino kama “trousers,” “shorts,” na “jeans” ni plurale tantum, yaani maneno yanayopatikana tu katika wingi; Kamusi ya Kiingereza ya Oxford huainisha aina hii ya nomino kuwa hutumika tu katika fomu ya wingi ili kueleza jambo linalochukuliwa kiakili kama mbili au zaidi, hata kama kimwili ni kitu kimoja [2].

Rekodi za kwanza za matumizi ya “trousers” katika wingi huko Marekani zinaanzia 1840, neno likiwa ufupisho wa “pantaloons,” ambalo chimbuko lake ni mhusika wa tamthilia za Commedia dell’Arte aliyevaa soksi na suruali fupi mbili zinazofanana, jambo lililochochea mtazamo wa “vipande viwili” [3].
Hivyo, mkusanyiko wa historia ya utengenezaji wa vipande viwili na kanuni ya kisarufi ya plurale tantum ndiyo chanzo cha kusema “jozi” tunaporejelea vazi moja la chini.

question_src: Je! Kuna sababu ya kibaolojia kwamba wanadamu wanavutiwa na tabia fulani za usoni (kama vile taya iliyofafanuliwa) au ni upendeleo wa kitamaduni tu?
all_claims: Ndiyo, kuna msingi wa kibaolojia unaoelezea kwa nini watu wengi huvutiwa na tabia fulani za usoni, ingawa ladha za kitamaduni huchangia pia.

Kwanza, muundo laini na rangi ya ngozi huchukuliwa kuwa kidokezo cha uzazi na afya njema, hivyo homogeneity ya ngozi ilihusishwa moja kwa moja na ukadiriaji wa kuvutia katika wanaume, ikionyesha kuwa ngozi inaweza kuwa “alama” ya afya ya ndani na ubora wa jeni [1].

Pili, ulinganifu wa uso unaonekana kuvutia zaidi kwa sababu viwango vya juu vya ulinganifu vinapendekeza mtu aliyeepuka magonjwa na vimelea wakati wa kukua, na hivyo kuwa na kinga thabiti na jeni “bora” kupitisha kizazi kijacho [2].

Tatu, taya iliyofafanuliwa—hasa kwa wanaume—inaashiria viwango vya juu vya testosterone vinavyohusishwa na mfumo wa kinga wenye nguvu na uwezo wa uzazi, jambo ambalo wanawake wengi hulitafsiri kama ishara ya virility na nguvu [3].

Hata hivyo, mabadiliko ya kitamaduni yanaweza kubadili “kigezo” kinachopendelewa, kama vile utafiti ulioona ngozi ya giza ikikadiriwa kuvutia zaidi kinyume na matokeo ya zamani, ukionyesha kuwa upendeleo wa uzuri si wa kibiolojia pekee bali pia huathiriwa na maadili ya kijamii yanayobadilika [1].

Title: Human (Homo sapiens) facial attractiveness in relation to skin texture and color - PubMed (pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov)

In contrast to some previous studies, the authors found that dark skin, not light skin, was rated as most attractive.

Document ID: 2
Title: Facial Symmetry and Attractiveness | The Evolution of Human Sexuality (sites.psu.edu)
Content: The Evolutionary Advantage theory proposed that symmetrical faces are perceived as more attractive because the symmetry indicates good health in an individual. Everyone’s genes are designed to develop a face perfectly symmetrical, but as we grow, develop, and then age, disease, infections, and parasites cause imperfection in our appearance (asymmetry). Thus, those that have less asymmetry and imperfections, are perceived as having better and stronger immune systems to withstand the infections and parasites that occur naturally. So, symmetry is a good indicator of a person having good genes to pass on their offspring.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Why is a Jawline Considered Attractive? (thejawline.net)
Content: A strong Jawline is attractive to the opposite sex


This is a well documented fact, right from an evolutionary perspective. A strong jawline in men is considered to be a sign of high testosterone levels which translates into greater virility. High testosterone levels are a sign of a strong immune system which means greater strength and stamina; therefore a strong jawline in men is considered a trait that is attractive to women.


Women with sharp jawlines are equally attractive to men and a well defined jawline in women is considered a sign of strength, grace and responsibility; traits that are extremely attractive to men. Some of the most beautiful actresses and models are observed to have an extremely chiseled jawline.

Title: Facial Symmetry and Attractiveness | The Evolution of Human Sexuality (sites.psu.edu)
Content: The Evolutionary Advantage theory proposed that symmetrical faces are perceived as more attractive because the symmetry indicates good health in an individual. Everyone’s genes are designed to develop a face perfectly symmetrical, but as we grow, develop, and then age, disease, infections, and parasites cause imperfection in our appearance (asymmetry). Thus, those that have less asymmetry and imperfections, are perceived as having better and stronger immune systems to withstand the infections and parasites that occur naturally. So, symmetry is a good indicator of a person having good genes to pass on their offspring.

Women with sharp jawlines are equally attractive to men and a well defined jawline in women is considered a sign of strength, grace and responsibility; traits that are extremely attractive to men. Some of the most beautiful actresses and models are observed to have an extremely chiseled jawline.

Title: While You Are Sleeping (www.webmd.com)
Content: It tends to go up and down a little during the day, and the same is true at night, although while you’re sleeping it can be 1 to 2 degrees lower than in the daytime. Body temperature starts to fall as bedtime approaches, paving the way for a good night’s sleep. Your body also tends to lose heat, which helps you fall and stay asleep. That’s one of the reasons experts say you shouldn’t exercise close to bedtime: Exercise heats you up. We sleep better when we’re cooler. Your temperature starts to rise toward morning, preparing your body for wakefulness.

question_src: Wataalam wa seismolojia: Je! Unaamuaje ikiwa tetemeko la ardhi lilikuwa likitokea kwa asili au ikiwa ni ya kibinadamu?
all_claims: Wataalamu wa seismolojia huchunguza mambo kadhaa: kwanza hutafuta uhusiano wa kijiografia na shughuli za binadamu kama kuchimba mafuta, kupasua miamba au kujaza maji majabali; matetemeko yanapoonekana kuwekwa mkusanyiko karibu na visima vinavyoingiza au kutoa vimiminika, na hutokea muda mfupi baada ya taratibu hizo kuanza, hulenga kutilia shaka chanzo cha kibinadamu.

question_src: Je! Pikipiki "Wobble" hufanyikaje, na ni ngumu kusahihisha kama inavyoonekana?
all_claims: “Wobble” ya pikipiki hutokea mbele ya tairi linapoanza kutikisika kutoka upande hadi upande kwa kasi baada ya kuingia kwenye mtetemo unaojirudia, jambo ambalo hufanya mpanda farasi ashindwe kudhibiti mwelekeo wa ghafla wa pikipiki [1].

Kawaida mtetemo huo huanzishwa na sababu kama gurudumu la mbele kuinuka ghafla wakati wa kuharakisha au kugonga shimo, hivyo kushusha uthabiti wa upinde wa mbele na kuruhusu mikono ya ‘handlebar’ kwenda upande–kwa–upande kama “tank-slapper” [4].

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Can A Shark Really Smell A Drop Of Blood From A Mile Away? (www.ripleys.com)
Content: Even though there’s just a 1 in 3.7 million chance of being killed by a shark, people are so fearful of the predators that they’ve developed myths about them—such as their ability to smell a tiny drop of blood from miles away.


While sharks do have a strong sense of smell, this statement is largely overblown. Some sharks can identify blood a quarter-mile away, but the scent doesn’t reach them instantaneously or necessarily cause them to attack.


[Image: blue shark nostrils]


Sharks have a heightened sense of smell and olfactory system that is hundreds of times stronger than a human’s. Their nostrils, located beneath their snouts, are used only for smelling and not for breathing. They do have the capacity to detect tiny amounts of various compounds in the water. Some types of sharks, such as the lemon shark, can even detect a scent in a large swimming pool or a substance that is several hundred meters away.


But a shark more than a quarter-mile away won’t smell your blood and decide to make you into a yummy snack. Smells reach a shark through the currents, and it would take time for the scent to travel that distance to a shark’s nostrils. The motion of the ocean carries smell molecules with it, so, the more motion, the faster the smell will travel.


If you do start to bleed while swimming in the ocean, there is some time to get safely to shore in case a rogue shark decides to attack.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Shark Senses - Shark Facts and Information (www.sharks-world.com)
Content: Sharks have nostrils that they only use to smell. When they swim, water flows through the nostrils, is introduced into the nasal duct and moves the last folds of the skin that has sensory cells. Some sharks, such as the lemon shark (Negaprion brevirostris), can detect a small amount of blood in the water.


The sense of smell is directional, this means that if the aroma comes from the left side of the shark, the shark first perceives it precisely in the left fossa rather than the right and can detect the location of the source of the smelling.


It is necessary to emphasize that they are very sensitive to odors and can differentiate a prey from another shark and even from a predator and respond in a decisive way to the smell produced by a wounded or fearful prey.
---

question_src: Ikiwa Waislamu watafanya mauaji kama tulivyoona huko Ufaransa, kwa nini vyombo vya habari ni haraka sana kuiita ugaidi? Ikiwa Mkristo alifanya hivyo wakati akipiga kelele "Sifa kwa Yesu", je! Hiyo pia ingeitwa ugaidi au tungemwita tu wazimu? Je! Uandishi huu wa habari ni upendeleo?
all_claims: Utafiti wa vyombo vya habari unaonyesha kuwa kumhusisha mhalifu na Uislamu mara nyingi kunatosha kuanzisha lebo ya “ugaidi,” ilhali wasio Waislamu hukumbwa na maelezo mengine kama “mwendawazimu” au “lone wolf” [3]; hii ni dalili ya upendeleo wa kimfumo katika uandishi wa habari [2].
Data inaonyesha kwamba tukio ambalo mtuhumiwa ni Mwislamu hupata takribani mara 4.5 zaidi ya chanjo ya habari kuliko tukio sawia linalofanywa na asiye Mwislamu [4].
Kitaalamu, hilo linamaanisha kuwa mhalifu asiye Mwislamu angehitaji kuua wastani wa watu saba zaidi ili kufikia kiwango sawa cha uangalizi wa vyombo vya habari kama Mwislamu [4].

Hivyo, kama Mkristo angefanya shambulio huku akipiga kelele “Sifa kwa Yesu,” kuna uwezekano mkubwa vyombo vya habari vingesisitiza masuala ya afya ya akili au itikadi nyingine, badala ya “ugaidi,” ikilinganishwa na hali ambako mshukiwa ni Mwislamu.

Matokeo haya yanaashiria upendeleo uliojengeka katika jinsi ugaidi unavyotambulishwa na kuchapishwa, na siyo tofauti ya kisheria bali ni tofauti ya kijamii na kimaudhui inayotokana na taswira za kidini zinazoenezwa na vyombo vya habari.

claim: Firewall ni kifaa au programu inayochuja trafiki ya mtandao na kuruhusu tu data inayopaswa kufika au kuondoka kulingana na sheria ulizoziweka
question_src: Je! Moto wa moto hufanyaje kazi?
all_claims: Firewall ni kifaa au programu inayochuja trafiki ya mtandao na kuruhusu tu data inayopaswa kufika au kuondoka kulingana na sheria ulizoziweka [1].
Ufanisi wake unategemea usanidi sahihi, na hakuna firewall iliyo kamilifu [1].

Pakiti za TCP ni rahisi kuchujwa kwa kuwa vichwa vyake hubeba anwani za chanzo, marudio na taarifa ya mlolongo, hivyo kurahisisha kulinganishwa na sheria za uchujaji [1], ilhali pakiti za UDP hukaguliwa zaidi kwa nambari za bandari kwa sababu hazina maelezo mengi kwenye vichwa vyake [2].

Kitaaluma, kuna aina tatu kuu: firewalls zisizo na hali (stateless) ambazo hukagua kila pakiti moja kwa moja bila kuzingatia mkondo wa data [3]; firewalls zenye hali (stateful) ambazo hukusanya safu ya pakiti, kutathmini hali ya muunganisho na kisha kutumia sheria, hivyo kuongeza usahihi na ufanisi [4]; na firewalls za kiwango cha programu (application firewalls) ambazo huenda mbali zaidi kwa kuchambua yaliyomo halisi ya data, si vichwa pekee [4].
claims_retained: Firewall ni kifaa au programu inayochuja trafiki ya mtandao na kuruhusu tu data inayopaswa kufika au kuondoka kulingana na sheria ulizoziweka [1].
Ufanisi wake unategemea usanidi sahihi, na hakuna firewall iliyo kamilifu [1].
prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: How do firewalls work? Firewall technology explained (cybersecurity.att.com)
Content: Firewalls filter network traffic so that you only receive data that you should be getting. No firewall works perfectly, and a lot of a firewall's effectiveness depends on how you configure it.


To get a basic grasp of how firewalls work, it's important to understand how TCP packets work.


The data that your computer sends and receives over the internet or an internal network is comprised of TCP packets and UDP packets. TCP packets can be more effectively filtered by firewalls because they contain more information in their headers.


[Image]


TCP packets contain information such as source and destination addresses, packet sequence information, and payload. That information allows your network interface to deliver data properly, and a firewall can compare that information to the rules you configured it with. For example, all HTTPS data is transmitted through TCP packets. When HTTPS data is sent to your computer through your network interface while you surf the web, your operating system will know that it's data that's supposed to go to your web browser. The same applies if you are surfing the web - on your phone, on your PC, or even on a server machine in your datacenter. With the proliferation of the Internet of Things, you might even be surfing the web from a touchscreen embedded in your refrigerator. Your HTTPS data is used the same way regardless.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: How do firewalls work? Firewall technology explained (cybersecurity.att.com)
Content: UDP packets can be filtered by port, but their headers lack the information that TCP packets have for more sophisticated filtering.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: How do firewalls work? Firewall technology explained (cybersecurity.att.com)
Content: Stateless or packet filtering firewalls inspect each packet individually, without considering the trends of the data you're receiving.
---
Document ID: 4
Title: How do firewalls work? Firewall technology explained (cybersecurity.att.com)
Content: Stateful firewalls do what stateless firewalls do, and they also consider the connection states of streams of data. This is the bouncer who may see one high school kid and then reject the whole group of high school kids, rather than asking each of them to prove their age. Stateful firewalls will collect a series of packets before it determines their connection state, and then compares those findings to the firewall rules, rather than applying the rules to each individual packet of data.
3. Application firewalls generally do everything that stateful firewalls do, and they also analyze the actual data content of the packets, not just the headers.
---

question_src: Je! Kwa nini watu wengi wanafurahiya kutatanisha na wengine kwa kiwango fulani?
all_claims: Watu wengi hupata “furaha” ya kutatanisha au kuwanyanyasa wengine kwa sababu tafiti zinaonyesha kwamba wengi wao wamepitia msongo au kiwewe kikubwa katika miaka mitano iliyopita, na uonevu huwa mbinu ya muda mfupi ya kupunguza maumivu hayo [1].

Asilimia 66 ya wanaokubali kutukana ni wanaume, jambo linaloendana na malezi yanayowakataza wavulana kuonyesha hisia na badala yake kuwatia moyo kupata umaarufu kupitia tabia za kuwachezea wengine [2].
Kwa wengine, uonevu hufunika kutoridhika kwao binafsi; kumlenga mtu mwingine huwapunguzia aibu yao ya ndani na kuwapa hisia ya nguvu ya haraka [3].
Pia, wale waliowahi kunyanyaswa huelekea kuendeleza mtindo huo ili kurejesha udhibiti wanaohisi wamepoteza [4].
Kukosa elimu kuhusu hotuba ya chuki huwafanya baadhi wasione madhara yake, hivyo “utani” wa kikatili huonekana kama burudani isiyo na tatizo [5].
Hatimaye, urafiki na uhusiano wa kifamilia wasio na usalama huwalazimisha wengine kubagua ili kukubalika, na kibali cha wenzao huwapa msukumo wa kimwili na kihisia kuendelea [6].

Title: Why do People Bully? The Scientific Reasons - Ditch the Label (us.ditchthelabel.org)
Content: Our data shows that those who bully are far more likely than average to have experienced a stressful or traumatic situation in the past 5 years. Examples include their parents/guardians splitting up, the death of a relative or the gaining of a little brother or sister.


It makes sense because we all respond to stress in very different ways. Some of us use positive behaviours, such as meditation, exercise and talking therapy – all designed to relieve the stress.


Others use negative behaviours such as bullying, violence and alcohol abuse, which temporarily mask the issues but usually make them worse in the long-term.


The research shows that some people simply do not know how to positively respond to stress and so default to bullying others as a coping mechanism.

question_src: Ikiwa watu wanaweza kujenga kompyuta zao, ni nini kinachowazuia watu kujenga smartphones zao wenyewe?
all_claims: Tofauti kuu ni kiwango cha ujumuishaji na upatikanaji wa vipuri; sehemu za PC zimekuwa za “plug-and-play” kwa miongo kadhaa, lakini simu huhitaji vipengele vidogo sana vilivyobuniwa kufanya kazi pamoja kwenye ubao mmoja ulioshonwa kiwanda, na sehemu hizi hazipatikani kirahisi kwa rejareja [2].
Kwa mfano, mtengenezaji binafsi atalazimika kupata chipu za kuhifadhi, prosesa, GPS, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, LTE, kamera mbili, kidhibiti cha USB, betri n.k.
kutoka kwa zaidi ya wauzaji 100 tofauti nchini China, jambo linaloongeza gharama na ugumu wa usafirishaji, ubora na *firmware* [2].
Hata ukifanikiwa kupata kila kitu, kifaa kitakuwa kikubwa na chenye nguvu ndogo kuliko simu za sokoni kwa sababu huwezi kufungasha vipuri hivyo kwa uthabiti ule ule wa kiwanda [1].
Hatimaye, redio za simu huhitaji uthibitisho wa kisheria (FCC, CE n.k.), zikitaka zana za majaribio ghali na maarifa ya RF ambayo wahobi wengi hawana.
Hivyo, ingawa kiufundi inawezekana—kwa kutumia, tuseme, Raspberry Pi na moduli ya GSM—matokeo huwa mradi mzito wa majaribio badala ya mbadala bora wa iPhone au Galaxy [1].

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Yes, you can build your own smartphone (www.zdnet.com)
Content: A number of people have asked me whether it possible to build a smartphone out of easily available parts. Absolutely. It won't be as sleek or as powerful as one you could pick up, and you will have to assemble it yourself, but it's one of those projects that's very doable.


Here's one example built around a Raspberry Pi board, and Adafruit Fona GSM board, a 5-megapixel camera, 802.11n Wi-Fi, and a 3.5-inch display. You'll have to shop around for some of these parts, but the last time I looked they were all still available.


Now, this might not be a device that you want to carry around with you as a daily smartphone, but it's something that you could integrate into a bigger project, such as an IoT hub or maybe a rugged handset for use in an off-road vehicle or boat.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: I want to build my own smartphone (forums.tomsguide.com)
Content: It's probably near impossible to build your own smartphone. It's not just that simple that you need the motherboard, and the processor. There are much more things you need to worry about as well. storage chip, accelerometer, compass, two cameras, radio chip (incorporating GPS, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, and cellular), USB controller chip, Micro-USB port, LCD panel, capacitive touchscreen, battery, slider, keyboard, case, etc.... Most of the suppliers are from china. And I don't think you live in China. Even if you live in China, you probably have to contact all the suppliers in china (possibly over 100) to get the individual parts of a smartphone.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Make Your Own Cellphone From Scratch. (www.instructables.com)
Content: n fact, you can make a cellphone in much the same way you'd make anything else: find the right parts, figure out how to connect them together, and try to do it in a way that's attractive and robust. Because of the ubiquity of cellphones, there are companies making the components they're made of; with some digging, I was able to find versions of these parts that are possible to buy in small quantities and that are possible to assemble by hand. This wasn't necessarily easy, but it's a very different problem than trying to learn the physics needed to understand how a cellphone tower works

Kwa mfano, mtengenezaji binafsi atalazimika kupata chipu za kuhifadhi, prosesa, GPS, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, LTE, kamera mbili, kidhibiti cha USB, betri n.k.
kutoka kwa zaidi ya wauzaji 100 tofauti nchini China, jambo linaloongeza gharama na ugumu wa usafirishaji, ubora na *firmware* [2].
Hata ukifanikiwa kupata kila kitu, kifaa kitakuwa kikubwa na chenye nguvu ndogo kuliko simu za sokoni kwa sababu huwezi kufungasha vipuri hivyo kwa uthabiti ule ule wa kiwanda [1].
Hatimaye, redio za simu huhitaji uthibitisho wa kisheria (FCC, CE n.k.), zikitaka zana za majaribio ghali na maarifa ya RF ambayo wahobi wengi hawana.
Hivyo, ingawa kiufundi inawezekana—kwa kutumia, tuseme, Raspberry Pi na moduli ya GSM—matokeo huwa mradi mzito wa majaribio badala ya mbadala bora wa iPhone au Galaxy [1].
claims_retained: Tofauti kuu ni kiwango cha ujumuishaji na upatikanaji wa vipuri; sehemu za PC zimekuwa za “plug-and-play” kwa miongo kadhaa, lakini simu huhitaji vipengele vidogo sana vilivyobuniwa kufanya kazi pamoja kwenye ubao mmoja ulioshonwa kiwanda, na sehemu hizi hazipatikani kirahisi kwa rejareja [2].
kutoka kwa zaidi ya wauzaji 100 tofauti nchini China, jambo linaloongeza gharama na ugumu wa usafirishaji, ubora na *firmware* [2].
Hivyo, ingawa kiufundi inawezekana—kwa kutumia, tuseme, Raspberry Pi na moduli ya GSM—matokeo huwa mradi mzito wa majaribio badala ya mbadala bora wa iPhone au Galaxy [1].
prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Yes, you can build your own smartphone (www.zdnet.com)
Content: A number of people have asked me whether it possible to build a smartphone out of easily available parts. Absolutely. It won't be as sleek or as powerful as one you could pick up, and you will have to assemble it yourself, but it's one of those projects that's very doable.


Here's one example built around a Raspberry Pi board, and Adafruit Fona GSM board, a 5-megapixel camera, 802.11n Wi-Fi, and a 3.5-inch display. You'll have to shop around for some of these parts, but the last time I looked they were all still available.


Now, this might not be a device that you want to carry around with you as a daily smartphone, but it's something that you could integrate into a bigger project, such as an IoT hub or maybe a rugged handset for use in an off-road vehicle or boat.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: I want to build my own smartphone (forums.tomsguide.com)
Content: It's probably near impossible to build your own smartphone. It's not just that simple that you need the motherboard, and the processor. There are much more things you need to worry about as well. storage chip, accelerometer, compass, two cameras, radio chip (incorporating GPS, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, and cellular), USB controller chip, Micro-USB port, LCD panel, capacitive touchscreen, battery, slider, keyboard, case, etc.... Most of the suppliers are from china. And I don't think you live in China. Even if you live in China, you probably have to contact all the suppliers in china (possibly over 100) to get the individual parts of a smartphone.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Make Your Own Cellphone From Scratch. (www.instructables.com)
Content: n fact, you can make a cellphone in much the same way you'd make anything else: find the right parts, figure out how to connect them together, and try to do it in a way that's attractive and robust. Because of the ubiquity of cellphones, there are companies making the components they're made of; with some digging, I was able to find versions of these parts that are possible to buy in small quantities and that are possible to assemble by hand. This wasn't necessarily easy, but it's a very different problem than trying to learn the physics needed to understand how a cellphone tower works
---

claim: Wakurdi ni watu wa kabila la Irani wanaoishi asili katika eneo lenye milima la Asia Magharibi linaloitwa Kurdistan, linalojumuisha kusini-mashariki mwa Uturuki, kaskazini-magharibi mwa Iran, kaskazini mwa Iraq na kaskazini mwa Syria
question_src: Watu wa Kikurdi ni nani?
all_claims: Wakurdi ni watu wa kabila la Irani wanaoishi asili katika eneo lenye milima la Asia Magharibi linaloitwa Kurdistan, linalojumuisha kusini-mashariki mwa Uturuki, kaskazini-magharibi mwa Iran, kaskazini mwa Iraq na kaskazini mwa Syria [1].
Idadi yao inakadiriwa kuwa kati ya milioni 30 hadi 45, hivyo kuwafanya kuwa miongoni mwa makundi makubwa zaidi bila taifa huru duniani [1].
Mbali na ardhi yao ya jadi, wako pia katikati mwa Anatolia, Khorasan, Caucasus, pamoja na diaspora kubwa katika miji ya Uturuki Magharibi (hasa Istanbul) na Ulaya Magharibi (hasa Ujerumani) [1].
Neno “Kurd” lilipata taswira ya ethnonym baada ya ushindi wa Waislamu dhidi ya Waajemi na polepole likaunganisha makabila mbalimbali ya Kiajemi na Irani chini ya utambulisho mmoja [2].
Wakurdi wengi hujiona kuwa ni wazao wa Wamedi wa kale na hutumia kalenda inayoanzia 612 KK, mwaka ambao Ninawi iliangushwa na Wamedi [3].
Ingawa wengi ni Waislamu wa Sunni, ndani ya jamii hiyo zipo dini nyingine pia, hivyo dini si kipengele chao cha msingi cha utambulisho [4].
Kinachowaunganisha zaidi ni kitambulisho cha kikabila na lugha ya Kikurdi ambavyo vilijidhihirisha tangu Zama za Kati [4].
claims_retained: Wakurdi ni watu wa kabila la Irani wanaoishi asili katika eneo lenye milima la Asia Magharibi linaloitwa Kurdistan, linalojumuisha kusini-mashariki mwa Uturuki, kaskazini-magharibi mwa Iran, kaskazini mwa Iraq na kaskazini mwa Syria [1].

Ingawa wengi ni Waislamu wa Sunni, ndani ya jamii hiyo zipo dini nyingine pia, hivyo dini si kipengele chao cha msingi cha utambulisho [4].
Kinachowaunganisha zaidi ni kitambulisho cha kikabila na lugha ya Kikurdi ambavyo vilijidhihirisha tangu Zama za Kati [4].
prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Kurds (en.wikipedia.org)
Content: Kurds (Kurdish: کورد ,Kurd‎) or Kurdish people are an Iranian[28][29][30] ethnic group native to a mountainous region of Western Asia known as Kurdistan, which spans southeastern Turkey, northwestern Iran, northern Iraq, and northern Syria.[31] There are exclaves of Kurds in Central Anatolia, Khorasan, and the Caucasus, as well as significant Kurdish diaspora communities in the cities of western Turkey (in particular Istanbul) and Western Europe (primarily in Germany). The Kurdish population is estimated to be between 30 and 45 million.[2][32]
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Kurds (en.wikipedia.org)
Content: The term gained the characteristic of an ethnonym following the Muslim conquest of Persia, as it was adopted into Arabic and gradually became associated with an amalgamation of Iranian and Iranicised tribes and groups in the region.[41][42]
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Kurds (en.wikipedia.org)
Content: Many Kurds consider themselves descended from the Medes, an ancient Iranian people,[83] and even use a calendar dating from 612 BC, when the Assyrian capital of Nineveh was conquered by the Medes.[84] The claimed Median descent is reflected in the words of the Kurdish national anthem: "We are the children of the Medes and Kai Khosrow."
---
Document ID: 4
Title: Today, the Kurds are spread across four nations. Who are they? (www.nationalgeographic.com)
Content: If you can’t point to Kurdistan on a map, you’re not alone: It’s not a sovereign country. But for Kurds, an ethnic group of roughly 30 million people, it is very real indeed. Nestled on the margins of Turkey, Iran, Iraq, and Syria, Kurdistan is one of the planet’s most volatile regions, and its people are the world’s largest stateless group.


The Kurds are indigenous to the Middle East, but scholars and Kurdish people alike disagree as to the group’s origin. Nor do all Kurds share a religious identity: Though the majority of Kurds are Sunni Muslims, other religions are practiced as well.


What is clear is a Kurdish ethnic identity and common language. Those commonalities emerged around the Middle Ages. Since then, Kurds have played roles in the histories of what are now Iran, Iraq, Syria, and Turkey.


But while they flourished and wielded influence in the region, Kurds lost their lands when the Ottoman Empire took over most Kurdish-held territory in the 1500s.
---

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Kurds (en.wikipedia.org)
Content: Kurds (Kurdish: کورد ,Kurd‎) or Kurdish people are an Iranian[28][29][30] ethnic group native to a mountainous region of Western Asia known as Kurdistan, which spans southeastern Turkey, northwestern Iran, northern Iraq, and northern Syria.[31] There are exclaves of Kurds in Central Anatolia, Khorasan, and the Caucasus, as well as significant Kurdish diaspora communities in the cities of western Turkey (in particular Istanbul) and Western Europe (primarily in Germany). The Kurdish population is estimated to be between 30 and 45 million.[2][32]
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Kurds (en.wikipedia.org)
Content: The term gained the characteristic of an ethnonym following the Muslim conquest of Persia, as it was adopted into Arabic and gradually became associated with an amalgamation of Iranian and Iranicised tribes and groups in the region.[41][42]
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Kurds (en.wikipedia.org)
Content: Many Kurds consider themselves descended from the Medes, an ancient Iranian people,[83] and even use a calendar dating from 612 BC, when the Assyrian capital of Nineveh was conquered by the Medes.[84] The claimed Median descent is reflected in the words of the Kurdish national anthem: "We are the children of the Medes and Kai Khosrow."
---
Document ID: 4
Title: Today, the Kurds are spread across four nations. Who are they? (www.nationalgeographic.com)
Content: If you can’t point to Kurdistan on a map, you’re not alone: It’s not a sovereign country. But for Kurds, an ethnic group of roughly 30 million people, it is very real indeed. Nestled on the margins of Turkey, Iran, Iraq, and Syria, Kurdistan is one of the planet’s most volatile regions, and its people are the world’s largest stateless group.


The Kurds are indigenous to the Middle East, but scholars and Kurdish people alike disagree as to the group’s origin. Nor do all Kurds share a religious identity: Though the majority of Kurds are Sunni Muslims, other religions are practiced as well.


What is clear is a Kurdish ethnic identity and common language. Those commonalities emerged around the Middle Ages. Since then, Kurds have played roles in the histories of what are now Iran, Iraq, Syria, and Turkey.


But while they flourished and wielded influence in the region, Kurds lost their lands when the Ottoman Empire took over most Kurdish-held territory in the 1500s.
---

claim: Kiamotamfoloji “agnostic” kiasili hurejelea msimamo wa falsafa unaodai kwamba hatuna (au hatuwezi kupata) maarifa ya kutosha kuthibitisha au kukanusha uwepo wa Mungu, hivyo “chaguo la busara ni kuhifadhi hukumu” ; hata hivyo, katika mazingira ya Amerika Kaskazini neno hilo limeteleza kimsingi nalo hutumika na watu wanaojiona hawana imani thabiti kama njia isiyo kali ya kusema “siamini Mungu.” Sababu kuu ni kijamii kuliko kisemantiki: (1) Katika utamaduni wenye mgawanyiko bayana kati ya “waumini” na “wasiomwamini,” lebo rahisi za duali zinapendelewa, hivyo “agnostic” huangukia upande uleule na “asiyeamini,” tofauti na maelezo ya kimsingi ya falsafa.
question_src: Kamusi inaniambia njia ya agnostic "Nadhani haiwezi kuthibitika" lakini kawaida katika Amerika ya Kaskazini watu wanaonekana kuitumia kumaanisha "kinda usiamini Mungu". Kwa nini hiyo?
all_claims: Kiamotamfoloji “agnostic” kiasili hurejelea msimamo wa falsafa unaodai kwamba hatuna (au hatuwezi kupata) maarifa ya kutosha kuthibitisha au kukanusha uwepo wa Mungu, hivyo “chaguo la busara ni kuhifadhi hukumu” [2]; hata hivyo, katika mazingira ya Amerika Kaskazini neno hilo limeteleza kimsingi nalo hutumika na watu wanaojiona hawana imani thabiti kama njia isiyo kali ya kusema “siamini Mungu.” Sababu kuu ni kijamii kuliko kisemantiki: (1) Katika utamaduni wenye mgawanyiko bayana kati ya “waumini” na “wasiomwamini,” lebo rahisi za duali zinapendelewa, hivyo “agnostic” huangukia upande uleule na “asiyeamini,” tofauti na maelezo ya kimsingi ya falsafa.

(2) Neno “atheist” limebeba mzigo wa kijamii na unahusianishwa na kukana dini waziwazi, hivyo watu wengi wanaoepuka mzozo huchagua “agnostic” kama toleo la upole, wakimaanisha tu hawatendi imani, si kwamba wamefikia hitimisho la kutokuwepo kwa Mungu.

(3) Mwanzilishi wa istilahi, Thomas Huxley, alisisitiza kuwa agnosticism “ni kanuni siyo imani,” akiona si haki kudai ukweli bila ushahidi [1]; mantiki hii ya kutojua imebaki, lakini katika matumizi ya kila siku imetafsiriwa kama “kutokuwa na imani,” na ufafanuzi wa falsafa umepungua, hivyo neno linaonekana kama toleo “lililolegea” la atheism badala ya msimamo wa kutojua.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: What Is The Difference Between Agnosticism And Atheism? (www.worldatlas.com)
Content: Agnostic people believe that the existence of God or a supernatural being is unknown and beyond human reason. The phrase “agnosticism” was first used by Thomas Henry Huxley against religious people who accused him of denouncing the role of God in the creation of the universe. Huxley supported the theories of evolution by Charles Darwin and did not subscribe to religious beliefs. He believed that nature was too diverse to have been created and that natural selection provided a better explanation provable by evidence. Huxley thought that agnosticism was a principle and not a belief. He reiterated that it is wrong for one to claim a phenomenon is a definite truth unless logical evidence is provided. The word was coined as the antagonist of the phrase “Gnosticism,” meaning “knowledge.” Gnosticism was a religious ideology in the first and second centuries that suggested that the material world was ungodly while the spirit world was the better choice. Although agnosticism was not intended to raise the question of whether God exists or not, it found its way to the religious world. Huxley justified his stand by claiming that he did not deny or affirm the mortality or human and therefore, did not see the reason to believe or disprove the existence of God. He challenged the religious and atheists to prove or disprove the presence of God.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: What Does "Agnostic" Mean? (www.psychologytoday.com)
Content: “Maybe there is a God, but maybe not. I’m just not sure. I mean, who can really say?”


If you’ve ever uttered such words or heard someone else utter them, you’re dealing with agnosticism.


“Agnostic” is a label people often use to indicate that they embrace an orientation somewhere between the serene surety of knowing that there is a God and the conviction that there isn’t.


That is, while a theist is someone who believes in God, and an atheist is someone who does not believe in God, an agnostic is someone who isn’t convinced that God exists, but at the same time, can’t be totally sure that God doesn’t exist. And given a lack of knowledge concerning the question of God’s existence – or the lack of any possibility of such knowledge -- an agnostic simply sighs and shrugs, offering an unapologetic “Who knows?” to the whole matter.


In the words of philosopher Julian Baggini, an agnostic “claims we cannot know whether God exists and so the only rational option is to reserve judgment.”
---

all_claims: Kuwa na jiwe kwenye gland yako ya mshono (sialolithiasis) ni hali ambapo amana ngumu za madini—hasa kalsiamu—huunda ndani ya tezi au mfereji wa mate na hivyo kuziba mtiririko wa mate kinywani [4].
Kawaida huathiri watu wenye umri wa miaka 30–60 na hutokea mara nyingi zaidi kwa wanaume kuliko wanawake [1].
Mawe mengi hujitokeza kwenye tezi ndogo zilizo sakafuni mwa mdomo na mtu anaweza kuwa na mawe zaidi ya moja kwa wakati mmoja [3].
Hali hii mara chache ni hatari, lakini inaweza kusababisha maumivu na uvimbe, hasa wakati wa kula [5].

Sababu kamili haijulikani, ingawa hatari huongezeka kwa upungufu wa maji mwilini, kiwewe mdomoni, uvutaji sigara, ugonjwa wa fizi na baadhi ya dawa zinazopunguza au kufanya mate kuwa mazito, kama diuretiki na antihistamini [2].

Matibabu ya nyumbani yanajumuisha kunyonya matunda ya machungwa au pipi ngumu ili kuongeza mtiririko wa mate, kunywa maji mengi, kufanya masaji nyepesi, kutumia dawa za maumivu kama ibuprofen, na kunyonya vipande vya barafu; mawe makubwa yanaposhindikana kutoka, daktari huweza kuhitajika [5].
claims_retained: Kuwa na jiwe kwenye gland yako ya mshono (sialolithiasis) ni hali ambapo amana ngumu za madini—hasa kalsiamu—huunda ndani ya tezi au mfereji wa mate na hivyo kuziba mtiririko wa mate kinywani [4].

Matibabu ya nyumbani yanajumuisha kunyonya matunda ya machungwa au pipi ngumu ili kuongeza mtiririko wa mate, kunywa maji mengi, kufanya masaji nyepesi, kutumia dawa za maumivu kama ibuprofen, na kunyonya vipande vya barafu; mawe makubwa yanaposhindikana kutoka, daktari huweza kuhitajika [5].
prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Salivary Stones (www.hopkinsmedicine.org)
Content: Salivary stones, also called sialolithiasis, are hardened mineral deposits that form in the salivary glands. The condition is more likely to affect people age 30 to 60 and men are more likely to get salivary stones than women.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Salivary Stones (www.hopkinsmedicine.org)
Content: The cause is not known, but several factors are associated with salivary stone formation:


* Dehydration, due to inadequate fluid intake, illness, or medications such as diuretics (water pills) and anticholinergic drugs


* Trauma to the inside of the mouth


* Smoking


* Gum disease
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Salivary Gland Stones: Symptoms, Causes, and Treatment (www.webmd.com)
Content: A salivary gland stone -- also called salivary duct stone -- is a calcified structure that may form inside a salivary gland or duct. It can block the flow of saliva into the mouth.


The majority of stones affect the submandibular glands located at the floor of the mouth. Less commonly, the stones affect the parotid glands, located on the inside of the cheeks, or the sublingual glands, which are under the tongue. Many people with the condition have multiple stones.
---
Document ID: 4
Title: Salivary Gland Stones: Symptoms, Causes, and Treatment (www.webmd.com)
Content: Salivary stones form when chemicals in the saliva accumulate in the duct or gland. They mostly contain calcium. The exact cause is not known. But factors contributing to less saliva production and/or thickened saliva may be risk factors for salivary stones. These factors include: dehydration, poor eating, and use of certain medications including some antihistamines, blood pressure drugs, psychiatric drugs, and bladder control drugs. Trauma to the salivary glands may also raise the risk for salivary stones.
---
Document ID: 5
Title: Salivary stones: Symptoms, causes, and how to get rid of them (www.medicalnewstoday.com)
Content: Salivary stones are rarely serious, and a person can often treat them at home.


Home remedies for getting rid of salivary stones include:


* Sucking on citrus fruits or hard candies. Sucking on a wedge of lemon or orange increases the flow of saliva, which can help dislodge the stone. A person can also try sucking on sugar-free gum or hard, sour candies, such as lemon drops.
* Drinking plenty of fluids. Regular fluid intake helps keep the mouth hydrated and can increase saliva flow.
* Gentle massage. Gently massaging the affected area may relieve pain and encourage the stone to pass through the salivary duct. The Sjogren’s Syndrome Foundation have an illustrated guide on how to do this on their website.
* Medications. Some over-the-counter drugs, such as ibuprofen and acetaminophen, can help relieve pain and swelling.
* Sucking on ice cubes. Sucking on something cold, such as an ice cube or ice pop, may also help reduce pain and swelling resulting from salivary stones.
---

Sababu kamili haijulikani, ingawa hatari huongezeka kwa upungufu wa maji mwilini, kiwewe mdomoni, uvutaji sigara, ugonjwa wa fizi na baadhi ya dawa zinazopunguza au kufanya mate kuwa mazito, kama diuretiki na antihistamini [2].

Matibabu ya nyumbani yanajumuisha kunyonya matunda ya machungwa au pipi ngumu ili kuongeza mtiririko wa mate, kunywa maji mengi, kufanya masaji nyepesi, kutumia dawa za maumivu kama ibuprofen, na kunyonya vipande vya barafu; mawe makubwa yanaposhindikana kutoka, daktari huweza kuhitajika [5].
prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Salivary Stones (www.hopkinsmedicine.org)
Content: Salivary stones, also called sialolithiasis, are hardened mineral deposits that form in the salivary glands. The condition is more likely to affect people age 30 to 60 and men are more likely to get salivary stones than women.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Salivary Stones (www.hopkinsmedicine.org)
Content: The cause is not known, but several factors are associated with salivary stone formation:


* Dehydration, due to inadequate fluid intake, illness, or medications such as diuretics (water pills) and anticholinergic drugs


* Trauma to the inside of the mouth


* Smoking


* Gum disease
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Salivary Gland Stones: Symptoms, Causes, and Treatment (www.webmd.com)
Content: A salivary gland stone -- also called salivary duct stone -- is a calcified structure that may form inside a salivary gland or duct. It can block the flow of saliva into the mouth.


The majority of stones affect the submandibular glands located at the floor of the mouth. Less commonly, the stones affect the parotid glands, located on the inside of the cheeks, or the sublingual glands, which are under the tongue. Many people with the condition have multiple stones.
---
Document ID: 4
Title: Salivary Gland Stones: Symptoms, Causes, and Treatment (www.webmd.com)
Content: Salivary stones form when chemicals in the saliva accumulate in the duct or gland. They mostly contain calcium. The exact cause is not known. But factors contributing to less saliva production and/or thickened saliva may be risk factors for salivary stones. These factors include: dehydration, poor eating, and use of certain medications including some antihistamines, blood pressure drugs, psychiatric drugs, and bladder control drugs. Trauma to the salivary glands may also raise the risk for salivary stones.
---
Document ID: 5
Title: Salivary stones: Symptoms, causes, and how to get rid of them (www.medicalnewstoday.com)
Content: Salivary stones are rarely serious, and a person can often treat them at home.


Home remedies for getting rid of salivary stones include:


* Sucking on citrus fruits or hard candies. Sucking on a wedge of lemon or orange increases the flow of saliva, which can help dislodge the stone. A person can also try sucking on sugar-free gum or hard, sour candies, such as lemon drops.
* Drinking plenty of fluids. Regular fluid intake helps keep the mouth hydrated and can increase saliva flow.
* Gentle massage. Gently massaging the affected area may relieve pain and encourage the stone to pass through the salivary duct. The Sjogren’s Syndrome Foundation have an illustrated guide on how to do this on their website.
* Medications. Some over-the-counter drugs, such as ibuprofen and acetaminophen, can help relieve pain and swelling.
* Sucking on ice cubes. Sucking on something cold, such as an ice cube or ice pop, may also help reduce pain and swelling resulting from salivary stones.
---

question_src: Je! Watu ambao husikia kwa mara ya kwanza, baada ya kitu kama kupata viingilio vya kusikia, wanajua watu wengine wanasema nini?
all_claims: Mara kipandikizi cha cochlear kinapowashwa, ubongo hupokea ishara za kielektroniki ambazo “hazitakuwa kama kusikia kawaida,” hivyo mtu hawezi mara moja kutambua au kuelewa maneno ya wengine [2].
Kuelewa hotuba kunahitaji muda na mafunzo maalum; wagonjwa hupitia tiba ya hotuba na ukarabati ili kujifunza kutafsiri sauti hizo ipasavyo [3].

Kipindi hiki cha mafunzo kinaweza kudumu kati ya mwaka mmoja hadi hadi miaka 12, kutegemea umri ambao mtu alipata implanti na masuala mengine ya kibinafsi—mwandishi mmoja alianza katika mwaka wa 11 [1].
Ndani ya mwaka wa kwanza wa matumizi, watu wengi wenye vipandikizi vya cochlear hupata “faida kubwa katika kuelewa hotuba,” lakini mafanikio hutofautiana [2].

Hata hivyo, baadhi ya watumiaji hawatawahi kusikia au kuongea kama watu waliozaliwa wanasikia kwa sababu za kipekee za kibaiolojia na mazingira; hivyo, uelewa kamili wa kile watu wengine wanasema si hakikisho kwa kila mtu [1].
Kwa kifupi, kusikia si swichi ya kuwasha, bali ni mchakato wa kujifunza unaohitaji muda na juhudi kabla ya kuelewa hotuba kikamilifu.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: What’s It Like for a Deaf Person to Hear for the First Time? (slate.com)
Content: Most children will require at least some speech therapy, depending what age they received their implants. Training time ranges from a year to 12 (I clocked in at 11) and varies in terms of intensity. As they learn how to listen, their brains are doing heavy lifting by burning new neural pathways. Some of them will never listen or speak like someone born hearing due to various factors out of people’s control.


Hearing—or, rather, the perception of it—isn’t a light switch you flip on and off. It’s serious business.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Cochlear implants - Mayo Clinic (www.mayoclinic.org)
Content: Cochlear implants use a sound processor that fits behind the ear. The processor captures sound signals and sends them to a receiver implanted under the skin behind the ear. The receiver sends the signals to electrodes implanted in the snail-shaped inner ear (cochlea).


The signals stimulate the auditory nerve, which then directs them to the brain. The brain interprets those signals as sounds, though these sounds won't be just like normal hearing.


It takes time and training to learn to interpret the signals received from a cochlear implant. Within a year of use, most people with cochlear implants make considerable gains in understanding speech.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Cochlear Implant: Cost, Pros, Cons, Risks, How It Works (www.healthline.com)
Content: Though the brain will notice the sounds, they’re not the same as normal hearing. Speech therapy and rehabilitation are necessary to learn how to properly interpret these sounds.
---

Hata hivyo, baadhi ya watumiaji hawatawahi kusikia au kuongea kama watu waliozaliwa wanasikia kwa sababu za kipekee za kibaiolojia na mazingira; hivyo, uelewa kamili wa kile watu wengine wanasema si hakikisho kwa kila mtu [1].
Kwa kifupi, kusikia si swichi ya kuwasha, bali ni mchakato wa kujifunza unaohitaji muda na juhudi kabla ya kuelewa hotuba kikamilifu.

Title: What’s It Like for a Deaf Person to Hear for the First Time? (slate.com)
Content: Most children will require at least some speech therapy, depending what age they received their implants. Training time ranges from a year to 12 (I clocked in at 11) and varies in terms of intensity. As they learn how to listen, their brains are doing heavy lifting by burning new neural pathways. Some of them will never listen or speak like someone born hearing due to various factors out of people’s control.


Hearing—or, rather, the perception of it—isn’t a light switch you flip on and off. It’s serious business.

Document ID: 2
Title: Cochlear implants - Mayo Clinic (www.mayoclinic.org)
Content: Cochlear implants use a sound processor that fits behind the ear. The processor captures sound signals and sends them to a receiver implanted under the skin behind the ear. The receiver sends the signals to electrodes implanted in the snail-shaped inner ear (cochlea).


The signals stimulate the auditory nerve, which then directs them to the brain. The brain interprets those signals as sounds, though these sounds won't be just like normal hearing.


It takes time and training to learn to interpret the signals received from a cochlear implant. Within a year of use, most people with cochlear implants make considerable gains in understanding speech.
---

Title: Cochlear Implant: Cost, Pros, Cons, Risks, How It Works (www.healthline.com)
Content: Though the brain will notice the sounds, they’re not the same as normal hearing. Speech therapy and rehabilitation are necessary to learn how to properly interpret these sounds.

question_src: Je! Kwa nini hatuwezi tu kutupa takataka zetu zote kwenye lava iliyoyeyuka ili kuiondoa badala ya kuiweka na kuchafua maji ya ardhini wakati wa taka?
all_claims: Kutupa takataka kwenye lava si wazo zuri kwa sababu, kwanza, si kila kitu kingezama na kuyeyuka; aina nyingi za plastiki, mpira na vitambaa huweza kuelea juu ya lava yenye mnato, hivyo kubaki zikichoma na kutoa mafusho hatari [1].

Pili, maziwa ya lava ni mabamba na yanapopokea kitu baridi husababisha mabadiliko ya ghafla ya joto yanayoweza kuanzisha mlipuko wa mnyororo; bati moja pekee inaweza kuchochea mvuke wa asidi na kurusha lava zaidi ya mita 85 hewani, hali ambayo ingehatarisha wafanyakazi na mazingira jirani [2].

Tatu, idadi ya volkeno zinazowaka ni ndogo—takribani 1 500 duniani—na nyingi ziko mbali na miji, hivyo tungehitaji msururu usioisha wa malori kusafirisha taka, jambo ambalo lingeongeza gharama na uzalishaji wa kaboni, huku nchi zisizo na volkano zikibaki na tatizo lilelile [3].

Zaidi ya hayo, stratovolcano nyingi ni za kulipuka, na hata volkano za ngao—zilizo tulivu kiasi—ni chache sana (takriban 600 na nyingi hazifanyi kazi), kwa hiyo hatuna “shimo la moto” la kutosha kushughulikia takataka za dunia nzima [3].
Hivyo, hatari ya milipuko, uchafuzi wa hewa na changamoto za kijiografia na kiuchumi hufanya wazo hili liwe lisilowezekana na hatari.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Why we can't dump all our trash into volcanoes? (www.scienceabc.com)
Content: Lava lakes are undeniably complex and unpredictable wonders of nature. Being extremely hot, they can melt plenty of things, but not everything. There are thousands of forms of plastic, rubber, fabrics and other such materials that would float atop the viscous lava, rather than sinking into the heated void.


[Image: Lava_Lake_Nyiragongo]


An active Lava Lake (Photo Credit: Cai Tjeenk Willink /Wikimedia Commons)


Secondly, lava lakes are not infinitely deep. All that melted trash would have to end up somewhere, and while most of it might vanish in plumes of smoke and vapour – the smoke emanating from that destruction would be incredibly harmful to breathe or send up into the atmosphere.


As terrifying and wrathful as lava lakes are, in reality, they do have a finite volume, and are often on the move up and out of the vent, due to the incredible pressures building up inside.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Why we can't dump all our trash into volcanoes? (www.scienceabc.com)
Content: Lava lakes are unstable beneath their semi-solid, comparatively cool upper layer. If you pierce their surfaces with a relatively cold object, like a piece of trash, the sudden transfer of heat could trigger a chain reaction of explosions. The upper layer starts melting down, releasing pressurized acidic steam and fumes from the vaporized trash. Content: According to the Centers for Disease Control (CDC), the spread of Ebola in the affected African countries is due to a lack of medical professionals, treatment facilities, and supplies. In addition, not enough people in these countries understand how the disease is spread and how to keep it from spreading to others.

The CDC is trying to make sure that people who appear sick do not get on a plane to come to the US. They are also screening people arriving from countries known to have Ebola. Finally, even if someone does develop Ebola after returning to the US, our public health system has a strong ability to track people and their contacts. Our health care system has plenty of supplies, medicines, doctors, and nurses with the know-how to treat and stop it from spreading.

Title: Ebola: Should we be worried? (tarrant-tx.tamu.edu)
Content: According to the Centers for Disease Control (CDC), the spread of Ebola in the affected African countries is due to a lack of medical professionals, treatment facilities, and supplies. In addition, not enough people in these countries understand how the disease is spread and how to keep it from spreading to others.

The CDC is trying to make sure that people who appear sick do not get on a plane to come to the US. They are also screening people arriving from countries known to have Ebola. Finally, even if someone does develop Ebola after returning to the US, our public health system has a strong ability to track people and their contacts. Our health care system has plenty of supplies, medicines, doctors, and nurses with the know-how to treat and stop it from spreading.

Windows) hukumbana na hitilafu isiyoweza kushughulikiwa na huacha kazi ghafla ili kuzuia uharibifu zaidi wa data au vifaa [1]; mara nyingi ni “bug” katika programu au dereva inayochafua kumbukumbu na kernel hushindwa kurekebisha hali hiyo [1].
Katika Windows, faili muhimu za Msajili zikiharibika, mfumo hupoteza maelekezo ya msingi ya uendeshaji na unaweza kujizima au kuanzisha upya bila onyo [2].

Programu hasidi kama virusi au adware inaweza kufunga au kubadilisha huduma muhimu, na hivyo kuibua skrini ya bluu ya kifo (BSOD) [5].
Ukiishiwa kabisa RAM, OS haiwezi kuweka data mpya, na huchagua kusitisha mfumo ili kuepusha rushwa ya kumbukumbu [6].
Hatimaye, joto kupita kiasi linapozima feni ya CPU au kuzidi uwezo wa kupooza, viunga vya ulinzi vya vifaa huzima nguvu mara moja kuzuia kuungua kwa chipu [7].

all_claims: Ndiyo; ushahidi unaonyesha kuwa matamko ya Papa—kama sauti kuu ya Vatican—huweza kuelekeza mjadala wa kisiasa na hata kusitisha au kuharakisha sera katika nchi zenye Wakatoliki wengi.

Nchini Italia, mara tu Vatican inapotoa maoni kinyume na pendekezo la serikali, “wanasiasa wenye urafiki wa Italia wataruka kwa utetezi wake… na kuzuia sheria ambazo zinaonekana kwenda kinyume na mafundisho ya Kanisa” [1]; hii inaashiria kuwa hotuba za Papa zinaweza kubadili msimamo wa wabunge.
Hoja kama hiyo inaonekana pia katika mvutano kuhusu ushuru wa majengo ya kanisa, ambako ukimya au kauli fiche za Vatican zimeathiri uamuzi wa wanasiasa kuhusu kulipisha au kutolipisha kodi hiyo [2].

Katika Amerika ya Kusini, maadili ya Kikatoliki yanayoendelezwa na Papa yanaendelea kushikilia marufuku ya utoaji mimba nchini Argentina na kuingizwa kwa manufaa ya Kikatoliki kwenye Katiba, dalili kuwa kauli za Papa husaidia kuendeleza sera kulingana na mafundisho ya Kanisa [3].

Aidha, uwepo wa Papa kutoka Argentina na matumizi yake ya “ishara na lugha” za eneo hilo hufufua utambulisho wa Kikatoliki katika nchi hata zilizotengwa kidunia, na hivyo kuongeza uzito wa misimamo yake katika maamuzi ya kisera [4].
Hivyo, hotuba za Papa ni chombo chenye nguvu kinachoweza kuelekeza sera na maamuzi katika nchi za Kikatoliki.

Aidha, uwepo wa Papa kutoka Argentina na matumizi yake ya “ishara na lugha” za eneo hilo hufufua utambulisho wa Kikatoliki katika nchi hata zilizotengwa kidunia, na hivyo kuongeza uzito wa misimamo yake katika maamuzi ya kisera [4].

Title: How The Vatican Influences Italy - Italy Chronicles (italychronicles.com)
Content: The politics of Italy seem to be intertwined with the teachings of the Roman Catholic church and the policies of the Vatican, even if the Roman Catholic church tends to keep rather silent on issues such as corruption and organized crime. If the Vatican considers an aspect of the Italian government’s policies disagreeable, it will voice an opinion and friendly Italian politicians will leap to its defense and lend their unquestioning support up to and including blocking legislation which is seen to go against the Church’s teachings.

Title: GlobalPlus: Religion and politics in Latin America - The ARDA | Global Plus (globalplus.thearda.com)

question_src: Je! Kichujio cha hewa cha gari kinawezaje kuathiri mileage yake ya gesi?
all_claims: Kichujio cha hewa chafu huzuia mtiririko wa hewa kwenye injini, na kuifanya ijitume zaidi na kutumia mafuta mengi zaidi [1].
Kuchukua nafasi ya kichujio kilichoziba kwenye magari ya zamani yaliyo na carburetor kumeonekana kuongeza ufanisi wa mafuta kwa takriban 14% [2].
Utafiti mwingine umebainisha ongezeko la hadi 10% ya mileage ya gesi na akiba ya takriban senti 15 kwa kila galoni baada ya kuweka kichujio kipya [2].

Kwa ujumla, kichujio kipya huruhusu injini kupumua kwa urahisi, kuboresha utendaji na kutunza uchumi wa mafuta, huku kichujio chafu kikisababisha kushuka kwa nguvu, kuongezeka kwa utoaji wa moshi na matumizi makubwa ya petroli [3].

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Can Replacing Your Air Filter Improve Gas Mileage? - (www.pgfilters.com)
Content: Dirty air filters reduce airflow – Air filters trap contaminants in a media made of paper and synthetic fibers. Over time, this media becomes filled with dirt and debris, preventing the engine from breathing properly. As a result, the engine will work harder and use more fuel.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: 5 Benefits of Changing Your Air Filter (www.carsdirect.com)
Content: One of the biggest reasons to change your air filter regularly. Some studies indicate that replacing a dirty air filter increases fuel mileage on older, carburated cars by as much as 14 percent if the filter is so dirty it affects driveability. In addition, changing a clogged air filter can potentially increase acceleration by 6 to 11 percent on modern fuel-injected cars. Other studies claim a 10 percent increase in gas mileage and up to 15¢ per gallon fuel savings. Regardless of the exact figures, it is obvious that a clean air filter improves air flow to the engine and increases engine performance and gas mileage.

Title: Tobacco and Cancer | CDC (www.cdc.gov)
Content: Tobacco smoke has at least 70 chemicals that cause cancer, also known as carcinogens. Many of these chemicals can damage your DNA, which controls how your body makes new cells and directs each kind of cell to do what it is made for. Damaged DNA can make cells grow differently from how they are supposed to. These unusual cells can turn into cancer.

question_src: Je! Ni vipi baada ya ngono kuzuia maambukizo wakati urethra na uke ni shimo mbili tofauti?
all_claims: Ingawa mrija wa mkojo (urethra) na uke ni matundu mawili tofauti, yako karibu sana—sehemu yao ya nje hutenganishwa na milimita chache tu—hivyo msuguano, vidole au uume wakati wa ngono vinaweza kusukuma bakteria kutoka uke au ngozi ya karibu hadi kwenye mdomo wa urethra; baada ya hapo wanaweza kupanda hadi kwenye kibofu na kusababisha UTI [3].

Kukojoa mara tu baada ya tendo hutoa mkondo wa maji unaopitia urethra unaosaidia “kuosha” bakteria hao kabla hawajapanda juu zaidi, hatua ambayo mamlaka kama CDC hupendekeza kama kinga rahisi na salama [1].

Aidha, kama mikono au kondomu iliyogusa anus kisha ikagusa sehemu za siri, vijidudu vya utumbo vinaweza kuishia kwenye mdomo wa urethra na kukuzwa na unyevunyevu wa ngono; kukojoa hutoa shinikizo linalowatoa haraka [2].

prompt:

Title: UTIs and urinating after sexual intercourse: What is the link? (www.medicalnewstoday.com)
Content: Experts debate whether urinating after sex helps prevent UTIs.


Many health authorities, including the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), recommend urinating after sex to prevent UTIs. Doing so may help flush away bacteria that are close to the urethra and prevent them from entering the urinary tract.


However, research published in a 2016 edition of American Family Physician suggests that urinating after sex does not have any measurable protective effects. Still, the researchers note, it is a safe and reasonable thing to do.

Aidha, kama mikono au kondomu iliyogusa anus kisha ikagusa sehemu za siri, vijidudu vya utumbo vinaweza kuishia kwenye mdomo wa urethra na kukuzwa na unyevunyevu wa ngono; kukojoa hutoa shinikizo linalowatoa haraka [2].
Ingawa tafiti za 2016 zilibaini ushahidi dhaifu wa ufanisi, watafiti wanaona hakuna hatari yoyote kulifanya, na linaweza kupunguza hatari hasa kwa wanawake kutokana na umbali huo mfupi [1].

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: UTIs and urinating after sexual intercourse: What is the link? (www.medicalnewstoday.com)
Content: Experts debate whether urinating after sex helps prevent UTIs.


Many health authorities, including the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), recommend urinating after sex to prevent UTIs. Doing so may help flush away bacteria that are close to the urethra and prevent them from entering the urinary tract.


However, research published in a 2016 edition of American Family Physician suggests that urinating after sex does not have any measurable protective effects. Still, the researchers note, it is a safe and reasonable thing to do.
---

Title: UTIs and urinating after sexual intercourse: What is the link? (www.medicalnewstoday.com)
Content: Bacteria in the genital or anal region can enter the urethra during sex if a person does not wash their hands between touching the anus and genitals.

Content: During sex, bacteria can get into your urethra, the tube that carries urine out of your body. That can raise your chances of an infection. When you pee, you flush those germs out.

question_src: Wakati ninapotazama kupika inaonyesha haionyeshi chef kuosha mikono yao au kusafisha chochote, wapi mpishi huosha mikono yao mara ngapi? Je! Ni nini kuhusu visu, vyombo, nk?
all_claims: Katika studio kuna sinki maalum nje ya eneo la kamera, ambako mpishi huosha mikono yao kabla ya kurekodi na pia kila wanapohama kutoka kazi moja kwenda nyingine, lakini vipande hivi hukatwakatwa kwa sababu havionekani “kuvutia” na muda wa kipindi ni mfupi [1].

Utafiti uliochunguza vipindi vya wapishi mashuhuri uligundua kuwa ni mpishi mmoja tu (Emeril Lagasse) aliyekuwa ametaja kuosha mikono, na wote wapishi watatu waliorekodiwa walishika nyama mbichi bila kuosha mikono zao angalau mara moja, ikionyesha kuwa usafi hauonyeshwi mara nyingi hewani [2].

Vifaa vingine pia havionyeshwi kusafishwa ipasavyo: ni takriban theluthi moja tu ya wapishi walioonekana kubadilisha au kuosha bodi za kukatia baada ya kutumia nyama mbichi, na robo tu walizungumzia joto salama la nyama [2].

Kwa hiyo, ingawa wapishi wengi husafisha mikono, visu na bodi nje ya kamera, watazamaji wanapaswa kufahamu kwamba kile kinachoonekana si mwongozo wa usalama; nyumbani ni salama kuosha mikono kwa maji ya joto na sabuni kabla ya kuanza, kati ya hatu zinazo-gusa nyama mbichi, na kusafisha visu, bodi na vyombo kwa maji ya moto na sabuni kila unapobadilisha aina ya chakula.

Title: Why Don't TV Chefs Wash Their Hands? — Home Cook World (homecookworld.com)
Content: TV chefs actually wash their hands before and during filming. Since viewers have a short attention span and these scenes aren’t the most exciting part of an episode, they typically get edited out to shorten the show.


While this helps keep people like you and me engaged, it also sends the wrong season to those just getting started in home cooking, who are probably unaware of how vital kitchen hygiene is to their health.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Don't Eat Food Prepared by a Celebrity Chef on TV (gizmodo.com)
Content: Only Emeril Lagasse even mentioned washing his hands before cooking, and all but three of the chefs are shown handling meat without washing their hands at least once. Nineteen of the chefs handled completely cooked food barehanded and only a third of the chefs demonstrate safe cutting board use, that is, changing or cleaning the board after chopping raw meat. Only a quarter discussed the temperature of their meat, which is important, say the researchers, because consumers might not know the doneness of the meat they cook.
