claim: Miili ya binadamu hutegemea levers za darasa la tatu kwa wingi kwa sababu mfumo huu, ingawa una faida ndogo ya mitambo katika kushinda upinzani, huruhusu harakati kubwa na za kasi kwenye ncha za mwili bila hitaji la kusogeza misuli kwa umbali mrefu ; hivyo, kukaza kwa sentimita chache kwenye biceps husababisha mkono kusafiri umbali mkubwa na kwa mwendo wa haraka, jambo muhimu kwa kazi kama kurusha, kukimbia au kushika vitu vidogo kwa ustadi.
question_src: Kwa nini kuna watu wengi wa darasa la tatu kwenye miili yetu?
all_claims: Miili ya binadamu hutegemea levers za darasa la tatu kwa wingi kwa sababu mfumo huu, ingawa una faida ndogo ya mitambo katika kushinda upinzani, huruhusu harakati kubwa na za kasi kwenye ncha za mwili bila hitaji la kusogeza misuli kwa umbali mrefu [4]; hivyo, kukaza kwa sentimita chache kwenye biceps husababisha mkono kusafiri umbali mkubwa na kwa mwendo wa haraka, jambo muhimu kwa kazi kama kurusha, kukimbia au kushika vitu vidogo kwa ustadi.

Kwa kuwa lengo la harakati nyingi za kibinadamu si kunyanyua mizigo mizito bali kupata kasi, safu pana ya mwendo na udhibiti sahihi, mwili “umechagua” kimaumbile miundo ya darasa la tatu inayowezesha sifa hizi bila kuongeza uzito au ukubwa wa misuli.
Ndiyo maana takribani viungo vyote vikubwa—mfano kiwiko kinapopinda kwa kutumia biceps—hufanya kazi kama levers za darasa la tatu, na kufanya aina hii kuwa iliyotawala mwilini [2].
claims_retained: Miili ya binadamu hutegemea levers za darasa la tatu kwa wingi kwa sababu mfumo huu, ingawa una faida ndogo ya mitambo katika kushinda upinzani, huruhusu harakati kubwa na za kasi kwenye ncha za mwili bila hitaji la kusogeza misuli kwa umbali mrefu [4]; hivyo, kukaza kwa sentimita chache kwenye biceps husababisha mkono kusafiri umbali mkubwa na kwa mwendo wa haraka, jambo muhimu kwa kazi kama kurusha, kukimbia au kushika vitu vidogo kwa ustadi.
Ndiyo maana takribani viungo vyote vikubwa—mfano kiwiko kinapopinda kwa kutumia biceps—hufanya kazi kama levers za darasa la tatu, na kufanya aina hii kuwa iliyotawala mwilini [2].
prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Third-Class Levers in the Human Body | Science project | Education.com (www.education.com)
Content: In a third-class lever, the input force is in between the output force and the fulcrum. An example of this class of lever is a baseball bat. The handle of the bat is the fulcrum, you supply the input force near the middle, and the other end of the bat that pushes the ball with the output forces. In a third-class lever, the input force is greater than the output force but the output load is able to move farther.

[Image: Examples of Levers]

You have several third-class levers in your body. One that is easy to investigate is your forearm.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Levers work to create movement in the human body (us.humankinetics.com)
Content: Bones, ligaments, and muscles are the structures that form levers in the body to create human movement. In simple terms, a joint (where two or more bones join together) forms the axis (or fulcrum), and the muscles crossing the joint apply the force to move a weight or resistance. Levers are typically labeled as first class, second class, or third class. All three types are found in the body, but most levers in the human body are third class.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Levers work to create movement in the human body (us.humankinetics.com)
Content: There are numerous third-class levers in the human body; one example can be illustrated in the elbow joint (figure 1.23b). The joint is the axis (fulcrum). The resistance (weight) is the forearm, wrist, and hand. The force is the biceps muscle when the elbow is flexed.
---
Document ID: 4
Title: Basic Biomechanics: Levers (www.aaronswansonpt.com)
Content: ## Mechanical Advantage in Biomechanics

It may seem confusing that most of the muscles in the human body are 3rd class levers, since these levers are at a mechanical disadvantage in terms of effort versus load. However, this only holds true in terms of resistance. The opposite is true when you consider the distal lever displacement. A small arc of motion proximally at the muscle insertion will create large angular displacement and velocity distally. Since most human movement is aimed at maximizing angular displacement of a distal segment through space, the use of 3rd class levers for is very efficient.

This creates a relationship between the lever arm distance, distal angular displacement/velocity, and torque production. The shorter the lever arm of the effort force (decreased mechanical advantage), the greater angular displacement and angular velocity of the distal end of the lever for a given arc of displacement of the effort force. The larger the lever arm of the effort force (increased mechanical advantage), the increased torque production.

This lever arm and force/torque production relationship needs to be taken into consideration when assessing movement and prescribing interventions. For example, applying a 5 pound weight at the distal end of a lever during a scaption/SLR exercise creates a mechanical disadvantage for the supraspinatus/illiopsoas. This results in the muscle being overloaded in attempt to create the amount of torque necessary for the distal angular displacement.
---

claim: Hesabu muhimu (ujumuishaji) ni mojawapo ya matawi mawili makuu ya hesabu, lingine likiwa hesabu tofauti
question_src: Fafanua: hesabu muhimu
all_claims: Hesabu muhimu (ujumuishaji) ni mojawapo ya matawi mawili makuu ya hesabu, lingine likiwa hesabu tofauti [1].

Tofauti na hesabu ya kutofautisha inayopima kasi ya mabadiliko, hesabu muhimu hushughulikia jumla ya ukubwa au thamani ya kipimo, ikitoa thamani halisi ya kazi kati ya pointi mbili na hivyo kutumika kupata urefu, maeneo na kiasi [2].

Kiini chake ni kujumlisha vipande vidogo visivyo na kikomo ili kupata jumla endelevu; kielelezo maarufu ni kuhesabu eneo chini ya curve ya kazi ya kihesabu, ambalo ndilo linaloanzisha dhana ya ujumuishaji wa msingi [1].
Kutoka wazo hili mbinu hizo huendelezwa kupata maeneo ya sehemu zisizo kawaida, ujazo wa miili ya mzunguko, na hata vidokezo vya kati vya massa au msongamano [3].

Uwezo wa kubadilisha jumla hizi kuwa taarifa sahihi hufanya hesabu muhimu kuwa chombo muhimu katika fizikia na uhandisi, mahali ambako inahitajika kutathmini nishati, kazi au mtiririko katika mifumo tata [1].
claims_retained: Hesabu muhimu (ujumuishaji) ni mojawapo ya matawi mawili makuu ya hesabu, lingine likiwa hesabu tofauti [1].

Title: What Is Integral Calculus? (with pictures) (www.wise-geek.com)
Content: Integral calculus, also known as integration, is one of the two branches of calculus, with the other being differentiation. Differentiation describes how the value of a function changes with respect to its variables. Integration is the inverse, in that it gives the exact summation of a function between two values. Integral calculus provides an exact means of calculating the area under the curve of a mathematical function. Integration has a wide range of applications in physics and engineering.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Integral calculus | mathematics (www.britannica.com)
Content: Integral calculus, Branch of calculus concerned with the theory and applications of integrals. While differential calculus focuses on rates of change, such as slopes of tangent lines and velocities, integral calculus deals with total size or value, such as lengths, areas, and volumes.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Introduction to Integration (www.mathsisfun.com)
Content: Integration can be used to find areas, volumes, central points and many useful things. But it is easiest to start with finding the area between a function and the x-axis
---

Differentiation describes how the value of a function changes with respect to its variables. Integration is the inverse, in that it gives the exact summation of a function between two values. Integral calculus provides an exact means of calculating the area under the curve of a mathematical function. Integration has a wide range of applications in physics and engineering.

claim: Google Fiber ni huduma ya intaneti ya kasi kubwa inayotumia nyuzi-macho (FTTH) iliyoanzishwa na Google mwaka 2010, ikitoa hadi 1,000 Mbps na malipo ya kila mwezi bila mkataba wa muda mrefu
question_src: Je! Ni nini Google Fibre na itakua nje ya Amerika?
all_claims: Google Fiber ni huduma ya intaneti ya kasi kubwa inayotumia nyuzi-macho (FTTH) iliyoanzishwa na Google mwaka 2010, ikitoa hadi 1,000 Mbps na malipo ya kila mwezi bila mkataba wa muda mrefu [1].
Huduma hii kwa sasa inapatikana tu Marekani kwenye takriban miji 18 kama Atlanta, Austin, Denver, San Francisco na Seattle [1].
Google ilisitisha upanuzi mkubwa mwaka 2016, ikipunguza au kusitisha shughuli katika baadhi ya maeneo na kukata nafasi nyingi za kazi zinazohusiana na mradi huo [2].
Tangu hapo imeongeza mji mmoja tu—West Des Moines, Iowa—na hata huko ujenzi unatarajiwa kuchukua miaka kadhaa kukamilika [1].

Linapokuja suala la upanuzi wa kimataifa, kampuni imeeleza wazi kwamba “kwa wakati huu hatuna mipango ya kupanua Google Fiber kimataifa,” hivyo hakuna tarehe wala mpango wa kuipeleka nje ya Marekani, vikiwemo Uingereza na masoko mengine [3].
claims_retained: Google Fiber ni huduma ya intaneti ya kasi kubwa inayotumia nyuzi-macho (FTTH) iliyoanzishwa na Google mwaka 2010, ikitoa hadi 1,000 Mbps na malipo ya kila mwezi bila mkataba wa muda mrefu [1].
Huduma hii kwa sasa inapatikana tu Marekani kwenye takriban miji 18 kama Atlanta, Austin, Denver, San Francisco na Seattle [1].

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: 'What is Google Fiber?': Everything you need to know about Google's high-speed internet service (www.businessinsider.com)
Content: Google Fiber is a broadband internet service that Google is currently deploying in 18 cities across the US.
* The service is notable because of its high speed, running up to 1000 Mbps, with a friendly month-to-month, all-inclusive pricing scheme.
* Despite the initial promise of the network, Google has paused expansion of Fiber beyond its current 18 cities, and notably pulled Fiber out of several cities where it attempted to deploy the service.
* Visit Business Insider's Tech Reference library for more stories.


Google Fiber is Google's fiber optic-based broadband internet service, which debuted in 2010. It's built to deliver high-speed connectivity to businesses and individuals in select cities.


At least, that was the goal. While it once appeared that Google intended to roll out Google Fiber across the entire US, the company "paused" most of its expansion plans, adding only one new city in the last four years — they announced in July 2020 that Fiber would be coming to West Des Moines, IA, but it won't be ready for several years.


Currently, Google Fiber services are available in 18 locations across the country.


## Where Google Fiber currently operates


[Image]


You can visit the Google Fiber website to check its availability and sign up for the service. Dave Johnson/Business Insider


The service is currently operating or rolling out operations in 18 cities, including Atlanta, Georgia; Austin, Texas; Charlotte, North Carolina; Chicago, Illinois; Denver, Colorado; San Francisco, California; and Seattle, Washington.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Google Fiber Internet: Coverage & Availability Map (broadbandnow.com)
Content: Google Fiber mainly focuses on urban areas where existing fiber and city regulations make it possible to install FTTH (Fiber to the Home) rapidly. The Google Fiber project has been on hold since 2016, when the company stopped expanding and reportedly cut many jobs related to the project.
---

At this time we have no plans to expand Google Fiber internationally.


- Robert, the Google Fiber team

claim: Gerund ni nomino inayotokana na kitenzi kilichoongezewa kiambishi “-ing”, hivyo ingawa lina umbo la kitenzi hutumika kama nomino katika sentensi, kwa mfano kama kiima, kitu au kisawe
question_src: Kuuliza darasa langu, Gerund ni nini?
all_claims: Gerund ni nomino inayotokana na kitenzi kilichoongezewa kiambishi “-ing”, hivyo ingawa lina umbo la kitenzi hutumika kama nomino katika sentensi, kwa mfano kama kiima, kitu au kisawe [3].
Hakuna ubaguzi kwa kanuni hii; kila gerund lazima limalizike kwa “-ing” [1].
Mfano “running” katika “I love running” (au “Ninapenda kukimbia”) linataja shughuli ya kukimbia, ilhali “run” katika “I run every day” ni kitenzi linaloonyesha kitendo kinachofanyika [3].
Kifungu cha gerund (gerund phrase) kinaweza kuwa na gerund pamoja na virekebishi, kivumishi au viambatanishi vingine, na karibu kamwe hakihitaji alama za koma [2].
Kwa njia hii, gerund huruhusu hatua au shughuli kuongelewa kama kitu, kama inavyoonekana kwenye sentensi kama “Swimming is fun” au “Reading improves knowledge.”.
claims_retained: Gerund ni nomino inayotokana na kitenzi kilichoongezewa kiambishi “-ing”, hivyo ingawa lina umbo la kitenzi hutumika kama nomino katika sentensi, kwa mfano kama kiima, kitu au kisawe [3].
Mfano “running” katika “I love running” (au “Ninapenda kukimbia”) linataja shughuli ya kukimbia, ilhali “run” katika “I run every day” ni kitenzi linaloonyesha kitendo kinachofanyika [3].

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: What is a Gerund? Definition, Examples & Exercises (www.gingersoftware.com)
Content: Gerunds are words that are formed with verbs but act as nouns. They’re very easy to spot, since every gerund is a verb with ing tacked to its tail. There are no exceptions to this rule.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Gerunds // Purdue Writing Lab (owl.purdue.edu)
Content: . A gerund is a verbal ending in -ing that is used as a noun.
2. A gerund phrase consists of a gerund plus modifier(s), object(s), and/or complement(s).
3. Gerunds and gerund phrases virtually never require punctuation
---
Document ID: 3
Title: What is a Gerund? Definition, Examples of Gerunds (writingexplained.org)
Content: Gerund definition: A gerund is a noun formed from a verb. A gerund will always contain the ending “-ing.”


What are gerunds? Any verb ending in “-ing” and used as a noun is a gerund.


Examples of Gerunds:


Verb/Gerund


* to run/running
* I run every day. / I like running.


In the first sentence, “run” is used as a verb. I am “doing” the action “to run.” In the second sentence, “running” is used as a gerund (noun) and “like” is the verb.


* to sing/singing
* Sara sings. Singing makes Sara happy.


In the first sentence, “sings” is used as a verb. Sara is “doing” the action “to sing.” In the second sentence, “singing” is used as a gerund and “makes” is the verb.


Note: A gerund will always be used as a noun and does not replace the progressive form of the verb.
---

question_src: Je! Ni kwanini nchi kama Iran na Saudi Arabia zinaonekana kuwa hazina wasiwasi (au vinginevyo hazina wasiwasi sana) na kushuka kwa bei ya hivi karibuni kwa bei ya mafuta, lakini uchumi wa Venezuela haraka unakuwa moja mbaya zaidi ulimwenguni, kwa sababu ya kushuka kwa mafuta?
all_claims: Venezuela inategemea sana mafuta, kwani zaidi ya 90 % ya mapato yake ya usafirishaji hutoka kwenye sekta hii, hivyo mapato yanatarajiwa kushuka hadi chini ya dola bilioni 8 mwaka 2020 kutoka bilioni 25 mwaka 2019, jambo linalokata nusu ya fedha za serikali na kuufanya uchumi ulegee haraka pindi bei zinapodidimia [2]; hali hii inazidishwa na vikwazo vya Marekani, kuporomoka kwa sarafu na janga la COVID-19 [1].

Kinyume chake, Saudi Arabia ina akiba kubwa na gharama za chini za uchimbaji, na inatarajia kuongeza uzalishaji hadi mapipa milioni 10 kwa siku mwishoni mwa 2021 ili kunufaika na mahitaji yanayorejea, hatua inayochochea utabiri wa ukuaji wa Pato la Taifa kwa 4.5 % mwaka 2021 [3].

Mashariki ya Kati kwa jumla, ikiwemo Iran na Saudi Arabia, inashikilia takriban 48 % ya akiba ya mafuta yasiyosafishwa duniani na 27 % ya uzalishaji wa sasa wa kimataifa, hivyo ina uwezo mkubwa wa kuongeza au kupunguza uzalishaji na kupata mapato hata bei zikishuka [5].
Uwezo huu wa kuzalisha kwa wingi na akiba ya fedha za kigeni hufanya nchi hizi ziwe na mshtuko mdogo wa bei ikilinganishwa na Venezuela, ambayo haina rasilimali mbadala wala hifadhi za fedha.
claims_retained: Venezuela inategemea sana mafuta, kwani zaidi ya 90 % ya mapato yake ya usafirishaji hutoka kwenye sekta hii, hivyo mapato yanatarajiwa kushuka hadi chini ya dola bilioni 8 mwaka 2020 kutoka bilioni 25 mwaka 2019, jambo linalokata nusu ya fedha za serikali na kuufanya uchumi ulegee haraka pindi bei zinapodidimia [2]; hali hii inazidishwa na vikwazo vya Marekani, kuporomoka kwa sarafu na janga la COVID-19 [1].

Venezuela inategemea sana mafuta, kwani zaidi ya 90 % ya mapato yake ya usafirishaji hutoka kwenye sekta hii, hivyo mapato yanatarajiwa kushuka hadi chini ya dola bilioni 8 mwaka 2020 kutoka bilioni 25 mwaka 2019, jambo linalokata nusu ya fedha za serikali na kuufanya uchumi ulegee haraka pindi bei zinapodidimia [2]; hali hii inazidishwa na vikwazo vya Marekani, kuporomoka kwa sarafu na janga la COVID-19 [1].

Title: Venezuela's financial crisis exacerbated by oil price war, coronavirus (www.reuters.com)
Content: A price war between world oil producers has slashed Venezuela’s revenue for its top export and exacerbated the country’s financial crisis as it also faces the coronavirus pandemic, U.S. sanctions and sliding crude output.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Venezuela's financial crisis exacerbated by oil price war, coronavirus (www.reuters.com)
Content: More than 90% of Venezuela’s export revenue comes from oil. The country risks generating less than $8 billion this year, a third of $25 billion in 2019, according to Caracas-based economic consultancy Ecoanalitica. Two other local consultants also projected the government will have less than half the funds it managed last year.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Saudi Arabia To Boost Oil Production To 10 Million Bpd As Prices Rise (oilprice.com)
Content: Saudi Arabia is expected to hike its crude oil production to 10 million barrels per day (bpd) by the end of 2021, up by 1.5 million bpd from May, due to rising global oil demand, Goldman Sachs said on Tuesday.
---
Document ID: 4
Title: Saudi Arabia To Boost Oil Production To 10 Million Bpd As Prices Rise (oilprice.com)
Content: The global demand rebound and the strong domestic recovery in oil demand also prompted Goldman to raise its economic growth projections of Saudi Arabia. The U.S. investment bank now sees the Saudi economy rising by 4.5 percent in 2021, compared to an earlier forecast of 2.5 percent growth.
---
Document ID: 5
Title: Why Does the Middle East Have So Much Oil? - FossilFuel.com (fossilfuel.com)
Content: The oil-rich nations in the Middle East, including Saudi Arabia, Iran, Iraq, Kuwait, Syria, Qatar, Bahrain, the United Arab Emirates (UAE), Yemen, and Oman, account for about 3.4 percent of the world’s total land surface. However, these countries contain around 38 percent of the world’s total natural gas reserves and 48 percent of the total known reserves of crude oil (Sorkhabi, 2010). When people think about the Middle East, they think about oil. According to 2020 data from the U.S. Energy Information Administration, around 27 percent of the world’s current oil production is sourced from this region. For as long as fossil fuels have been a primary source of global energy, the Middle East has been one of the world’s foremost oil and gas suppliers. Because of the region’s ability to produce and sell massive quantities of oil and gas, economic development in the Middle East has largely been fueled by the fossil fuel industry.
